voca.means_en: many / a lot of / lots of
If you abbreviate something, especially a word or a piece of writing, you make it shorter.
An abbreviation is a short form of a word or phrase, made by leaving out some of the letters or by using only the first letter of each word.\nWhat's the abbreviation for 'Saint'?
Your abdomen is the part of your body below your chest where your stomach and intestines are.
The abductor did not demand a ransom.\nShe says the artist's impression is an excellent likeness of her abductor.
Aberrant means unusual and not socially acceptable.
If one person abets another, they help or encourage them to do something criminal or wrong. Abet is often used in the legal expression `aid and abet'.

voca.means_ko: [어빌러디]\n능력, 힘, 재능, 기량, 수완, 솜씨, 역량
voca.means_en: Your ability to do something is the fact that you can do it.\nYour ability is the quality or skill that you have which makes it possible for you to do something\nIf you do something to the best of your abilities or to the best of your ability, you do it as well as you can.

If you are able to do something, you have skills or qualities which make it possible for you to do it.
If you are able to do something, you have enough freedom, power, time, or money to do it.
Someone who is able is very clever or very good at doing something.
Someone or something that is abnormal is unusual, especially in a way that is worrying.\n
Aborigines are members of the tribes that were living in Australia when Europeans arrived there.\n
If an unborn baby is aborted, the pregnancy is ended deliberately and the baby is not born alive.\nIf someone aborts a process, plan, or activity, they stop it before it has been completed.\n
If a woman has an abortion, she ends her pregnancy deliberately so that the baby is not born alive.\nWhat are your views on abortion? / We'd like to know what you feel about abortion.\n
An abortive attempt or action is unsuccessful.\n

If things abound, or if a place abounds with things, there are very large numbers of them.
Events Abound for the Lunar New Year!
Theories abound about how the earth began.

voca.means_ko:
[어바웃t]
약, ~쯤, ~ 경, 거의,
~에 대한(무엇의 주제나 연관성을 나타냄)
~에 관한, ~와 관련된
voca.means_en:
around / round / about
You use about to introduce who or what something relates to or concerns.
When you mention the things that an activity or institution is about, you are saying what it involves or what its aims are.
You use about after some adjectives to indicate the person or thing that a feeling or state of mind relates to.
If you do something about a problem, you take action in order to solve it.

voca.means_ko:
[어붜-v]
(위치나 지위면에서) ~보다 위에/위로
(나이, 수 등이) ~보다 많은, ~을 넘는
(중요도, 품질 등이) ~보다 위인, ~보다 우위인
위로/위에, ~ 이상으로, ~을 넘어
voca.means_en:
above / over
If one thing is above another one, it is directly over it or higher than it.
If an amount or measurement is above a particular level, it is greater than that level.
If you hear one sound above another, it is louder or clearer than the second one.
If someone is above you, they are in a higher social position than you or in a position of authority over you.
If you say that someone thinks they are above something, you mean that they act as if they are too good or important for it.
If you go abroad, you go to a foreign country, usually one which is separated from the country where you live by an ocean or a sea.\n
Someone's absence from a place is the fact that they are not there.\nThe absence of something from a place is the fact that it is not there or does not exist.\n

If someone or something is absent from a place or situation where they should be or where they usually are, they are not there.
If someone appears absent, they are not paying attention because they are thinking about something else.
An absent parent does not live with his or her children.
If you say that absent one thing, another thing will happen, you mean that if the first thing does not happen, the second thing will happen.

An absentee is a person who is expected to be in a particular place but who is not there.
Absentee is used to describe someone who is not there to do a particular job in person.
In elections in the United States, if you vote by absentee ballot or if you are an absentee voter, you vote in advance because you will be away.

voca.means_ko:
[엡썰룻t]
완전한, 완벽한, 확실한, 확고한
절대적인, 완전한, 완벽한, 가장 ~한,
제한이 없는, 절대적인
voca.means_en:
Absolute means total and complete.
You use absolute to emphasize something that you are saying.
An absolute ruler has complete power and authority over his or her country.
Absolute is used to say that something is definite and will not change even if circumstances change.
An amount that is expressed in absolute terms is expressed as a fixed amount rather than referring to variable factors such as what you earn or the effects of inflation.
An absolute is a rule or principle that is believed to be true, right, or relevant in all situations.

voca.means_ko:
[엡설룻리]
전적으로, 틀림없이(사실임을 강조함)
전혀(부정의 의미를 강조함)
극도로, 굉장히, 
절대적으로, 완전히, 전혀
그럼, 물론이지(강한 동의, 허락을 나타냄)
voca.means_en: Absolutely means totally and completely.\nSome people say absolutely as an emphatic way of saying yes or of agreeing with someone. They say absolutely not as an emphatic way of saying no or of disagreeing with someone.\n

voca.means_ko:
[업죠r-b]
(액체, 가스 등을) 흡수하다, 빨아들이다, 
(정보를) 받아들이다,
(돈이나 시간을) 차지하다/잡아먹다
voca.means_en:
If something absorbs a liquid, gas, or other substance, it soaks it up or takes it in.
If something absorbs light, heat, or another form of energy, it takes it in.
If a group is absorbed into a larger group, it becomes part of the larger group.
If something absorbs a force or shock, it reduces its effect.
The roots absorb water and minerals for the plants.
Plants absorb carbon from the atmosphere.

An abstract idea or way of thinking is based on general ideas rather than on real things and events.
In grammar, an abstract noun refers to a quality or idea rather than to a physical object.
Abstract art makes use of shapes and patterns rather than showing people or things.
Don't most people think philosophy is too abstract for them?
I read the abstract at the meeting.
This is the abstract of the presentation.

voca.means_ko:
[엡st뤡션]
추상 관념, 개념, 비실제적 관념
~에만 마음이 쏠려 있음, 정신이 딴데 팔려 있음
추출
voca.means_en: An abstraction is a general idea rather than one relating to a particular object, person, or situation.\n

An abundance of something is a large quantity of it.
North America is a land of abundance.
An abundance of instances is cited.

Something that is abundant is present in large quantities.
Inside, I feel peaceful and abundant.
I have abundant reason to believe it.
This country is abundant in natural resources.

voca.means_ko:
[업뷰-s]
남용, 오용, 학대, 욕설
(건강이 상하도록 무엇을) 남용/오용하다
(특히 성적으로) 학대하다
욕을하다
voca.means_en:
Abuse of someone is cruel and violent treatment of them.
Abuse is extremely rude and insulting things that people say when they are angry.
Abuse of something is the use of it in a wrong way or for a bad purpose.
If someone is abused, they are treated cruelly and violently.
You can say that someone is abused if extremely rude and insulting things are said to them.
An abyss is a very deep hole in the ground.\nIf someone is on the edge or brink of an abyss, they are about to enter into a very frightening or threatening situation.\n

Academic is used to describe things that relate to the work done in schools, colleges, and universities, especially work which involves studying and reasoning rather than practical or technical skills.
Academic is used to describe things that relate to schools, colleges, and universities.
Academic is used to describe work, or a school, college, or university, that places emphasis on studying and reasoning rather than on practical or technical skills.
Someone who is academic is good at studying.
You can say that a discussion or situation is academic if you think it is not important because it has no real effect or cannot happen.
An academic is a member of a university or college who teaches or does research.

Academy is sometimes used in the names of schools and colleges, especially those specializing in particular subjects or skills, or private high schools in the United States.\nAcademy appears in the names of some societies formed to improve or maintain standards in a particular field.\n
If the process or rate of something accelerates or if something accelerates it, it gets faster and faster.\nWhen a moving vehicle accelerates, it goes faster and faster.\n

voca.means_ko: [엑센t]\n~에 악센트를 두다, ~을 강조하다\n강세, 음조, 어조, 말투, 사투리
voca.means_en:
Someone who speaks with a particular accent pronounces the words of a language in a distinctive way that shows which country, region, or social class they come from.
An accent is a short line or other mark which is written above certain letters in some languages and which indicates the way those letters are pronounced.
If you put the accent on a particular feature of something, you emphasize it or give it special importance.

If you accept something that you have been offered, you say yes to it or agree to take it.
If you accept an idea, statement, or fact, you believe that it is true or valid.
If you accept a plan or an intended action, you agree to it and allow it to happen.
If you accept an unpleasant fact or situation, you get used to it or recognize that it is necessary or cannot be changed.
If a person, company, or organization accepts something such as a document, they recognize that it is genuine, correct, or satisfactory and agree to consider it or handle it.

Acceptable activities and situations are those that most people approve of or consider to be normal.
If something is acceptable to someone, they agree to consider it, use it, or allow it to happen.
If you describe something as acceptable, you mean that it is good enough or fairly good.

voca.means_ko: [엑셉던s]\n(선물, 제의 등을) 받아들임/수락\n동의, 승인, 가입 허가, 수용 절차
voca.means_en:
Acceptance of an offer or a proposal is the act of saying yes to it or agreeing to it.
If there is acceptance of an idea, most people believe or agree that it is true.
Your acceptance of a situation, especially an unpleasant or difficult one, is an attitude or feeling that you cannot change it and that you must get used to it.
Acceptance of someone into a group means beginning to think of them as part of the group and to act in a friendly way towards them.

voca.means_ko: [엑쎄s]\n(장소로의) 접근, 이용, 접속, 출입\n~을 입수/이용하다, ~에 접근하다
voca.means_en:
If you have access to a building or other place, you are able or allowed to go into it.
If you have access to something such as information or equipment, you have the opportunity or right to see it or use it.
If you have access to a person, you have the opportunity or right to see them or meet them.
If you access something, especially information held on a computer, you succeed in finding or obtaining it.

If a place or building is accessible to people, it is easy for them to reach it or get into it. If an object is accessible, it is easy to reach.
If something is accessible to people, they can easily use it or obtain it.
If you describe a book, painting, or other work of art as accessible, you think it is good because it is simple enough for people to understand and appreciate easily.

Accessories are items of equipment that are not usually essential, but which can be used with or added to something else in order to make it more efficient, useful, or decorative.
Accessories are articles such as belts and scarves which you wear or carry but which are not part of your main clothing.
If someone is guilty of being an accessory to a crime, they helped the person who committed it, or knew it was being committed but did not tell the police.

luck / chance / coincidence / accident / fortune / fate / destiny / providence
An accident happens when a vehicle hits a person, an object, or another vehicle, causing injury or damage.
If someone has an accident, something unpleasant happens to them that was not intended, sometimes causing injury or death.
If something happens by accident, it happens completely by chance.
An accidental event happens by chance or as the result of an accident, and is not deliberately intended.\n

If you accomplish something, you succeed in doing it.
She accomplished her mission for the lifting of a finger.
She has accomplished much in her short career. / I don't know what they accomplished.

voca.means_ko: [어컴플뤼쉬d]\n기량이 뛰어난, 재주가 많은, \n성취된, 수달된, 노련한, 잘 훈련된
voca.means_en: If someone is accomplished at something, they are very good at it.\nShe was an elegant and accomplished woman.\n

voca.means_ko: [어코r-d]\n(기관, 국가 간의 공식적인) 합의\n(권위, 지위 등을) 부여하다, 부합하다
voca.means_en:
An accord between countries or groups of people is a formal agreement, for example to end a war.
If you are accorded a particular kind of treatment, people act towards you or treat you in that way.
If one fact, idea, or condition accords with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them.
If one person, action, or fact is in accord with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them. You can also say that two people or things are in accord.

in proportion; in relation
on the report (of); as stated (by)
in conformity (with); in accordance (with)
depending (on whether)
dependent on

voca.means_ko: [어코r-딍뤼]\n그에 따라, 따라서, 적절히, 부응해서, 그에 맞춰\n그런 이유로, 그래서
voca.means_en: You use accordingly to introduce a fact or situation which is a result or consequence of something that you have just referred to.\nIf you consider a situation and then act accordingly, the way you act depends on the nature of the situation.\n

voca.means_ko: [어카운t]\n설명하다, 책임을 지다, 생각/간주하다, 여기다\n계좌, 장부, 회계, 기사, 보고
voca.means_en:
bill / statement / account / invoice / tab / check
If you have an account with a bank or a similar organization, you have an arrangement to leave your money there and take some out when you need it.
In business, a regular customer of a company can be referred to as an account, especially when the customer is another company.
Accounts are detailed records of all the money that a person or business receives and spends.
An account is a written or spoken report of something that has happened.
f you say that something is true by all accounts or from all accounts, you believe it is true because other people say so.
I will account for the incident.
I need a joint checking account for my husband and me.

to explain how or why something happened; to be the explanation for something
to be a particular part of something; to be a particular amount
to keep a record of how the money in your care will be spent or has been spent
to consider particular facts or circumstances when you are making a decision about something, especially when you are calculating the cost of something

An accountant is a person whose job is to keep financial accounts.
What time is the accountant coming?
If you need an accountant, my brother could help you out.

Accounting is the activity of keeping detailed records of the amounts of money a business or person receives and spends.
In the meantime, use the one in the Accounting Department.
My major was marketing, and my minor, accounting.
collect / gather / accumulate / run sth up / amass\nWhen you accumulate things or when they accumulate, they collect or are gathered over a period of time.\n

The accuracy of information or measurements is their quality of being true or correct, even in small details.
If someone or something performs a task, for example hitting a target, with accuracy, they do it in an exact way without making a mistake.
That typist does not come up to our standards of accuracy.
The accuracy of what he says is not to be questioned.
At this point, we are one hundred percent accuracy.

true / right / correct / exact / precise / accurate / spot on
Accurate information, measurements, and statistics are correct to a very detailed level. An accurate instrument is able to give you information of this kind.
An accurate statement or account gives a true or fair judgment of something.
You can use accurate to describe the results of someone's actions when they do or copy something correctly or exactly.
An accurate weapon or throw reaches the exact point or target that it was intended to reach. You can also describe a person as accurate if they fire a weapon or throw something in this way.

If you make an accusation against someone, you criticize them or express the belief that they have done something wrong.
An accusation is a statement or claim by a witness or someone in authority that a particular person has committed a crime, although this has not yet been proved.
You can bring an accusation against that man. / There was a hint of accusation in her voice.

If you accuse someone of doing something wrong or dishonest, you say or tell them that you believe that they did it.
If you are accused of a crime, a witness or someone in authority states or claims that you did it, and you may be formally charged with it and put on trial.
I don't want to accuse them. / I didn't accuse him of anything.

If you accustom yourself or another person to something, you make yourself or them become used to it.\nShe did not accustom herself to her surroundings. / It will do you good to accustom yourself to a regular life.\n

voca.means_ko: [어커s덤d]\n익숙한, 적응된, 습관이 된, 늘 하는\n평상시의, 늘 하는
voca.means_en:
If you are accustomed to something, you know it so well or have experienced it so often that it seems natural, unsurprising, or easy to deal with.
When your eyes become accustomed to darkness or bright light, they adjust so that you start to be able to see things, after not being able to see properly at first.
You can use accustomed to describe an action that someone usually does, a quality that they usually show, or an object that they usually use.

voca.means_ko:
[에익k]
(계속 무지근히) 아프다, 못 견디다
(~하고 싶어) 못 견디다
(계속 적인) 아품, 쑤심
voca.means_en:
hurt / ache / burn / sting / tingle / throb
If you ache or a part of your body aches, you feel a steady, fairly strong pain.
If you ache for something or your heart aches, you want something very much, and feel very unhappy because you cannot have it.
An ache is a steady, fairly strong pain in a part of your body.
to have a strong desire for somebody/something or to do something\n

If you achieve a particular aim or effect, you succeed in doing it or causing it to happen, usually after a lot of effort.
There's no easy way to achieve one's aim.
We have achieved what we intended to achieve.

bitter / pungent / sour / acrid / sharp / acid
An acid is a chemical substance, usually a liquid, which contains hydrogen and can react with other substances to form salts. Some acids burn or dissolve other substances that they come into contact with.
An acid substance contains acid.

voca.means_ko:
[엑k놀릐쥐]
~을 (사실로) 인정하다, ~에 동의하다
(호의, 칭찬등에) 감사하다, 감사의 뜻을 표하다
(서신·선물 등을) 받았음을 알리다
voca.means_en:
admit / acknowledge / concede / confess / allow / grant
If you acknowledge a fact or a situation, you accept or admit that it is true or that it exists.
If someone's achievements, status, or qualities are acknowledged, they are known about and recognized by a lot of people, or by a particular group of people.
If you acknowledge a message or letter, you write to the person who sent it in order to say that you have received it.
If you acknowledge someone, for example by moving your head or smiling, you show that you have seen and recognized them.

The acme of something is its highest point of achievement or excellence.
His work is considered the acme of cinematic art.
His success in this role marked his acme as an actor.

An acoustic guitar or other instrument is one whose sound is produced without any electrical equipment.
Acoustic means relating to sound or hearing. Compare aural.
If you refer to the acoustics or the acoustic of a space, you are referring to the structural features which determine how well you can hear music or speech in it.
Acoustics is the scientific study of sound.
He needs to use an acoustic instrument. / The acoustic guitar is quieter than other instruments.

An acquaintance is someone who you have met and know slightly, but not well.
If you have an acquaintance with someone, you have met them and you know them.
Your acquaintance with a subject is your knowledge or experience of it.

If you acquire something, you buy or obtain it for yourself, or someone gives it to you.
If you acquire something such as a skill or a habit, you learn it, or develop it through your daily life or experience.
Work hard while you're young and acquire a competence.
Children acquire a foreign language rapidly.
An acrobatic movement or display involves difficult physical acts such as jumping and balancing, especially in a circus.\n

An acronym is a word composed of the first letters of the words in a phrase, especially when this is used as a name. An example of an acronym is NATO which is made up of the first letters of the `North Atlantic Treaty Organization'.
The Rising SUV. SUV is an acronym for sport-utility vehicle.
The word "acronym" was coined for curtailing words.

If someone or something goes across a place or a boundary, they go from one side of it to the other.
If something is situated or stretched across something else, it is situated or stretched from one side of it to the other.
If something is lying across an object or place, it is resting on it and partly covering it.
If you look across at a place, person, or thing, you look towards them.
Across is used in measurements to show the width of something.

voca.means_ko: [액t]\n행동, 법률, (연극) 막\n행동하다, 적용하다, ~처럼 행동하다, 가장하다, 연기하다
voca.means_en:
action / move / act / gesture / deed / feat
When you act, you do something for a particular purpose.
If you act on advice or information, you do what has been advised or suggested.
If someone acts in a particular way, they behave in that way.
If someone or something acts as a particular thing, they have that role or function.
An act is a single thing that someone does.
If you say that someone's behaviour is an act, you mean that it does not express their real feelings.

voca.means_ko: 고장나다, 제멋대로 행동하다, 까불다\n(사람이) 말은 안듣다\n(바다, 강이) 사나워지다, (병이) 재발하다
voca.means_en: to make somebody annoyed by behaving badly, trying to get attention, etc.\nif a machine or part of the body acts up, it does not work as it should\n

voca.means_ko: [액션]\n활동, 행동, 효과, 작용, 영향,\n소송, 법적 조치,
voca.means_en:
action / move / act / gesture / deed / feat
Action is doing something for a particular purpose.
An action is something that you do on a particular occasion.
To bring a legal action against someone means to bring a case against them in a court of law.
The action is all the important and exciting things that are happening in a situation.
An action movie is a film in which a lot of dangerous and exciting things happen. An action hero is the main character in one of these films.

Someone who is active moves around a lot or does a lot of things.
If you have an active mind or imagination, you are always thinking of new things.
If someone is active in an organization, cause, or campaign, they do things for it rather than just giving it their support.
If you say that a person or animal is active in a particular place or at a particular time, you mean that they are performing their usual activities or performing a particular activity.

voca.means_ko: [액티뷔디]\n(활발한) 움직임, 활기, \n(취미나 특별한 목적을 위한) 활동, 행동
voca.means_en:
Activity is a situation in which a lot of things are happening or being done.
An activity is something that you spend time doing.
The activities of a group are the things that they do in order to achieve their aims.

You use actually to indicate that a situation exists or happened, or to emphasize that it is true.
You use actually when you are correcting or contradicting someone.
You can use actually when you are politely expressing an opinion that other people might not have expected from you.
You use actually to introduce a new topic into a conversation.

Acupuncture is the treatment of a person's illness or pain by sticking small needles into their body at certain places.
Acupuncture appears to be effective in relieving pain.
Dr. George Lewith has studied acupuncture for 25 years.

voca.means_ko:
[어큐웃t]
극심한,  심각한, 절실한
(질병이) 급성의
(관찰력, 이해력 등이) 예리한,
(각도가) 예각인
voca.means_en:
You can use acute to indicate that an undesirable situation or feeling is very severe or intense.
An acute illness is one that becomes severe very quickly but does not last very long. Compare chronic.
If a person's or animal's sight, hearing, or sense of smell is acute, it is sensitive and powerful.
An acute angle is less than 90. Compare obtuse angle.
I need the help of an acute man such as you. / There is an acute shortage of water.

voca.means_ko:
[어답t]
(새로운 용도, 상황에) 맞추다, 조정하다, 
(상황에) 적응하다, ~을 적응시키다, 
변경하다, 각색하다
voca.means_en:
If you adapt to a new situation or adapt yourself to it, you change your ideas or behaviour in order to deal with it successfully.
If you adapt something, you change it to make it suitable for a new purpose or situation.
If you adapt a book or play, you change it so that it can be made into a film or a television programme.
I don't know if I can adapt to the pressure. / I don't know how to adapt this.
You have to adapt yourself to your new circumstances.

An adaptation of a book or play is a film or a television programme that is based on it.\nAdaptation is the act of changing something or changing your behaviour to make it suitable for a new purpose or situation.\n
Adaptive means having the ability or tendency to adapt to different situations.\nBut the Taliban is fairly adaptive.\n

voca.means_ko:
[에d]
더하다, 추가하다, 첨가하다, 덧붙이다
(수, 양을) 합하다, 더하다
(말을) 덧붙이다
voca.means_en:
If you add one thing to another, you put it in or on the other thing, to increase, complete, or improve it.
If you add numbers or amounts together, you calculate their total.
If one thing adds to another, it makes the other thing greater in degree or amount.
To add a particular quality to something means to cause it to have that quality.
If you add something when you are speaking, you say something more.
to include something with something else; to put something into something else or between two things\n
to increase the size, amount, number, etc. of something\n
to increase the size, amount, number, etc. of something\n

If you are allowed something, you are given permission to have it or are given it.
If you allow something to happen, you do not prevent it.
If one thing allows another thing to happen, the first thing creates the opportunity for the second thing to happen.
If you allow a particular length of time or a particular amount of something for a particular purpose, you include it in your planning.
If you allow that something is true, you admit or agree that it is true.
Some people use Allow me to... as a way of introducing something that they want to say or do.

to mention somebody/something indirectly or in a few words\n

A country's ally is another country that has an agreement to support it, especially in war.
The Allies were the armed forces that fought against Germany and Japan in the Second World War.
If you describe someone as your ally, you mean that they help and support you, especially when other people are opposing you.
If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them.
I will have a mighty ally. / The politician tried to make an ally of the people.
almost / nearly / practically\nYou use almost to indicate that something is not completely the case but is nearly the case.\n

voca.means_en:
alone / lonely / lone
When you are alone, you are not with any other people.
If one person is alone with another person, or if two or more people are alone, they are together, without anyone else present.
If you say that you are alone or feel alone, you mean that nobody who is with you, or nobody at all, cares about you.
If someone is alone in doing something, they are the only person doing it, and so are different from other people.
You say that one person or thing alone does something when you are emphasizing that only one person or thing is involved.
If you say that one person or thing alone is responsible for part of an amount, you are emphasizing the size of that part and the size of the total amount.

voca.means_en:
If you move or look along something such as a road, you move or look towards one end of it.
If something is situated along a road, river, or corridor, it is situated in it or beside it.
You use along with to mention someone or something else that is also involved in an action or situation.
When someone or something moves along, they keep moving in a particular direction.
If you say that something is going along in a particular way, you mean that it is progressing in that way.
They walked slowly along the road. / Houses had been built along both sides of the river.
We're going for a swim. Why don't you come along?
The elk, reindeer, rhino, and bison moved along with them at a distance.\n

If one thing is alongside another thing, the first thing is next to the second.
If you work alongside other people, you all work together in the same place.
A police car pulled up alongside us.
Soon the rowboat pulled alongside the ship.

voca.means_en:
loud / loudly / aloud
When you say something, read, or laugh aloud, you speak or laugh so that other people can hear you.
If you think aloud, you express your thoughts as they occur to you, rather than thinking first and then speaking.
An alphabet is a set of letters usually presented in a fixed order which is used for writing the words of a particular language or group of languages.\n

already / just / yet\nYou use already to show that a situation exists at this present moment or that it exists at an earlier time than expected. You use already after the verb `be' or an auxiliary verb, or before a verb if there is no auxiliary. When you want add emphasis, you can put already at the beginning of a sentence.\n

also / as well / too
You can use also to give more information about a person or thing, or to add another relevant fact.
You can use also to indicate that something you have just said about one person or thing is true of another person or thing.

An alteration is a change in or to something.
The house needed extensive alteration when we moved in.
Faulty clothing alteration makes me upset.

voca.means_en:
option / choice / alternative / possibility
If one thing is an alternative to another, the first can be found, used, or done instead of the second.
An alternative plan or offer is different from the one that you already have, and can be done or used instead.
Alternative is used to describe something that is different from the usual things of its kind, or the usual ways of doing something, in modern Western society. For example, an alternative lifestyle does not follow conventional ways of living and working.
The alternative to submission is death.
For some Asia countries, one alternative is nuclear power
You use alternatively to introduce a suggestion or to mention something different to what has just been stated.\nAlternatively, an all-inclusive package might be a good idea.\n

although / even though / though
You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which contains a statement which contrasts with the statement in the main clause.
You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which contains a statement which makes the main clause of the sentence seem surprising or unexpected.
You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which gives some information that is relevant to the main clause but modifies the strength of that statement.
You use although when admitting a fact about something which you regard as less important than a contrasting fact.

voca.means_en:
If you always do something, you do it whenever a particular situation occurs. If you always did something, you did it whenever a particular situation occurred.
If something is always the case, was always the case, or will always be the case, it is, was, or will be the case all the time, continuously.
If you say that something is always happening, especially something which annoys you, you mean that it happens repeatedly.
You use always in expressions such as can always or could always when you are making suggestions or suggesting an alternative approach or method.
You can say that someone always was, for example, awkward or lucky to indicate that you are not surprised about what they are doing or have just done.
collect / gather / accumulate / run sth up / amass\nIf you amass something such as money or information, you gradually get a lot of it.\n
An amateur is someone who does something as a hobby and not as a job.\nAmateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job.\n
surprise / startle / amaze / stun / astonish / take sb aback / astound\nIf something amazes you, it surprises you very much.\n
Amazement is the feeling you have when something surprises you very much.\n
You say that something is amazing when it is very surprising and makes you feel pleasure, approval, or wonder.\n
An ambassador is an important official who lives in a foreign country and represents his or her own country's interests there.\n

If you say that there is ambiguity in something, you mean that it is unclear or confusing, or it can be understood in more than one way.\nPython uses a few names as special built - in words that it  reserves  for special use to prevent ambiguity\n
If you have an ambition to do or achieve something, you want very much to do it or achieve it.\nAmbition is the desire to be successful, rich, or powerful.\n
Someone who is ambitious has a strong desire to be successful, rich, or powerful.\nAn ambitious idea or plan is on a large scale and needs a lot of work to be carried out successfully.\n
An ambulance is a vehicle for taking people to and from hospital.\n

If a group of people ambush their enemies, they attack them after hiding and waiting for them.
An ambush is an attack on someone by people who have been hiding and waiting for them.
If someone is lying in ambush, they are hiding and waiting for someone, usually to attack them.

If you amend something that has been written such as a law, or something that is said, you change it in order to improve it or make it more accurate.\nIf you make amends when you have harmed someone, you show that you are sorry by doing something to please them.\n
recompense or compensation given or gained for some injury, insult, etc\n

Someone or something that is situated or moving among a group of things or people is surrounded by them.
If you are among people of a particular kind, you are with them and having contact with them.
If someone or something is among a group, they are a member of that group and share its characteristics.
If you want to focus on something that is happening within a particular group of people, you can say that it is happening among that group.
If something happens among a group of people, it happens within the whole of that group or between the members of that group.
If something such as a feeling, opinion, or situation exists among a group of people, most of them have it or experience it.
I had to choose only one person among those people.

to be equal to or the same as something
if you say that somebody/something doesn't amount to much, you mean that he/she/it is not very important

To amputate someone's arm or leg means to cut all or part of it off in an operation because it is diseased or badly damaged.\n

entertainment / fun / recreation / relaxation / play / pleasure / amusement
Amusement is the feeling that you have when you think that something is funny or amusing.
Amusement is the pleasure that you get from being entertained or from doing something interesting.
Amusements are ways of passing the time pleasantly.
Amusements are games, rides, and other things that you can enjoy, for example at a fairground or at the seaside.

If you make or draw an analogy between two things, you show that they are similar in some way.
I do not understand your analogy.
She has some analogy to that actress.

Anatomy is the study of the structure of the bodies of people or animals.
You can refer to your body as your anatomy.
An animal's anatomy is the structure of its body.

Your ancestors are the people from whom you are descended.
An ancestor of something modern is an earlier thing from which it developed.
Their caves were filled with the bones of their ancestors.

voca.means_en:
An anchor is a heavy hooked object that is dropped from a boat into the water at the end of a chain in order to make the boat stay in one place.
The anchor on a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it.
When a boat anchors or when you anchor it, its anchor is dropped into the water in order to make it stay in one place.
If you anchor an object somewhere, you fix it to something to prevent it moving from that place.
The person who anchors a television or radio programme, especially a news programme, is the person who presents it and acts as a link between interviews and reports which come from other places or studios.

voca.means_en: Ancient means belonging to the distant past, especially to the period in history before the end of the Roman Empire.\nAncient means very old, or having existed for a long time.\n

Angels are spiritual beings that some people believe are God's servants in heaven.
You can call someone you like very much an angel in order to show affection, especially when they have been kind to you or done you a favour.
If you describe someone as an angel, you mean that they seem to be very kind and good.
You can describe someone as angelic if they are, or seem to be, very good, kind, and gentle.\nAngelic means like angels or relating to angels.\n
Anger is the strong emotion that you feel when you think that someone has behaved in an unfair, cruel, or unacceptable way.\nIf something angers you, it makes you feel angry.\n

voca.means_en:
An angle is the difference in direction between two lines or surfaces. Angles are measured in degrees.
An angle is the shape that is created where two lines or surfaces join together.
An angle is the direction from which you look at something.
You can refer to a way of presenting something or thinking about it as a particular angle.
If someone is angling for something, they are trying to get it without asking for it directly.
to try to obtain something without asking for it directly\n
angry / mad / indignant / cross / irate\nWhen you are angry, you feel strong dislike or impatience about something.\n

An animal is a living creature such as a dog, lion, or rabbit, rather than a bird, fish, insect, or human being.
Any living creature other than a human being can be referred to as an animal.
Any living creature, including a human being, can be referred to as an animal.
Animal products come from animals rather than from plants.

voca.means_en: Something that is animate has life, in contrast to things like stones and machines which do not.\nTo animate something means to make it lively or more cheerful.\n
Your ankle is the joint where your foot joins your leg.\n
If you annotate written work or a diagram, you add notes to it, especially in order to explain it.\n
Annotation is the activity of annotating something.\nAn annotation is a note that is added to a text or diagram, often in order to explain it.\n

declare | state | indicate | announce
If you announce something, you tell people about it publicly or officially.
If you announce a piece of news or an intention, especially something that people may not like, you say it loudly and clearly, so that everyone you are with can hear it.
If an airport or railway employee announces something, they tell the public about it by means of a loudspeaker system.
If someone or something annoys you, it makes you fairly angry and impatient.\n

Annual events happen once every year.
Annual quantities or rates relate to a period of one year.
An annual is a book or magazine that is published once a year.
An annual is a plant that grows and dies within one year.

If you remain anonymous when you do something, you do not let people know that you were the person who did it.
Something that is anonymous does not reveal who you are.
If you describe a place as anonymous, you dislike it because it has no unusual or interesting features and seems unwelcoming.

You use another at the beginning of a statement to link it to a previous statement.
You use another before a word referring to a distance, length of time, or other amount, to indicate an additional amount.
You use one another to indicate that each member of a group does something to or for the other members.

answer / reply

If you answer a letter or advertisement, you write to the person who wrote it.
When you answer the telephone, you pick it up when it rings. When you answer the door, you open it when you hear a knock or the bell.
When you answer a question in a test or quiz, you write or say something in an attempt to give the facts that are asked for.
If you answer something that someone has said or done, you respond to it.
An answer is something that you say when you answer someone.
An answer is a letter that you write to someone who has written to you.
to speak on behalf of somebody and say what they will do or what they think\n

Antacid is a substance that reduces the level of acid in the stomach.\n
The Antarctic is the area around the South Pole.\n

a continent around the South Pole: consists of an ice-covered plateau, 1800--3000 m (6000 ft to 10 000 ft) above sea level, and mountain ranges rising to 4500 m (15 000 ft) with some volcanic peaks; average temperatures all below freezing and human settlement is confined to research stations. All political claims to the mainland are suspended under the Antarctic Treaty of 1959\n
An anteater is an animal with a long nose that eats termites or ants. Anteaters live in warm countries.\n
An antelope is an animal like a deer, with long legs and horns, that lives in Africa or Asia. Antelopes are graceful and can run fast. There are many different types of antelope.\n
effective against bacteria\n

If you anticipate an event, you realize in advance that it may happen and you are prepared for it.
If you anticipate a question, request, or need, you do what is necessary or required before the question, request, or need occurs.
If you anticipate something, you do it, think it, or say it before someone else does.
an astringent substance applied to the skin to reduce or prevent perspiration\nreducing or preventing perspiration\n
A male deer's antlers are the branched horns on its head.\n
Anxiety is a feeling of nervousness or worry.\n

You use any in positive statements when you are referring to someone or something of a particular kind that might exist, occur, or be involved in a situation, when their exact identity or nature is not important.

You use anyone or anybody in questions and conditional clauses to ask or talk about whether someone is present or doing something.

You use anything in statements with negative meaning to indicate in a general way that nothing is present or that an action or event does not or cannot happen.

You can use anything before words which indicate the kind of thing you are talking about.
You use anytime to mean a point in time which is not fixed or set.\n
used in negative sentences and questions to refer to the near future\n

You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous point.
You use anyway or anyhow to suggest that a statement is true or relevant in spite of other things that have been said.
You use anyway or anyhow to correct or modify a statement, for example to limit it to what you definitely know to be true
You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that you are asking what the real situation is or what the real reason for something is.

You use anywhere in statements with negative meaning to indicate that a place does not exist.

You use anywhere to refer to a place when you are emphasizing that it could be any of a large number of places.

If two people are apart, they are no longer living together or spending time together, either permanently or just for a short time.
You use apart from when you are making an exception to a general statement.

voca.means_en: Apes are chimpanzees, gorillas, and other animals in the same family.\nIf you ape someone's speech or behaviour, you imitate it.\n
When you apologize to someone, you say that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them. You can say `I apologize' as a formal way of saying sorry.\n
An apology is something that you say or write in order to tell someone that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them.\nIf you offer or make your apologies, you apologize.\n

An apostrophe is the mark ' when it is written to indicate that one or more letters have been left out of a word, as in 'isn't' and 'we'll'. It is also added to nouns to form possessives, as in 'Mike's car'.\n

clear / obvious / apparent / evident / plain / crystal clear
An apparent situation, quality, or feeling seems to exist, although you cannot be certain that it does exist.
If something is apparent to you, it is clear and obvious to you.

You use apparently to indicate that the information you are giving is something that you have heard, but you are not certain that it is true.\nYou use apparently to refer to something that seems to be true, although you are not sure whether it is or not.\n

voca.means_en:
If you appeal to someone to do something, you make a serious and urgent request to them.
If you appeal to someone in authority against a decision, you formally ask them to change it. In British English, you appeal against something. In American English, you appeal something.
If something appeals to you, you find it attractive or interesting.
An appeal is a serious and urgent request.
An appeal is an attempt to raise money for a charity or for a good cause.
An appeal is a formal request for a decision to be changed.
The appeal of something is a quality that it has which people find attractive or interesting.

If you say that something appears to be the way you describe it, you are reporting what you believe or what you have been told, though you cannot be sure it is true.
If someone or something appears to have a particular quality or characteristic, they give the impression of having that quality or characteristic.
When someone or something appears, they move into a position where you can see them.
When something new appears, it begins to exist or reaches a stage of development where its existence can be noticed.
When something such as a book appears, it is published or becomes available for people to buy.
When someone appears in something such as a play, a show, or a television programme, they take part in it.
When someone appears before a court of law or before an official committee, they go there in order to answer charges or to give information as a witness.

When someone makes an appearance at a public event or in a broadcast, they take part in it.
Someone's or something's appearance is the way that they look.
The appearance of someone or something in a place is their arrival there, especially when it is unexpected.
The appearance of something new is its coming into existence or use.
If something has the appearance of a quality, it seems to have that quality.
If something is true to all appearances, from all appearances, or by all appearances, it seems from what you observe or know about it that it is true.
When you append something to something else, especially a piece of writing, you attach it or add it to the end of it.\n

When a group of people applaud, they clap their hands in order to show approval, for example when they have enjoyed a play or concert.
When an attitude or action is applauded, people praise it.
Your appetite is your desire to eat. / Someone's appetite for something is their strong desire for it.
Applause is the noise made by a group of people clapping their hands to show approval.\n

If you apply for something such as a job or membership of an organization, you write a letter or fill in a form in order to ask formally for it.
If you apply yourself to something or apply your mind to something, you concentrate hard on doing it or on thinking about it.
If something such as a rule or a remark applies to a person or in a situation, it is relevant to the person or the situation.
If you apply something such as a rule, system, or skill, you use it in a situation or activity.
A name that is applied to someone or something is used to refer to them.
If you apply something to a surface, you put it on or rub it into the surface.
If you appoint someone to a job or official position, you formally choose them for it.\n

voca.means_ko: [어포인먼t]\n(특히 업무 관련) 약속, 예약, \n임명, 선임, (책임 있는) 직위, 직책
voca.means_en:
job / post / position / vacancy / placement / appointment / opening
The appointment of a person to a particular job is the choice of that person to do it.
An appointment is a job or position of responsibility.
If you have an appointment with someone, you have arranged to see them at a particular time, usually in connection with their work or for a serious purpose.
If something can be done by appointment, people can arrange in advance to do it at a particular time.

voca.means_ko: [어p뤠이졀]\n(가치, 업적, 본질에 대한) 평가, 견적, 감정
voca.means_en: If you make an appraisal of something, you consider it carefully and form an opinion about it.\n

If you appraise something or someone, you consider them carefully and form an opinion about them.\nAppraisal is the official or formal assessment of the strengths and weaknesses of someone or something. Appraisal often involves observation or some kind of testing.\n

If you appreciate something, for example a piece of music or good food, you like it because you recognize its good qualities.
If you appreciate a situation or problem, you understand it and know what it involves.
If you appreciate something that someone has done for you or is going to do for you, you are grateful for it.
If something that you own appreciates over a period of time, its value increases.

fear / alarm / apprehension / fright / foreboding
Apprehension is a feeling of fear that something bad may happen.
The apprehension of someone who is thought to be a criminal is their capture or arrest by the police.
An apprentice is a young person who works for someone in order to learn their skill.\nIf a young person is apprenticed to someone, they go to work for them in order to learn their skill.\n

voca.means_en:
When you approach something, you get closer to it.
If you approach someone about something, you speak to them about it for the first time, often making an offer or request.
When you approach a task, problem, or situation in a particular way, you deal with it or think about it in that way.
As a future time or event approaches, it gradually gets nearer as time passes.
As you approach a future time or event, time passes so that you get gradually nearer to it.
If something approaches a particular level or state, it almost reaches that level or state.

[어p러p뤼에잇t]

voca.means_en: Something that is appropriate is suitable or acceptable for a particular situation.\nIf someone appropriates something which does not belong to them, they take it, usually without the right to do so.\n

agree / approve / consent / acquiesce
If you approve of an action, event, or suggestion, you like it or are pleased about it.
If you approve of someone or something, you like and admire them.
If someone in a position of authority approves a plan or idea, they formally agree to it and say that it can happen.

voca.means_en:
An approximate number, time, or position is close to the correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.
An idea or description that is approximate is not intended to be precise or accurate, but to give some indication of what something is like.
If something approximates to something else, it is similar to it but is not exactly the same.
An apricot is a small, soft, round fruit with yellowish-orange flesh and a stone inside.\nApricot is used to describe things that are yellowish-orange in colour.\n
An apron is a piece of clothing that you put on over the front of your normal clothes and tie round your waist, especially when you are cooking, in order to prevent your clothes from getting dirty.\n
Someone's aptitude for a particular kind of work or activity is their ability to learn it quickly and to do it well.\n

Aquarius is one of the twelve signs of the zodiac. Its symbol is a person pouring water. People who are born approximately between 20th January and 18th February come under this sign.\nAn Aquarius is a person whose sign of the zodiac is Aquarius.\n
If you describe an action, rule, or decision as arbitrary, you think that it is not based on any principle, plan, or system. It often seems unfair because of this.\n
Archery is a sport in which people shoot arrows at a target using a bow.\n

An architect is a person who designs buildings.
You can use architect to refer to a person who plans large projects such as landscaping or railways.
The architect of an idea, event, or institution is the person who invented it or made it happen.

Architecture is the art of planning, designing, and constructing buildings.
The architecture of a building is the style in which it is designed and constructed.
The architecture of something is its structure.

voca.means_ko: [아r틱]\n북극의, 북극(권)의, 북극에서 오는, 북극성 기후의\n북극 지방
voca.means_en: The Arctic is the area of the world around the North Pole. It is extremely cold and there is very little light in winter and very little darkness in summer.\nIf you describe a place or the weather as arctic, you are emphasizing that it is extremely cold.\n

An area is a particular part of a town, a country, a region, or the world.
Your area is the part of a town, country, or region where you live. An organization's area is the part of a town, country, or region that it is responsible for.
A particular area is a piece of land or part of a building that is used for a particular activity.
An area is a particular place on a surface or object, for example on your body.
The area of a surface such as a piece of land is the amount of flat space or ground that it covers, measured in square units.
You can use area to refer to a particular subject or topic, or to a particular part of a larger, more general situation or activity.

voca.means_ko:
[아r-규-]
(논거를 들어) 주장/논쟁하다, 말다툼하다
언쟁하다, 다투다
분명히 보여주다, 입증하다
voca.means_en:
If one person argues with another, they speak angrily to each other about something that they disagree about.
If you tell someone not to argue with you, you want them to do or believe what you say without protest or disagreement.
If you argue with someone about something, you discuss it with them, with each of you giving your different opinions.
If you argue that something is true, you state it and give the reasons why you think it is true.
If you argue for something, you say why you agree with it, in order to persuade people that it is right. If you argue against something, you say why you disagree with it, in order to persuade people that it is wrong.
If you argue, you support your opinions with evidence in an ordered or logical way.
If you say that no-one can argue with a particular fact or opinion, you are emphasizing that it is obviously true and so everyone must accept it.
to discuss all the details of an idea, a plan, etc., often in an excited or angry way, until you reach a decision\n
to disagree with what somebody says; to say or show that something is not right\n

An argument is a statement or set of statements that you use in order to try to convince people that your opinion about something is correct.
An argument is a discussion or debate in which a number of people put forward different or opposing opinions
An argument is a conversation in which people disagree with each other angrily or noisily.
If you accept something without argument, you do not question it or disagree with it.

Aries is one of the twelve signs of the zodiac. Its symbol is a ram. People who are born approximately between 21st March and 19th April come under this sign.\nAn Aries is a person whose sign of the zodiac is Aries.\n
The aristocracy is a class of people in some countries who have a high social rank and special titles.\n

Arithmetic is the part of mathematics that is concerned with the addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of numbers.\nYou can use arithmetic to refer to the process of doing a particular sum or calculation.\n

Your arms are the two long parts of your body that are attached to your shoulders and that have your hands at the end.
The arm of a piece of clothing is the part of it that covers your arm.
The arm of a chair is the part on which you rest your arm when you are sitting down.
An arm of an object is a long thin part of it that sticks out from the main part.
An arm of land or water is a long thin area of it that is joined to a broader area.
Arms are weapons, especially bombs and guns.
The arms of a city or of a noble family are its coat of arms. Arms is often used in the names of British pubs.
If you arm someone with a weapon, you provide them with a weapon.
Someone who is armed is carrying a weapon, usually a gun.\nAn armed attack or conflict involves people fighting with guns or carrying weapons.\n

(armour)
In former times, armour was special metal clothing that soldiers wore for protection in battle.
Armour consists of tanks and other military vehicles used in battle.
Armour is a hard, usually metal, covering that protects a vehicle against attack.
Your armpits are the areas of your body under your arms where your arms join your shoulders.\n

An army is a large organized group of people who are armed and trained to fight on land in a war. Most armies are organized and controlled by governments.\nAn army of people, animals, or things is a large number of them, especially when they are regarded as a force of some kind.\n

If you arrange an event or meeting, you make plans for it to happen.
If you arrange with someone to do something, you make plans with them to do it.
If you arrange something for someone, you make it possible for them to have it or to do it.
If you arrange things somewhere, you place them in a particular position, usually in order to make them look attractive or tidy.
If a piece of music is arranged by someone, it is changed or adapted so that it is suitable for particular instruments or voices, or for a particular performance.
An array of different things or people is a large number or wide range of them.\nAn array of objects is a collection of them that is displayed or arranged in a particular way.\n

voca.means_ko:

(무엇의 진행을) 막다, 저지하다

voca.means_en:
If the police arrest you, they take charge of you and take you to a police station, because they believe you may have committed a crime.
If something or someone arrests a process, they stop it continuing.
If something interesting or surprising arrests your attention, you suddenly notice it and then continue to look at it or consider it carefully.

voca.means_ko: [어롸이v]\n(특히 여정 끝에) 도착하다, 도달하다, 배달되다\n도래하다, 찾아오다
voca.means_en:
When a person or vehicle arrives at a place, they come to it at the end of a journey.
When you arrive at a place, you come to it for the first time in order to stay, live, or work there.
When something such as letter or meal arrives, it is brought or delivered to you.
When something such as a new product or invention arrives, it becomes available.
When a particular moment or event arrives, it happens, especially after you have been waiting for it or expecting it.
When you arrive at something such as a decision, you decide something after thinking about it or discussing it.
to agree on something or to find something after discussing and thinking about it\n
Someone who is arrogant behaves in a proud, unpleasant way towards other people because they believe that they are more important than others.\n

An arrow is a long thin weapon which is sharp and pointed at one end and which often has feathers at the other end. An arrow is shot from a bow.\nAn arrow is a written or printed sign that consists of a straight line with another line bent at a sharp angle at one end. This is a printed arrow: . The arrow points in a particular direction to indicate where something is.\n
Arson is the crime of deliberately setting fire to a building or vehicle.\n

Art consists of paintings, sculpture, and other pictures or objects which are created for people to look at and admire or think deeply about.
Art is the activity or educational subject that consists of creating paintings, sculptures, and other pictures or objects for people to look at and admire or think deeply about.
The arts are activities such as music, painting, literature, cinema, and dance, which people can take part in for enjoyment, or to create works which express serious meanings or ideas of beauty.
At a university or college, arts are subjects such as history, literature, or languages in contrast to scientific subjects.
If you describe an activity as an art, you mean that it requires skill and that people learn to do it by instinct or experience, rather than by learning facts or rules.

Arteries are the tubes in your body that carry blood from your heart to the rest of your body. Compare vein.\nYou can refer to an important main route within a complex road, railway, or river system as an artery.\n
Arthritis is a medical condition in which the joints in someone's body are swollen and painful.\n
any invertebrate of the phylum Arthropoda, having jointed limbs, a segmented body, and an exoskeleton made of chitin. The group includes the crustaceans, insects, arachnids, and centipedes\n

voca.means_en:
An article is a piece of writing that is published in a newspaper or magazine.
You can refer to objects as articles of some kind.
An article of a formal agreement or document is a section of it which deals with a particular point.
Someone who is in articles is being trained as a lawyer or accountant by a firm with whom they have a written agreement.
In grammar, an article is a kind of determiner. In English, 'a' and 'an' are called the indefinite article, and 'the' is called the definite article.
If you describe something as the genuine article, you are emphasizing that it is genuine, and often that it is very good.

voca.means_ko: [아릐풱t]\n(천연물과 대비하여) 인공물, 공예품, 유물\n인공 유물, 만들어낸 것

voca.means_en:
artificial / synthetic / false / man-made / fake / imitation
Artificial objects, materials, or processes do not occur naturally and are created by human beings, for example using science or technology.
An artificial state or situation exists only because someone has created it, and therefore often seems unnatural or unnecessary.
If you describe someone or their behaviour as artificial, you disapprove of them because they pretend to have attitudes and feelings which they do not really have.
considered as one general group\n
as usually happens or is expected\n
very clean\nif somebody is as clean as a whistle, they are not involved in anything illegal\n

voca.means_en: As usual, she had left without him.\nin the same way as what happens most of the time or in most cases\n
in addition to somebody/something; too\n
until now or until a particular time in the past\n

Ash is the grey or black powdery substance that is left after something is burnt. You can also refer to this substance as ashes.
A dead person's ashes are their remains after their body has been cremated.
An ash is a tree that has smooth grey bark and loses its leaves in winter.

ashamed / embarrassed
If someone is ashamed, they feel embarrassed or guilty because of something they do or they have done, or because of their appearance.
If you are ashamed of someone, you feel embarrassed to be connected with them, often because of their appearance or because you disapprove of something they have done.
If someone is ashamed to do something, they do not want to do it because they feel embarrassed about it.
Someone or something that comes ashore comes from the sea onto the shore.\n

voca.means_en:
If you move something aside, you move it to one side of you.
If you take or draw someone aside, you take them a little way away from a group of people in order to talk to them in private.
If you move aside, you get out of someone's way.
If you set something such as time, money, or space aside for a particular purpose, you save it and do not use it for anything else.
If you brush or sweep aside a feeling or suggestion, you reject it.
An aside is a comment that a character in a play makes to the audience, which the other characters are supposed not to be able to hear.

asleep / fall asleep / go to sleep / get to sleep / drift off / nod off / drop off
Someone who is asleep is sleeping.
When you fall asleep, you start sleeping.
Someone who is fast asleep or sound asleep is sleeping deeply.

An aspect of something is one of the parts of its character or nature.
The aspect of a building or window is the direction in which it faces.
In grammar, aspect is the way that a verb group shows whether an activity is continuing, is repeated, or is completed. For example, in `They were laughing', the verb is in the progressive aspect and shows that the action was continuing. Compare tense.
Someone's aspirations are their desire to achieve things.\n
If you aspire to something such as an important job, you have a strong desire to achieve it.\n
to have a strong desire to gain or achieve something\n
An assassin is a person who assassinates someone.\n
When someone important is assassinated, they are murdered as a political act.\n

voca.means_en:
An assault by an army is a strong attack made on an area held by the enemy.
An assault on a person is a physical attack on them.
An assault on someone's beliefs is a strong criticism of them.
Assault weapons such as rifles are intended for soldiers to use in battle rather than for purposes such as hunting.

build / construct / assemble / erect / set up / put up / put together
When people assemble or when someone assembles them, they come together in a group, usually for a particular purpose such as a meeting.
To assemble something means to collect it together or to fit the different parts of it together.
An assembler is a person, a machine, or a company which assembles the individual parts of a vehicle or a piece of equipment such as a computer.\n

voca.means_en:
An assembly is a large group of people who meet regularly to make decisions or laws for a particular region or country.
An assembly is a group of people gathered together for a particular purpose.
When you refer to rights of assembly or restrictions on assembly, you are referring to the legal right that people have to gather together.
In a school, assembly is a gathering of all the teachers and pupils at the beginning of every school day.
The assembly of a machine, device, or object is the process of fitting its different parts together.

If someone asserts a fact or belief, they state it firmly.
If you assert your authority, you make it clear by your behaviour that you have authority.
If you assert your right or claim to something, you insist that you have the right to it.
If you assert yourself, you speak and act in a forceful way, so that people take notice of you.
claim / allegation / assertion / contention\n

voca.means_en:
If you assign a piece of work to someone, you give them the work to do.
If you assign something to someone, you say that it is for their use.
If someone is assigned to a particular place, group, or person, they are sent there, usually in order to work at that place or for that person.
If you assign a particular function or value to someone or something, you say they have it.

voca.means_ko: [어싸인먼t]\n과제, 숙제, 임무, 할당, 부여, 담당부서\n배정, 배치
voca.means_en:
task / duties / mission / job / assignment / chore
An assignment is a task or piece of work that you are given to do, especially as part of your job or studies.
You can refer to someone being given a particular task or job as their assignment to the task or job.

If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them.
If you assist someone, you give them information, advice, or money.
If something assists in doing a task, it makes the task easier to do.

Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.
Someone's assistant is a person who helps them in their work.
An assistant is a person who works in a shop selling things to customers.

관련시키다, 제휴/연합시키다

동료의, 친구의
voca.means_en:
If you associate someone or something with another thing, the two are connected in your mind.
If you are associated with a particular organization, cause, or point of view, or if you associate yourself with it, you support it publicly.
If you say that someone is associating with another person or group of people, you mean they are spending a lot of time in the company of people you do not approve of.
Your associates are the people you are closely connected with, especially at work.
Associate is used before a rank or title to indicate a slightly different or lower rank or title.

If one thing is associated with another, the two things are connected with each other.\nAssociated is used in the name of a company that is made up of a number of smaller companies which have joined together.\n

An association is an official group of people who have the same job, aim, or interest.
Your association with a person or a thing such as an organization is the connection that you have with them.
If something has particular associations for you, it is connected in your mind with a particular memory, idea, or feeling.
If you do something in association with someone else, you do it together.

voca.means_en:
If you assume that something is true, you imagine that it is true, sometimes wrongly.
If something assumes a particular quality, it begins to have that quality.
You can use let us assume or let's assume when you are considering a possible situation or event, so that you can think about the consequences.
If someone assumes power or responsibility, they take power or responsibility.\n

If you make an assumption that something is true or will happen, you accept that it is true or will happen, often without any real proof.\nSomeone's assumption of power or responsibility is their taking of it.\n

If you assure someone that something is true or will happen, you tell them that it is definitely true or will definitely happen, often in order to make them less worried.
To assure someone of something means to make certain that they will get it.
You use phrases such as I can assure you or let me assure you to emphasize the truth of what you are saying.
An asterisk is the sign *. It is used especially to indicate that there is further information about something in another part of the text.\n
Asthma is a lung condition which causes difficulty in breathing.\n
An astronaut is a person who is trained for travelling in a spacecraft.\n
An astronomer is a scientist who studies the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space.\n
Astronomy is the scientific study of the stars, planets, and other natural objects in space.\n
separately or in groups of two, three, etc. on each occasion\n

Ate is the past tense of eat.\n
An athlete is a person who does a sport, especially athletics, or track and field events.\nYou can refer to someone who is fit and athletic as an athlete.\n
Athletics refers to track and field sports such as running, the high jump, and the javelin.\nAthletics refers to any kind of physical sports, exercise, or games.\n
An atlas is a book of maps.\n

voca.means_en:
If you attempt to do something, especially something difficult, you try to do it.
If you make an attempt to do something, you try to do it, often without success.
An attempt on someone's life is an attempt to kill them.

If you attend a meeting or other event, you are present at it.
If you attend an institution such as a school, college, or church, you go there regularly.
If you attend to something, you deal with it. If you attend to someone who is hurt or injured, you care for them.
to deal with or take responsibility for something; to give practical help to somebody who needs it\n

voca.means_en: An attendant is someone whose job is to serve or help people in a place such as a petrol station, a car park, or a cloakroom.\nYou use attendant to describe something that results from a thing already mentioned or that is connected with it.\n

voca.means_ko: 주의, 집중, 주목\n관심, 흥미\n(관심을 끌기 위한) 행동/배려
voca.means_en:
If you give someone or something your attention, you look at it, listen to it, or think about it carefully.
Attention is great interest that is shown in someone or something, particularly by the general public.
If someone or something is getting attention, they are being dealt with or cared for.
You can refer to someone's efforts to help you, or the interest they show in you, as their
If you bring something to someone's attention or draw their attention to it, you tell them about it or make them notice it.
An attic is a room at the top of a house just below the roof.\n
Your attire is the clothes you are wearing.\n

Your attitude to something is the way that you think and feel about it,\nIf you refer to someone as a person with attitude, you mean that they have a striking and individual style of behaviour, especially a forceful or aggressive one.\n
In the United States, an attorney or attorney at law is a lawyer.\n

voca.means_en:
If something attracts people or animals, it has features that cause them to come to it.
If someone or something attracts you, they have particular qualities which cause you to like or admire them. If a particular quality attracts you to a person or thing, it is the reason why you like them.
If you are attracted to someone, you are interested in them sexually.
If something attracts support, publicity, or money, it receives support, publicity, or money.
If one object attracts another object, it causes the second object to move towards it.

voca.means_en:
Attraction is a feeling of liking someone, and often of being sexually interested in them.
An attraction is a feature which makes something interesting or desirable.
An attraction is something that people can go to for interest or enjoyment, for example a famous building.

beautiful / pretty / handsome / attractive / lovely / good-looking / gorgeous
A person who is attractive is pleasant to look at.
Something that is attractive has a pleasant appearance or sound.
You can describe something as attractive when it seems worth having or doing.

voca.means_en:
If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation.
If you attribute a particular quality or feature to someone or something, you think that they have got it.
If a piece of writing, a work of art, or a remark is attributed to someone, people say that they wrote it, created it, or said it.
An attribute is a quality or feature that someone or something has.
Someone or something that is atypical is not typical of its kind.\n
An auction is a public sale where goods are sold to the person who offers the highest price.\nIf something is auctioned, it is sold in an auction.\n
to sell something at an auction, especially something that somebody no longer needs or wants\n
An auditorium is the part of a theatre or concert hall where the audience sits.\nAn auditorium is a large room, hall, or building which is used for events such as meetings and concerts.\n
To augment something means to make it larger, stronger, or more effective by adding something to it.\n

voca.means_ko: (어떤 사람, 장소에 서려있는 독특한) 기운, 분위기
voca.means_en: An aura is a quality or feeling that seems to surround a person or place or to come from them.\n

The author of a piece of writing is the person who wrote it.
An author is a person whose job is writing books.
The author of a plan or proposal is the person who thinks of it and works out the details.
If you describe a person or an organization as authoritarian, you are critical of them controlling everything rather than letting people decide things for themselves.\n

voca.means_en:
The authorities are the people who have the power to make decisions and to make sure that laws are obeyed.
An authority is an official organization or government department that has the power to make decisions.
Authority is the right to command and control other people.
If someone has authority, they have a quality which makes other people take notice of what they say.
Authority is official permission to do something.
Someone who is an authority on a particular subject knows a lot about it.
If you say you have it on good authority that something is true, you mean that you believe it is true because you trust the person who told you about it.
An autograph is the signature of someone famous which is specially written for a fan to keep.\nIf someone famous autographs something, they put their signature on it.\n
Automotive is used to refer to things relating to cars.\n
Autumn is the season between summer and winter when the weather becomes cooler and the leaves fall off the trees.\n

An auxiliary is a person who is employed to assist other people in their work. Auxiliaries are often medical workers or members of the armed forces.
In grammar, an auxiliary or auxiliary verb is a verb which is used with a main verb, for example to form different tenses or to make the verb passive. In English, the basic auxiliary verbs are `be', `have', and `do'. Modal verbs such as `can' and `will' are also sometimes called auxiliaries.
Auxiliary staff and troops assist other staff and troops.
If something you want or need is available, you can find it or obtain it.\n
An avalanche is a large mass of snow that falls down the side of a mountain.\nSomeone who is available is not busy and is therefore free to talk to you or to do a particular task.\n
If you avert something unpleasant, you prevent it from happening.\nIf you avert your eyes or gaze from someone or something, you look away from them.\n

If you avoid something unpleasant that might happen, you take action in order to prevent it from happening.
If you avoid doing something, you choose not to do it, or you put yourself in a situation where you do not have to do it.
If you avoid a person or thing, you keep away from them. When talking to someone, if you avoid the subject, you keep the conversation away from a particular topic.

voca.means_en:
awake / awaken / wake up / waken
Someone who is awake is not sleeping.
Someone who is wide awake is fully awake and unable to sleep.
When you awake or when something awakes you, you wake up.
to become aware of something and its possible results; to realize or understand something\n

voca.means_en:
An award is a prize or certificate that a person is given for doing something well.
In law, an award is a sum of money that a court decides should be given to someone.
A pay award is an increase in pay for a particular group of workers.
If someone is awarded something such as a prize or an examination mark, it is given to them.
To award something to someone means to decide that it will be given to that person.
