눈치 채고 있는
~에 대한 의식이 높은/관심이 많은
voca.means_en:
If you are aware of something, you know about it.
If you are aware of something, you realize that it is present or is happening because you hear it, see it, smell it, or feel it.
Someone who is aware notices what is happening around them or happening in the place where they live.

voca.means_ko: [어웨어네s]\n(무엇의 중요성에 대한) 의식/관심,\n알아채고 있음, 인식, 의식, 지각, 인지도
[어웨이]\n(시간적, 공간적으로) 떨어져, 사라져, 끊임없이\n다른데로, 자리에 없는, 결석한
voca.means_en:
If someone or something moves or is moved away from a place, they move or are moved so that they are no longer there. If you are away from a place, you are not in the place where people expect you to be.
If you look or turn away from something, you move your head so that you are no longer looking at it.
If you put or tidy something away, you put it where it should be. If you hide someone or something away, you put them in a place where nobody can see them or find them.
You use away to talk about future events. For example, if an event is a week away, it will happen after a week.

Awe is the feeling of respect and amazement that you have when you are faced with something wonderful and often rather frightening.
If you are awed by someone or something, they make you feel respectful and amazed, though often rather frightened.
If you are in awe of someone or if you stand in awe of them, you have a lot of respect for them and are slightly afraid of them.
great / cool / fantastic / fabulous / terrific / brilliant / awesome\nAn awesome person or thing is very impressive and often frightening.\n

terrible / awful / horrible / dreadful / vile / foul
If you say that someone or something is awful, you dislike that person or thing or you think that they are not very good.
If you say that something is awful, you mean that it is extremely unpleasant, shocking, or bad.
If you look or feel awful, you look or feel ill.
You can use awful with noun groups that refer to an amount in order to emphasize how large that amount is.

An awkward situation is embarrassing and difficult to deal with.
Something that is awkward to use or carry is difficult to use or carry because of its design. A job that is awkward is difficult to do.
An awkward movement or position is uncomfortable or clumsy.
Someone who feels awkward behaves in a shy or embarrassed way.

voca.means_ko:
[엑s]
도끼
해고, (기관의) 폐쇄, (사업의) 중단
(인원, 지원금 등을) 대폭 삭감/축소하다
voca.means_en:
An axe is a tool used for cutting wood. It consists of a heavy metal blade which is sharp at one edge and attached by its other edge to the end of a long handle.
If a person or institution is facing the axe, that person is likely to lose their job or that institution is likely to be closed, usually in order to save money.
If someone's job or something such as a public service or a television programme is axed, it is ended suddenly and without discussion.

voca.means_ko: 베이비 샤워 (임신한 것을 축하하기 위해 친구들이 아기 용품을 선물하는 축하 파티)

voca.means_en: A bachelor is a man who has never married.\n

voca.means_ko: [베엑k]\n등/허리, 등뼈, 척추, 뒷면, 뒤쪽, 뒷 부분\n후원하다, 후퇴하다, 도와주다
voca.means_en:
If you move back, you move in the opposite direction to the one in which you are facing or in which you were moving before.
If you go back somewhere, you return to where you were before.
If someone or something is back in a particular state, they were in that state before and are now in it again.
A person's or animal's back is the part of their body between their head and their legs that is on the opposite side to their chest and stomach.
The back of something is the side or part of it that is towards the rear or farthest from the front. The back of something is normally not used or seen as much as the front.
to stop threatening or annoying somebody\nto decide not to continue to do something or support an idea, in order to avoid a difficult or unpleasant situation\n
(computing) to make a copy of a file, a program, etc. that can be used if the original one is lost or damaged\nto add something extra to something, especially as a support\n
When I was in junior high, we didn't have Facebook back then.\n
Then I watched all three LOTRs back to back.\n
to move backwards a short distance, especially in a vehicle; to make somebody/something move backwards a short distance\nif traffic backs up or is backed up, it cannot move and forms a long line\n
Your backbone is the column of small linked bones down the middle of your back.\nThe backbone of an organization or system is the part of it that gives it its main strength.\n

environment / setting / surroundings / background / backdrop / situation
Your background is the kind of family you come from and the kind of education you have had. It can also refer to such things as your social and racial origins, your financial status, or the type of work experience that you have.
The background to an event or situation consists of the facts that explain what caused it.
The background is sounds, such as music, which you can hear but which you are not listening to with your full attention.
You can use background to refer to the things in a picture or scene that are less noticeable or important than the main things or people in it.

voca.means_ko: 뒤의, 뒷걸음질 하는, 퇴보하는, \n발전이 더딘, 낙후된
voca.means_en:
A backward movement or look is in the direction that your back is facing. Some people use backwards for this meaning.
If someone takes a backward step, they do something that does not change or improve their situation, but causes them to go back a stage.
A backward country or society does not have modern industries and machines.
A backward child has difficulty in learning.
Bacteria are very small organisms. Some bacteria can cause disease.\n

voca.means_ko:

심한, 심각한

voca.means_en:
Something that is bad is unpleasant, harmful, or undesirable.
You use bad to indicate that something unpleasant or undesirable is severe or great in degree.
A bad idea, decision, or method is not sensible or not correct.
If you describe a piece of news, an action, or a sign as bad, you mean that it is unlikely to result in benefit or success.
Something that is bad is of an unacceptably low standard, quality, or amount.

voca.means_ko: [베쥐]\n(소속, 신분, 계급 등을 나타내는) 표, 배지, \n휘장, 상징, 증표, (경찰 등의) 신분증
voca.means_en: A badge is a piece of metal or cloth which you wear to show that you belong to an organization or support a cause. American English usually uses button to refer to a small round metal badge.\n

A badger is a wild animal which has a white head with two wide black stripes on it. Badgers live underground and usually come up to feed at night.\nIf you badger someone, you repeatedly tell them to do something or repeatedly ask them questions.\n
If a piece of clothing is baggy, it hangs loosely on your body.\n

voca.means_en:
Bail is a sum of money that an arrested person or someone else puts forward as a guarantee that the arrested person will attend their trial in a law court. If the arrested person does not attend it, the money will be lost.
Bail is permission for an arrested person to be released after bail has been paid.
If someone is bailed, they are released while they are waiting for their trial, after paying an amount of money to the court.
If you bail, you use a container to remove water from a boat or from a place which is flooded.
to throw water out of a boat with a container or with your hands\n
save / rescue / bail out / redeem\nto pay somebody's bail (= the money that somebody accused of a crime has to pay if they do not appear at\n

If you bake, you spend some time preparing and mixing together ingredients to make bread, cakes, pies, or other food which is cooked in the oven.
When a cake or bread bakes or when you bake it, it cooks in the oven without any extra liquid or fat.
If places or people become extremely hot because the sun is shining very strongly, you can say that they bake.
A vegetable or fish bake is a dish that is made by chopping up and mixing together a number of ingredients and cooking them in the oven so that they form a fairly dry solid mass.

If you balance something somewhere, or if it balances there, it remains steady and does not fall.
If you balance one thing with something different, each of the things has the same strength or importance.
If you balance one thing against another, you consider its importance in relation to the other one.
Balance is the ability to remain steady when you are standing up.
A balance is a situation in which all the different parts are equal in strength or importance.
If you say that the balance tips in your favour, you start winning or succeeding, especially in a conflict or contest.

plain / simple / stark / bare / unequivocal / bald
Someone who is bald has little or no hair on the top of their head.
If a tyre is bald, its surface has worn down and it is no longer safe to use.
A bald statement is in plain language and contains no extra explanation or information.
People sometimes refer to a bald person as a baldy, especially if they are talking about them or to them in a friendly or humorous way.\n
A ballroom is a very large room that is used for dancing.\n
Bamboo is a tall tropical plant with hard, hollow stems. The young shoots of the plant can be eaten and the stems are used to make furniture.\n

voca.means_ko: 묶다, 결합시키다\n밴드, 한 무리, 묶는 것
voca.means_en:
A band is a small group of musicians who play popular music such as jazz, rock, or pop.
A band is a group of musicians who play brass and percussion instruments.
A band of people is a group of people who have joined together because they share an interest or belief.
A band is a flat, narrow strip of cloth which you wear round your head or wrists, or which forms part of a piece of clothing.
A bandage is a long strip of cloth which is wrapped around a wounded part of someone's body to protect or support it.\nIf you bandage a wound or part of someone's body, you tie a bandage around it.\n

hit / knock / bang / strike / bump / bash
A bang is a sudden loud noise such as the noise of an explosion.
Bangs are hair which is cut so that it hangs over your forehead.
If something bangs, it makes a sudden loud noise, once or several times.
If you bang a door or if it bangs, it closes suddenly with a loud noise.
If you bang on something or if you bang it, you hit it hard, making a loud noise.
If you bang something on something or if you bang it down, you quickly and violently put it on a surface, because you are angry.
to crash into or hit somebody/something violently, usually by mistake\n

voca.means_ko: 큰 소리로 쉴새없이 떠들다, \n뭔가를 열심히 계속하다

voca.means_en: to talk or write a lot or in a boring way about something\n

쌓다, 싸아 올리다

voca.means_en: to form into a large pile; to make something form a large pile\n
A banquet is a grand formal dinner.\n
A baptism is a Christian ceremony in which a person is baptized. Compare christening.\n

When someone is baptized, water is put on their heads or they are covered with water as a sign that their sins have been forgiven and that they have become a member of the Christian Church. Compare christen.\n

voca.means_en:
A bar is a place where you can buy and drink alcoholic drinks.
A bar is a room in a pub or hotel where alcoholic drinks are served.
A bar is a counter on which alcoholic drinks are served.
A bar is a long, straight, stiff piece of metal.
If you bar a door, you place something in front of it or a piece of wood or metal across it in order to prevent it from being opened.
If you bar someone's way, you prevent them from going somewhere or entering a place, by blocking their path.
If someone is barred from a place or from doing something, they are officially forbidden to go there or to do it.

voca.means_ko:

벌거벗은, 맨-, 노출된, 아무것도 안 덮인,

naked / bare
If a part of your body is bare, it is not covered by any clothing.
A bare surface is not covered or decorated with anything.
If a tree or a branch is bare, it has no leaves on it.
If you bare something, you uncover it and show it.
The tree house was in the tallest tree in a grove of tall, bare trees.
Jack felt the water rising around his bare feet.\n
Someone who is barefoot or barefooted is not wearing anything on their feet.\n

hardly / scarcely / barely / no sooner
You use barely to say that something is only just true or only just the case.
If you say that one thing had barely happened when something else happened, you mean that the first event was followed immediately by the second.

voca.means_en:
Something that is a bargain is good value for money, usually because it has been sold at a lower price than normal.
A bargain is an agreement, especially a formal business agreement, in which two people or groups agree what each of them will do, pay, or receive.
When people bargain with each other, they discuss what each of them will do, pay, or receive.
If people drive a hard bargain, they argue with determination in order to achieve a deal which is favourable to themselves.
You use into the bargain when mentioning an additional quantity, feature, fact, or action, to emphasize the fact that it is also involved. You can also say in the bargain in American English.
to give away something valuable or important in exchange for something less valuable or important\n

voca.means_ko: 헤치며 나아가다, 부딪치다, 충돌하다\n짐배, 바지선, 유람선

voca.means_en:
When a dog barks, it makes a short, loud noise, once or several times.
If you bark at someone, you shout at them aggressively in a loud, rough voice.
Bark is the tough material that covers the outside of a tree.
to shout something loudly\n
Barley is a grain that is used to make food, beer, and whisky.\n
A barn is a building on a farm in which crops or animal food can be kept.\n

voca.means_ko:
[붸럴]
(목제 금속으로 된 대통) 통, 배럴, 맥주통,

voca.means_en:
A barrel is a large, round container for liquids or food.
In the oil industry, a barrel is a unit of measurement equal to 159 litres.
The barrel of a gun is the tube through which the bullet moves when the gun is fired.
If a vehicle or person is barreling in a particular direction, they are moving very quickly in that direction.

A barren landscape is dry and bare, and has very few plants and no trees.
Barren land consists of soil that is so poor that plants cannot grow in it.
If you describe something such as an activity or a period of your life as barren, you mean that you achieve no success during it or that it has no useful results.
If you describe a room or a place as barren, you do not like it because it has almost no furniture or other objects in it.
A barren woman or female animal is unable to have babies.
He had never been to such a colorless, barren place.
a clasp or pin for holding women's hair in place\n

기본의, 기초의
voca.means_en:
basis / foundation / base
The base of something is its lowest edge or part.
The base of something is the lowest part of it, where it is attached to something else.
The base of an object such as a box or vase is the lower surface of it that touches the surface it rests on.
The base of an object that has several sections and that rests on a surface is the lower section of it.
A base is a layer of something which will have another layer added to it.
A position or thing that is a base for something is one from which that thing can be developed or achieved.
A company's client base or customer base is the group of regular clients or customers that the company gets most of its income from.

In America, baseball is a game played by two teams of nine players. Each player from one team hits a ball with a bat and then tries to run around three bases and get to the home base before the other team can get the ball back.\nA baseball is a small hard ball which is used in the game of baseball.\n
The basement of a building is a floor built partly or completely below ground level.\n

hit / knock / bang / strike / bump / bash
A bash is a party or celebration, especially a large one held by an official organization or attended by famous people.
If you get a bash on a part of your body, someone or something hits you hard, or you bump into something.
If someone bashes you, they attack you by hitting or punching you hard.
If you bash something, you hit it hard in a rough or careless way.
To bash someone means to criticize them severely, usually in a public way.
to hit or strike somebody/something and treat them/it in a rough way\n
to work very hard at something for a period of time\n

A basin is a large or deep bowl that you use for holding liquids, or for mixing or storing food.
A basin is the same as a washbasin.
A basin is a partially enclosed area of deep water where boats or ships are kept.
The river basin contains over half of the rain forests in the world.

voca.means_en: If a system or organization is described as a bastion of a particular way of life, it is seen as being important and effective in defending that way of life. Bastion can be used both when you think that this way of life should be ended and when you think it should be defended.\n

A bat is a specially shaped piece of wood that is used for hitting the ball in baseball, softball, cricket, rounders, or table tennis.
When you bat, you have a turn at hitting the ball with a bat in baseball, softball, cricket, or rounders.
Annie batted the animal's paws.

bath / bathe / swim / sunbathe
A bath is a container, usually a long rectangular one, which you fill with water and sit in while you wash your body.
When you have or take a bath, or when you are in the bath, you sit or lie in a bath filled with water in order to wash your body.
A bath or a baths is a public building containing a swimming pool, and sometimes other facilities that people can use to have a wash or a bath.
A bath is a container filled with a particular liquid, such as a dye or an acid, in which particular objects are placed, usually as part of a manufacturing or chemical process.
If you bath someone, especially a child, you wash them in a bath.

bath / bathe / swim / sunbathe
If you bathe in a sea, river, or lake, you swim, play, or wash yourself in it. Birds and animals can also bathe.
When you bathe, you have a bath.
If you bathe someone, especially a child, you wash them in a bath.
If you bathe a part of your body or a wound, you wash it gently or soak it in a liquid.
If a place is bathed in light, it is covered with light, especially a gentle, pleasant light.
"No, I want to go home and change out of my bathing suit." said Jack.\n

A battalion is a large group of soldiers that consists of three or more companies.\nA battalion of people is a large group of them, especially a well-organized, efficient group that has a particular task to do.\n

beat / batter / pound / pummel / lash / hammer

To batter someone means to hit them many times, using fists or a heavy object.
If a place is battered by wind, rain, or storms, it is seriously damaged or affected by very bad weather.
If you batter something, you hit it many times, using your fists or a heavy object.
Batter is a mixture of flour, eggs, and milk that is used in cooking.
In sports such as baseball and softball, a batter is a person who hits the ball with a wooden bat.
to hit something repeatedly until it breaks and falls down\n

campaign / battle / struggle / drive / war / fight
A battle is a violent fight between groups of people, especially one between military forces during a war.
A battle is a conflict in which different people or groups compete in order to achieve success or control.
You can use battle to refer to someone's efforts to achieve something in spite of very difficult circumstances.
To battle with an opposing group means to take part in a fight or contest against them. In American English, you can also say that one group or person is battling another.
To battle means to try hard to do something in spite of very difficult circumstances. In British English, you battle against something or with something. In American English, you battle something.
be full of or covered with something\n
be very easy to do\n
can / could / be able to / manage\n

like / love / be fond of / be keen on / adore\n

If something such as a boat beaches, or if it is beached, it is pulled or forced out of the water and onto land.

Beads are small pieces of coloured glass, wood, or plastic with a hole through the middle. Beads are often put together on a piece of string or wire to make jewellery.\nA bead of liquid or moisture is a small drop of it.\n
A bird's beak is the hard curved or pointed part of its mouth.\n

If you say that someone is beaming, you mean that they have a big smile on their face because they are happy, pleased, or proud about something.
If something beams radio signals or television pictures or they are beamed somewhere, they are sent there by means of electronic equipment.
If something such as the sun or a lamp beams down, it sends light to a place and shines on it.
A beam is a line of energy, radiation, or particles sent in a particular direction.
A beam of light is a line of light that shines from an object such as a lamp.

Beans such as green beans, French beans, or broad beans are the seeds of a climbing plant or the long thin cases which contain those seeds.
Beans such as soya beans and kidney beans are the dried seeds of a bean plant.
Beans such as coffee beans or cocoa beans are the seeds of plants that are used to produce coffee, cocoa, and chocolate.
If someone is full of beans, they are very lively and have a lot of energy and enthusiasm.

beat / batter / pound / pummel / lash / hammer
If you beat someone or something, you hit them very hard.

When your heart or pulse beats, it continually makes regular rhythmic movements.
If you beat a drum or similar instrument, you hit it in order to make a sound. You can also say that a drum beats.
If you beat eggs, cream, or butter, you mix them thoroughly using a fork or beater.
go away\n

voca.means_en:
beautiful / pretty / handsome / attractive / lovely / good-looking / gorgeous
A beautiful person is very attractive to look at.
If you describe something as beautiful, you mean that it is very attractive or pleasing.
You can describe something that someone does as beautiful when they do it very skilfully.

voca.means_ko: [뷰리]\n아름다움, 미, 미인, 아름다운 것\n멋진 사례/보기, 멋진 점, 장점
voca.means_en:
Beauty is the state or quality of being beautiful.
A beauty is a beautiful woman.
You can say that something is a beauty when you think it is very good.
The beauties of something are its attractive qualities or features.
If you say that a particular feature is the beauty of something, you mean that this feature is what makes the thing so good.
Beauty is used to describe people, products, and activities that are concerned with making women look beautiful.

voca.means_ko: 손짓하여 부르다, 신호하다, 유혹하다\n(부르는 신호, 동의를 나타내는) 손짓, 고갯짓
voca.means_en:
If you beckon to someone, you signal to them to come to you.

He screeched and beckoned to Jack and Annie.

become / get / go / turn
If someone or something becomes a particular thing, they start to change and develop into that thing, or start to develop the characteristics mentioned.
If something becomes someone, it makes them look attractive or it seems right for them.
If you wonder what has become of someone or something, you wonder where they are and what has happened to them.
A small flame danced from a bed of glowing coals.\n
A bedbug is a small insect with a round body and no wings which lives in dirty houses and feeds by biting people and sucking their blood when they are in bed.\n
A bedspread is a decorative cover which is put over a bed, on top of the sheets and blankets.\n
a prehistoric circular building found in various parts of Europe, usually of stone and having a dome-shaped roof\n

voca.means_en:
If something happens before a particular date, time, or event, it happens earlier than that date, time, or event.
If you do one thing before doing something else, you do it earlier than the other thing.
If someone is before something, they are in front of it.
You use before when you are talking about time. For example, if something happened the day before a particular date or event, it happened during the previous day.
If someone has done something before, they have done it on a previous occasion. If someone has not done something before, they have never done it.

If you beg someone to do something, you ask them very anxiously or eagerly to do it.
If someone who is poor is begging, they are asking people to give them food or money.
You say 'I beg to differ' when you are politely emphasizing that you disagree with someone.
If you say that something is going begging, you mean that it is available but no one is using it or accepting it.
to ask to be excused from something; to say that you cannot do something that you are expected or have promised to do\n

A beggar is someone who lives by asking people for money or food.

If something beggars belief, it is impossible to believe it. If something beggars description, it is impossible to describe it.
be too strange and unusual to be believed/described\n

begin - began - begun
begin / start
To begin to do something means to start doing it.
When something begins or when you begin it, it takes place from a particular time onwards.
If you begin with something, or begin by doing something, this is the first thing you do.
You use begin to mention the first thing that someone says.
If one thing began as another, it first existed in the form of the second thing.
If you say that a thing or place begins somewhere, you are talking about one of its limits or edges.

The beginning of an event or process is the first part of it.
The beginnings of something are the signs or events which form the first part of it.
The beginning of a period of time is the time at which it starts.
The beginning of a piece of written material is the first words or sentences of it.
If you talk about the beginnings of a person, company, or group, you are referring to their backgrounds or origins.

If you do something on someone's behalf, you do it for that person as their representative. The form in someone's behalf is also used, mainly in American English.\nIf you feel, for example, embarrassed or angry on someone's behalf, you feel embarrassed or angry for them.\n

The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say.
If you behave or behave yourself, you act in the way that people think is correct and proper.
In science, the way that something behaves is the things that it does.

People's or animals' behaviour is the way that they behave. You can refer to a typical and repeated way of behaving as a behaviour.\nIn science, the behaviour of something is the way that it behaves.\n

If you stay behind, you remain in a place after other people have gone.
When you shut a door or gate behind you, you shut it after you have gone through it.
If you behold someone or something, you see them.\n

Being is the present participle of be.
Being is used in non-finite clauses where you are giving the reason for something.
You can refer to any real or imaginary creature as a being.
Being is existence. Something that is in being or comes into being exists.
You can use being as to introduce a reason for what you are saying.

Belief is a feeling of certainty that something exists, is true, or is good.

If it is your belief that something is the case, it is your strong opinion that it is the case.
You use beyond belief to emphasize that something is true to a very great degree or that it happened to a very great degree.
You use contrary to popular belief to introduce a statement that is the opposite to what is thought to be true by most ordinary people.

If you believe in fairies, ghosts, or miracles, you are sure that they exist or happen. If you believe in a god, you are sure of the existence of that god.
If you believe in a way of life or an idea, you are in favour of it because you think it is good or right.
If you believe in someone or what they are doing, you have confidence in them and think that they will be successful.
trust / depend on / rely on / count on / believe in\nto feel that something is right or valuable; to approve of something\n
it is true, even though it does not sound likely\n

Bellyache is a pain inside your abdomen, especially in your stomach.\nIf you say that someone is bellyaching, you mean they complain loudly and frequently about something and you think this is unreasonable or unjustified.\n

If something or someone belongs in or to a particular category, type, or group, they are of that category, type, or group.

If you say that a time belongs to a particular system or way of doing something, you mean that that time is or will be characterized by it.

If something is below something else, it is in a lower position.
If something is below a particular amount, rate, or level, it is less than that amount, rate, or level.
If someone is below you in an organization, they are lower in rank.
If something is below ground or below the ground, it is in the ground.
You use below in a piece of writing to refer to something that is mentioned later.
If something bemuses you, it puzzles or confuses you.

A bench is a long seat of wood or metal that two or more people can sit on.
A bench is a long, narrow table in a factory or laboratory.
In parliament, different groups sit on different benches. For example, the government sits on the government benches.
In a court of law, the bench is the judge or magistrates.

When you bend, you move the top part of your body downwards and forwards. Plants and trees also bend.

If you bend something that is flat or straight, you use force to make it curved or to put an angle in it.
When a road, beam of light, or other long thin thing bends, or when something bends it, it changes direction to form a curve or angle.
If someone bends to your wishes, they believe or do something different, usually when they do not want to.If you bend rules or laws, you interpret them in a way that allows you to do something they would not normally allow you to do.

Something that is beneath another thing is under the other thing.

If you say that someone or something is beneath you, you feel that they are not good enough for you or not suitable for you.

During the late Ice Age in Europe, they sometimes lived in caves beneath cliffs.

voca.means_en:
If an object is bent, it is damaged and no longer has its correct shape.

If you have a bent for something, you have a natural ability to do it or a natural interest in it.

beside / besides
Something that is beside something else is at the side of it or next to it.
If you are beside yourself with anger or excitement, you are extremely angry or excited.

voca.means_ko: 최상/최고의, 제일 좋은, 가장 알맞은/좋은, 최적의\n가장, 가장 잘/알맞게\n~을 이기다, ~보다 잘 하다
voca.means_en:

To bestow something on someone means to give or present it to them.\n

If you bet on the result of a horse race, football game, or other event, you give someone a sum of money which they give you back with extra money if the result is what you predicted, or which they keep if it is not.
If someone is betting that something will happen, they are hoping or expecting that it will happen.
A bet is a sum of money which you give to someone when you bet.
You use expressions such as 'I bet', 'I'll bet', and 'you can bet' to indicate that you are sure something is true.

cheat / fool / deceive / betray / take in / trick / con

If someone betrays their country or their friends, they give information to an enemy, putting their country's security or their friends' safety at risk.
If you betray an ideal or your principles, you say or do something which goes against those beliefs.

voca.means_ko: 비스듬히 자르다\n사면, 빗각, 각도자\n비스듬한, 사면이 된

a bevel edge

If something is beyond a place or barrier, it is on the other side of it.
If something happens beyond a particular time or date, it continues after that time or date has passed.
If something extends beyond a particular thing, it affects or includes other things.
You use beyond to introduce an exception to what you are saying.
(in a way that is) too great, difficult, etc. to be believed\n
very much\n

If someone is biased, they prefer one group of people to another, and behave unfairly as a result. You can also say that a process or system is biased.\nIf something is biased towards one thing, it is more concerned with it than with other things.\n
A bib is a piece of cloth or plastic which is worn by very young children to protect their clothes while they are eating.\n

voca.means_en:
A bid for something or a bid to do something is an attempt to obtain it or do it.
A bid is an offer to pay a particular amount of money for something that is being sold.
If you bid for something or bid to do something, you try to obtain it or do it.
If you bid for something that is being sold, you offer to pay a particular amount of money for it.

A bidder is someone who offers to pay a certain amount of money for something that is being sold. If you sell something to the highest bidder, you sell it to the person who offers the most money for it\nA bidder for something is someone who is trying to obtain it or do it.\n

voca.means_en: If you bide your time, you wait for a good opportunity before doing something.\n
Bilingual means involving or using two languages.\nSomeone who is bilingual can speak two languages equally well, usually because they learned both languages as a child.\n

bill / statement / account / invoice / tab / check
A bill is a written statement of money that you owe for goods or services.
The bill in a restaurant is a piece of paper on which the price of the meal you have just eaten is written and which you are given before you pay.
A bill is a piece of paper money.
In government, a bill is a formal statement of a proposed new law that is discussed and then voted on.
The bill of a show or concert is a list of the entertainers who will take part in it.
If someone is billed to appear in a particular show, it has been advertised that they are going to be in it.
If you bill a person or event as a particular thing, you advertise them in a way that makes people think they have particular qualities or abilities.
~billed combines with adjectives to indicate that a bird has a beak of a particular kind or appearance.\n
A billion is a thousand million.\nIf you talk about billions of people or things, you mean that there is a very large number of them but you do not know or do not want to say exactly how many.\n

voca.means_en:
When something made of cloth billows, it swells out and moves slowly in the wind.
When smoke or cloud billows, it moves slowly upwards or across the sky.
A billow of smoke or dust is a large mass of it rising slowly into the air.

A bin is a container that you put rubbish in.
A bin is a container that you keep or store things in.
If you bin something, you throw it away.

bind - bound - bound
If something binds people together, it makes them feel as if they are all part of the same group or have something in common.
If you are bound by something such as a rule, agreement, or restriction, you are forced or required to act in a certain way.
If you bind something or someone, you tie rope, string, tape, or other material around them so that they are held firmly.
When a book is bound, the pages are joined together and the cover is put on.

voca.means_en: All the other animals bouned off.\n
to warn somebody that they will have to appear in court if they break the law again\n
short for biography\nBio- is used at the beginning of nouns and adjectives that refer to life or to the study of living things.\n
A biography of someone is an account of their life, written by someone else.\nBiography is the branch of literature which deals with accounts of people's lives.\n
the total number of living organisms in a given area, expressed in terms of living or dry weight per unit area\nvegetable matter used as a source of energy\n
A bird is a creature with feathers and wings. Female birds lay eggs. Most birds can fly.\nSome men refer to young women as birds. This use could cause offence.\n

When a baby is born, you refer to this event as his or her birth.
You can refer to the beginning or origin of something as its birth.
Some people talk about a person's birth when they are referring to the social position of the person's family.
A bison is a large hairy animal with a large head that is a member of the cattle family. They used to be very common in North America and Europe.\n

A bit of something is a small amount of it.
A bit of something is a small part or section of it.
A bit of something is a small piece of it.
You can use bit to refer to a particular item or to one of a group or set of things. For example, a bit of information is an item of information.
In computing, a bit is the smallest unit of information that is held in a computer's memory. It is either 1 or 0. Several bits form a byte.
a small amount at a time; gradually\n

voca.means_en:
bite - bit - bitten
If you bite something, you use your teeth to cut into it, for example in order to eat it or break it. If an animal or person bites you, they use their teeth to hurt or injure you.
If a snake or a small insect bites you, it makes a mark or hole in your skin, and often causes the surrounding area of your skin to become painful or itchy.
When an action or policy begins to bite, it begins to have a serious or harmful effect.
If an object bites into a surface, it presses hard against it or cuts into it.
A bite of something, especially food, is the action of biting it.
If you have a bite to eat, you have a small meal or a snack.
to react when somebody has harmed you and try to harm or criticize them\n
to cut or press into the surface of something\nto have an unpleasant effect on something, especially by making it smaller\n
to stop yourself from saying something or from showing how you feel\n
fail, or be defeated or destroyed\n
force yourself not to express the negative emotions that you are feeling\n
stop yourself from saying something that might upset somebody or cause an argument, although you want to speak\n

voca.means_en: Something that is bizarre is very odd and strange.\n

To blacken something means to make it black or very dark in colour. Something that blackens becomes black or very dark in colour.
If someone blackens your character, they make other people believe that you are a bad person.
He kept going deeper into the smelly blackness.\n

The blade of a knife, axe, or saw is the edge, which is used for cutting.
The blades of a propeller are the long, flat parts that turn round.
The blade of an oar is the thin flat part that you put into the water.
A blade of grass is a single piece of grass.

If you blame a person or thing for something bad, you believe or say that they are responsible for it or that they caused it.
If you say that you do not blame someone for doing something, you mean that you consider it was a reasonable thing to do in the circumstances.
The blame for something bad that has happened is the responsibility for causing it or letting it happen.
If someone is to blame for something bad that has happened, they are responsible for causing it.

Something that is blank has nothing on it.
If you look blank, your face shows no feeling, understanding, or interest.
A blank is a space which is left in a piece of writing or on a printed form for you to fill in particular information.
If your mind or memory is a blank, you cannot think of anything or remember anything.
Blanks are gun cartridges which contain explosive but do not contain a bullet, so that they cause no harm when the gun is fired.
If you draw a blank when you are looking for someone or something, you do not succeed in finding them.
If your mind goes blank, you are suddenly unable to think of anything appropriate to say, for example in reply to a question.
if you blank out or your mind blanks out, you cannot remember anything or you become confused\n

A blanket is a large square or rectangular piece of thick cloth, especially one which you put on a bed to keep you warm.
A blanket of something such as snow is a continuous layer of it which hides what is below or beyond it.
If something such as snow blankets an area, it covers it.
You use blanket to describe something when you want to emphasize that it affects or refers to every person or thing in a group, without any exceptions.

voca.means_en:
A blast is a big explosion, especially one caused by a bomb.
If something is blasted into a particular place or state, an explosion causes it to be in that place or state. If a hole is blasted in something, it is created by an explosion.
If workers are blasting rock, they are using explosives to make holes in it or destroy it, for example so that a road or tunnel can be built.
To blast someone means to shoot them with a gun.
If someone blasts their way somewhere, they get there by shooting at people or causing an explosion.
If something blasts water or air somewhere, it sends out a sudden, powerful stream of it.
if a gun or somebody using a gun blasts away, the gun fires loudly and continuously\n
when a spacecraft blasts off, it leaves the ground and goes up into space\n

voca.means_en:
When a fire blazes, it burns strongly and brightly.
If something blazes with light or colour, it is extremely bright.
If guns blaze, or blaze away, they fire continuously, making a lot of noise.
A blaze is a large fire which is difficult to control and which destroys a lot of things.
A blaze of publicity or attention is a great amount of it.
if a fire blazes up, it suddenly starts burning more strongly\n

If you bleach something, you use a chemical to make it white or pale in colour.
If the sun bleaches something, or something bleaches, its colour gets paler until it is almost white.
Bleach is a chemical that is used to make cloth white, or to clean things thoroughly and kill germs.

When you bleed, you lose blood from your body as a result of injury or illness.
If the colour of one substance bleeds into the colour of another substance that it is touching, it goes into the other thing so that its colour changes in an undesirable way.
If someone is being bled, money or other resources are gradually being taken away from them.
Bleeding is used by some people to emphasize what they are saying, especially when they feel strongly about something or dislike something.\n

voca.means_en:
mix / stir / mingle / blend
If you blend substances together or if they blend, you mix them together so that they become one substance.
When colours, sounds, or styles blend, they come together or are combined in a pleasing way.
If you blend ideas, policies, or styles, you use them together in order to achieve something.
A blend of things is a mixture or combination of them that is useful or pleasant.
if something blends in with something else or with its surroundings, it looks similar to it/them or matches well\n
to look or sound so similar to something that it is difficult for anyone to see or hear it\n
to add another substance to something and mix them together\n

When someone such as a priest blesses people or things, he asks for God's favour and protection for them.\nBless is used in expressions such as `God bless' or `bless you' to express affection, thanks, or good wishes.\nYou can say 'bless you' to someone who has just sneezed.

voca.means_en:
blind / blindly
Someone who is blind is unable to see because their eyes are damaged.
If you are blind with something such as tears or a bright light, you are unable to see for a short time because of the tears or light.
If you say that someone is blind to a fact or a situation, you mean that they ignore it or are unaware of it, although you think that they should take notice of it or be aware of it.
You can describe someone's beliefs or actions as blind when you think that they seem to take no notice of important facts or behave in an unreasonable way.
A blind corner is one that you cannot see round because something is blocking your view.
If something blinds you, it makes you unable to see, either for a short time or permanently.
extremely drunk\n
blind / blindly\nIf you say that someone does something blindly, you mean that they do it without having enough information, or without thinking about it.\n
When you blink or when you blink your eyes, you shut your eyes and very quickly open them again.\nWhen a light blinks, it flashes on and off.\n

A blister is a painful swelling on the surface of your skin. Blisters contain a clear liquid and are usually caused by heat or by something repeatedly rubbing your skin.\nWhen your skin blisters or when something blisters it, blisters appear on it.\n
A blizzard is a very bad snowstorm with strong winds.\n

voca.means_en:
building / property / premises / complex / structure / block / edifice
A block of flats or offices is a large building containing them.
A block in a town is an area of land with streets on all its sides.
A block of a substance is a large rectangular piece of it.
A block of something such as tickets or shares is a large quantity of them, especially when they are all sold at the same time and are in a particular sequence or order.
If you have a mental block or a block, you are temporarily unable to do something that you can normally do which involves using, thinking about, or remembering something.
To block a road, channel, or pipe means to put an object across it or in it so that nothing can pass through it or along it.
If something blocks your view, it prevents you from seeing something because it is between you and that thing.
If you block someone's way, you prevent them from going somewhere or entering a place by standing in front of them.
to stop a vehicle from being driven away by parking too close to it\n
to close a road or another place by placing a barrier across it to stop somebody/something going in or coming out\nto reserve a period of time for a particular activity\n
to fill something such as a hole completely so that nothing can get through it\n
"I told you our blood would boil if we went out there" he said.\n

A bloom is the flower on a plant.
If something such as someone's skin has a bloom, it has a fresh and healthy appearance.
A plant or tree that is in bloom has flowers on it.
When a plant or tree blooms, it produces flowers. When a flower blooms, it opens.
If someone or something blooms, they develop good, attractive, or successful qualities.

Blossom is the flowers that appear on a tree before the fruit.
If someone or something blossoms, they develop good, attractive, or successful qualities.
When a tree blossoms, it produces blossom.

If something is a blot on a person's or thing's reputation, it spoils their reputation.
A blot is a drop of liquid that has fallen on to a surface and has dried.
If you blot a surface, you remove liquid from it by pressing a piece of soft paper or cloth onto it.

When a wind or breeze blows, the air moves.
If the wind blows something somewhere or if it blows there, the wind moves it there.
If you blow, you send out a stream of air from your mouth.
If you blow something somewhere, you move it by sending out a stream of air from your mouth.
If you blow bubbles or smoke rings, you make them by blowing air out of your mouth through liquid or smoke.
When a whistle or horn blows or someone blows it, they make a sound by blowing into it.
When you blow your nose, you force air out of it through your nostrils in order to clear it.
to permit (a gas under pressure, esp steam) to be released\n

if a window blows out, or an explosion, etc. blows it out, the force makes it fall out
(in surfing) if the waves blow out or the wind blows out the waves, they become too low for surfing in a particular place

Something that is bluish is slightly blue in colour.\n

honest / frank / direct / open / outspoken / straight / blunt
If you are blunt, you say exactly what you think without trying to be polite.
A blunt object has a rounded or flat end rather than a sharp one.
A blunt knife or blade is no longer sharp and does not cut well.
If something blunts an emotion, a feeling or a need, it weakens it.

A blur is a shape or area which you cannot see clearly because it has no distinct outline or because it is moving very fast.
When a thing blurs or when something blurs it, you cannot see it clearly because its edges are no longer distinct.
If something blurs an idea or a distinction between things, that idea or distinction no longer seems clear.
If your vision blurs, or if something blurs it, you cannot see things clearly.
He peeked through a crack in the barrel and saw a blur of cowboys and horses go by.
A blurry shape is one that has an unclear outline.\n

If someone boasts about something that they have done or that they own, they talk about it very proudly, in a way that other people may find irritating or offensive.\nIf someone or something can boast a particular achievement or possession, they have achieved or possess that thing.\n

When you bob your head, you move it quickly up and down once, for example when you greet someone.
A bob is a fairly short hair style for women in which the hair is the same length all the way round, except for the front.
to come to the surface quickly\nto appear suddenly\n
If a woman's hair is bobbed, it is cut in a bob.\n

Your body is all your physical parts, including your head, arms, and legs.
You can also refer to the main part of your body, except for your arms, head, and legs, as your body.
You can refer to a person's dead body as a body.
A body is an organized group of people who deal with something officially.
A body of people is a group of people who are together or who are connected in some way.
The body of something such as a building or a document is the main part of it or the largest part of it.
physically and mentally; completely\n

When a hot liquid boils or when you boil it, bubbles appear in it and it starts to change into steam or vapour.

When a kettle or pan is boiling, the water inside it has reached boiling point.
When you boil food, or when it boils, it is cooked in boiling water.
If you are boiling with anger, you are very angry.

if anger, an argument, etc. boils up, it starts to become stronger or more violent\n

Someone who is bold is not afraid to do things which involve risk or danger.
Someone who is bold is not shy or embarrassed in the company of other people.
A bold colour or pattern is very bright and noticeable.
Bold lines or designs are drawn in a clear, strong way.
Bold is print which is thicker and looks blacker than ordinary printed letters.

voca.means_en:
A bond between people is a strong feeling of friendship, love, or shared beliefs and experiences that unites them.
A bond between people or groups is a close connection that they have with each other, for example because they have a special agreement.
When people bond with each other, they form a relationship based on love or shared beliefs and experiences. You can also say that people bond or that something bonds them.
When a government or company issues a bond, it borrows money from investors. The certificate which is issued to investors who lend money is also called a bond.
When one thing bonds with another, it sticks to it or becomes joined to it in some way. You can also say that two things bond together, or that something bonds them together.
The bond between a mare and her young is very strong.

Your bones are the hard parts inside your body which together form your skeleton.
If you bone a piece of meat or fish, you remove the bones from it before cooking it.
A bone tool or ornament is made of bone.
The bare bones of something are its most basic parts or details.
A bonfire is a fire that is made outdoors, usually to burn rubbish. Bonfires are also sometimes lit as part of a celebration.\n

voca.means_en: A bookcase is a piece of furniture with shelves that you keep books on.\n
A bookkeeper is a person whose job is to keep an accurate record of the money that is spent and received by a business or other organization.\n
A booklet is a small book that has a paper cover and that gives you information about something.\n

voca.means_ko:
[부움]
(사업, 경제의) 붐, 호황, 갑작스런 인기
울리다, 울려 퍼지다, 굉음을 내며 돌진하다
갑자기 유명해지다
(큰 소리를 내어) 알리다, 큰 소리로 말하다
voca.means_en:
If there is a boom in the economy, there is an increase in economic activity, for example in the amount of things that are being bought and sold.
A boom in something is an increase in its amount, frequency, or success.
On a boat, the boom is the long pole which is attached to the bottom of the sail and to the mast and which you move when you want to alter the direction in which you are sailing.
If the economy or a business is booming, the amount of things being bought or sold is increasing.
When something such as someone's voice, a cannon, or a big drum booms, it makes a loud, deep sound that lasts for several seconds.
A booming snore shattered the air.

voca.means_ko: ~을 밀어올리다, ~을 끌어올리다, 신장시키다\n밀어올리기, 상승, 증가, 응원, 후원, 격려
voca.means_en: If one thing boosts another, it causes it to increase, improve, or be more successful.\nIf something boosts your confidence or morale, it improves it.\n

Boots are shoes that cover your whole foot and the lower part of your leg.
Boots are strong, heavy shoes which cover your ankle and which have thick soles. You wear them to protect your feet, for example when you are walking or taking part in sport.
The boot of a car is a covered space at the back or front, in which you carry things such as luggage and shopping.
If you boot something such as a ball, you kick it hard.
If you get the boot or are given the boot, you are told that you are not wanted any more, either in your job or by someone you are having a relationship with.
Booty is a collection of valuable things stolen from a place, especially by soldiers after a battle.\n
Booze is alcoholic drink.\nIf people booze, they drink alcohol.\n

voca.means_ko:
[보r더r]
국경, 경계
(사진, 옷감 등의) 가장자리, 
~에 접하다, 이웃하다, 가장자리를 이루다
voca.means_en:
border / boundary / line / frontier
The border between two countries or regions is the dividing line between them. Sometimes the border also refers to the land close to this line.
A border is a strip or band around the edge of something.
In a garden, a border is a long strip of ground along the edge planted with flowers.
A country that borders another country, a sea, or a river is next to it.
If something is bordered by another thing, the other thing forms a line along the edge of it.

voca.means_ko: ~에 아주 가깝다, 거의 ~와 같다\n~의 옆/인근에 있다
voca.means_en: to share a border with another country or region; to be next to a place\nto come close to being something\n

without a band or margin around or along the edge
not divided by a national border
without limits
not constrained by the presence of international borders

voca.means_ko: 이쪽도 저쪽도 아닌, 경계선상의\n(두 가지 성격, 조건 사이의) 경계
voca.means_en: The borderline between two different or opposite things is the division between them.\nSomething that is borderline is only just acceptable as a member of a class or group.\n

voca.means_ko: ~에 구멍을 뚫다, 지루하게 하다\n구멍, 시추공, 지루하게 하는 사람

voca.means_en:
When a baby is born, it comes out of its mother's body at the beginning of its life. In formal English, if you say that someone is born of someone or to someone, you mean that person is their parent.
If someone is born with a particular disease, problem, or characteristic, they have it from the time they are born.
You can use be born in front of a particular name to show that a person was given this name at birth, although they may be better known by another name.
You use born to describe someone who has a natural ability to do a particular activity or job. For example, if you are a born cook, you have a natural ability to cook well.
born and brought up (in a place)\n

voca.means_ko:
[버로우]
빌리다, 빚지다
(돈을) 꾸다, 빌리다
(어휘, 사상 등을) 차용하다
voca.means_en:
borrow / lend
If you borrow something that belongs to someone else, you take it or use it for a period of time, usually with their permission.
If you borrow money from someone or from a bank, they give it to you and you agree to pay it back at some time in the future.
If you borrow a book from a library, you take it away for a fixed period of time.
If you borrow something such as a word or an idea from another language or from another person's work, you use it in your own language or work.
Someone who is living on borrowed time or who is on borrowed time has continued to live or to do something for longer than was expected, and is likely to die or be stopped from doing it soon.

Your boss is the person in charge of the organization or department where you work.
If you are the boss in a group or relationship, you are the person who makes all the decisions.
If you say that someone bosses you, you mean that they keep telling you what to do in a way that is irritating.
If you describe someone as bossy, you mean that they enjoy telling people what to do.\n

voca.means_ko: 괴롭히다, 귀찮게 하다, 성가시게 하다\n걱정하다, 괴로워하다, 신경쓰다\n골칫거리, 귀찮은 일
voca.means_en:
If you do not bother to do something or if you do not bother with it, you do not do it, consider it, or use it because you think it is unnecessary or because you are too lazy.
If something bothers you, or if you bother about it, it worries, annoys, or upsets you.
If someone bothers you, they talk to you when you want to be left alone or interrupt you when you are busy.
Bother means trouble or difficulty. You can also use bother to refer to an activity which causes this, especially when you would prefer not to do it or get involved with it.
"I don't think so..." something bothered Jack.

A bottle is a glass or plastic container in which drinks and other liquids are kept. Bottles are usually round with straight sides and a narrow top.
A bottle is a drinking container used by babies. It has a special rubber part at the top through which they can suck their drink.
To bottle a drink or other liquid means to put it into bottles after it has been made.
not do something, or not finish something, because you are frightened\n
to suddenly decide not to do something because you are too frightened\n
to keep your feelings, especially sadness or anger, hidden and not tell other people how you are feeling\n

bottom / base / foundation / foot
The bottom of something is the lowest or deepest part of it.
The bottom of an object is the flat surface at its lowest point. You can also refer to the inside or outside of this surface as the bottom.
If you say that the bottom has dropped or fallen out of a market or industry, you mean that people have stopped buying the products it sells.
The bottom of a street or garden is the end farthest away from you or from your house.
The bottom of a table is the end farthest away from where you are sitting. The bottom of a bed is the end where you usually rest your feet.
The bottom of an organization or career structure is the lowest level in it, where new employees often start.
if markets, prices or bad situations bottom out, they reach their lowest point and then stop getting worse\n
A boulevard is a wide street in a city, usually with trees along each side.\n

voca.means_ko:
[바운d]
튀어오르다, 튀다, 깡충깡충 달리다
뛰어오르기, 도약, 범위, 경계
꼭 ~할것 같은, 꼭 ~하는, ~할 가능성이 큰
묶인, 구속된, ~할 의무가 있는,
voca.means_en:
certain / bound / sure / definite / as sured
Bounds are limits which normally restrict what can happen or what people can do.
A bound is a long or high jump.
If an area of land is bounded by something, that thing is situated around its edge.
If someone's life or situation is bounded by certain things, those are its most important aspects and it is limited or restricted by them.
If a person or animal bounds in a particular direction, they move quickly with large steps or jumps.
If you say that a feeling or quality knows no bounds, you are emphasizing that it is very strong or intense.
If a place is out of bounds, people are not allowed to go there.

border / boundary / line / frontier
The boundary of an area of land is an imaginary line that separates it from other areas.
The boundaries of something such as a subject or activity are the limits that people think that it has.
A bouquet is a bunch of flowers which is attractively arranged.\nThe bouquet of something, especially wine, is the pleasant smell that it has.\n

When you bow to someone, you briefly bend your body towards them as a formal way of greeting them or showing respect.
If you bow your head, you bend it downwards so that you are looking towards the ground, for example because you want to show respect or because you are thinking deeply about something.
A bow is a knot with two loops and two loose ends that is used in tying shoelaces and ribbons.
A bow is a weapon for shooting arrows which consists of a long piece of curved wood with a string attached to both its ends.
The bow of a violin or other stringed instrument is a long thin piece of wood with fibres stretched along it, which you move across the strings of the instrument in order to play it.
The front part of a ship is called the bow or the bows. The plural bows can be used to refer either to one or to more than one of these parts.
be too polite to somebody important in order to gain their approval\n
A bow tie is a tie in the form of a bow. Bow ties are worn by men, especially for formal occasions.\n

voca.means_ko: 떠받치다, 보강하다, 중괄호로 묶다\n버팀목, 치열 교정기
voca.means_en:
If you brace yourself for something unpleasant or difficult, you prepare yourself for it.
If you brace yourself against something or brace part of your body against it, you press against something in order to steady your body or to avoid falling.
If you brace your shoulders or knees, you keep them stiffly in a particular position.
You can refer to two things of the same kind as a brace of that thing. The plural form is also brace.
A brace is a device attached to a part of a person's body, for example to a weak leg, in order to strengthen or support it.

voca.means_ko: 꼬다, 땋다, 매다, 묶다\n땋아 늘인 머리, 끈
voca.means_en: They made ropes by braiding plant fibers.\nMorgan tugged on one of Annie's braids.\n

Your brain is the organ inside your head that controls your body's activities and enables you to think and to feel things such as heat and pain.
Your brain is your mind and the way that you think.
If someone has brains or a good brain, they have the ability to learn and understand things quickly, to solve problems, and to make good decisions.
If someone is the brains behind an idea or an organization, he or she had that idea or makes the important decisions about how that organization is managed.
If you brainwash someone, you force them to believe something by continually telling them that it is true, and preventing them from thinking about it properly.\n
The bratty monkey was back.\n

Someone who is brave is willing to do things which are dangerous, and does not show fear in difficult or dangerous situations.
If you brave unpleasant or dangerous conditions, you deliberately expose yourself to them, usually in order to achieve something.
If someone is putting on a brave face or is putting a brave face on a difficult situation, they are pretending that they are happy or satisfied when they are not.
When a donkey brays, it makes a loud harsh sound.\n

Bread is a very common food made from flour, water, and yeast.\nIf food such as fish or meat is breaded, it is covered in tiny pieces of dry bread called breadcrumbs. It can then be fried or grilled.\n

The breadth of something is the distance between its two sides.
The breadth of something is its quality of consisting of or involving many different things.
If you say that someone does something or something happens throughout or across the length and breadth of a place, you are emphasizing that it happens everywhere in that place.

voca.means_ko:
[b뤠익k]
부수다, 중단하다
고장나다, (법, 약속을) 어기다, 
파괴, 틈, 중단, 휴식
voca.means_en:
break - broke - broken
When an object breaks or when you break it, it suddenly separates into two or more pieces, often because it has been hit or dropped.
If you break a part of your body such as your leg, your arm, or your nose, or if a bone breaks, you are injured because a bone cracks or splits.
If a surface, cover, or seal breaks or if something breaks it, a hole or tear is made in it, so that a substance can pass through.
When a tool or piece of machinery breaks or when you break it, it is damaged and no longer works.
If you break a rule, promise, or agreement, you do something that you should not do according to that rule, promise, or agreement.
If you break free or loose, you free yourself from something or escape from it.
If someone breaks something, especially a difficult or unpleasant situation that has existed for some time, they end it or change it.

voca.means_ko: 고장나다, 실패하다, 아주 나빠지다\n무너지다, 절연 파괴되다

voca.means_en: to enter a building illegally or by force\n(on something) to interrupt somebody when they are speaking or doing something\n

if something unpleasant such as a fire, a war, etc. breaks out, it starts suddenly
(break out of something) to escape from a place or from a situation
if something breaks out on your skin, your skin becomes covered in something

voca.means_ko: ~을 길들이다, 훈련시키다\n(특히 새 신을) 길을 들이다
voca.means_en:
if you break in new shoes or boots, you wear them until they become comfortable
(in the past) to prepare the engine of a new car for normal use by driving it slowly and carefully
to train a person so that they get used to a new job or situation; to train a horse so that you can ride it
use a lot of physical effort\n

voca.means_ko: (무력으로 ~을) 뚫고 나아가다, 돌파하다\n돌파구를 찾다\n(해, 달이 구름 뒤에서) 나타나다
voca.means_en: to make a way through a barrier using force\nto appear from behind something\n
to become greater in size or quantity than a particular level\nto succeed in dealing with a problem, such as an attitude that somebody has\n

voca.means_ko: 부서지다, 끝이 나다, 파하다\n(휴대전화의 통화가) 끊기다

voca.means_en: Breakfast is the first meal of the day. It is usually eaten in the early part of the morning.\nWhen you breakfast, you have breakfast.\n

voca.means_ko:
[b뤠st]
가슴, 유방, 가슴살
(꼭데기에) 오르다
가슴으로 받다, 가슴으로 밀다, 
~을 향햐여 가슴을 내밀다
voca.means_en:
A woman's breasts are the two soft, round parts on her chest that can produce milk to feed a baby.
A person's breast is the upper part of his or her chest.
A bird's breast is the front part of its body.
The breast of a shirt, jacket, or coat is the part which covers the top part of the chest.
You can refer to piece of meat that is cut from the front of a bird or lamb as breast.
Breaststroke is a swimming stroke which you do lying on your front, moving your arms and legs horizontally in a circular motion.\n

Your breath is the air that you let out through your mouth when you breathe. If someone has bad breath, their breath smells unpleasant.
When you take a breath, you breathe in once.
"Oh man" he breathed.

When people or animals breathe, they take air into their lungs and let it out again. When they breathe smoke or a particular kind of air, they take it into their lungs and let it out again as they breathe.
If someone breathes something, they say it very quietly.
If you do not breathe a word about something, you say nothing about it, because it is a secret.
If someone breathes life, confidence, or excitement into something, they improve it by adding this quality.
to take air into your lungs through your nose or mouth\n
to send air out of your lungs through your nose or mouth\n

voca.means_ko:
[b뤠쓰뤠s]
숨이 가쁜, 숨을 가쁘게 하는
(격한 감정으로) 숨을 쉴수 없는, 숨이 막힐 듯 한
voca.means_en: If you are breathless, you have difficulty in breathing properly, for example because you have been running or because you are afraid or excited.\nYou use breathless for emphasis when you are describing feelings of excitement or exciting situations.\n

voca.means_ko: [b뤼-d]\n(새끼를) 낳다, 기르다, 사육하다\n품종, 종족, 혈통, 종류, 유형
voca.means_en:
A breed of a pet animal or farm animal is a particular type of it. For example, terriers are a breed of dog.
You can refer to someone or something as one of a particular breed of person or thing when you want to talk about what they are like.
If you breed animals or plants, you keep them for the purpose of producing more animals or plants with particular qualities, in a controlled way.
When animals breed, they have babies.
If you say that something breeds bad feeling or bad behaviour, you mean that it causes bad feeling or bad behaviour to develo

A breeze is a gentle wind.
If you breeze into a place or a position, you enter it in a very casual or relaxed manner.
If you breeze through something such as a game or test, you cope with it easily.

If you brew tea or coffee, you make it by pouring hot water over tea leaves or ground coffee.
If a person or company brews beer, they make it.
If a storm is brewing, large clouds are beginning to form and the sky is becoming dark because there is going to be a storm.
If an unpleasant or difficult situation is brewing, it is starting to develop.
A brew is a particular kind of tea or coffee. It can also be a particular pot of tea or coffee.
to prepare a hot drink of tea or coffee\n
A bribe is a sum of money or something valuable that one person offers or gives to another in order to persuade him or her to do something.\nIf one person bribes another, they give them a bribe.\n
Bricks are rectangular blocks of baked clay used for building walls, which are usually red or brown. Brick is the material made up of these blocks.\n
A bride is a woman who is getting married or who has just got married.\n

A bridge is a structure that is built over a railway, river, or road so that people or vehicles can cross from one side to the other.
A bridge between two places is a piece of land that joins or connects them.
If something or someone acts as a bridge between two people, groups, or things, they connect them.
The bridge is the place on a ship from which it is steered.
To bridge the gap between two people or things means to reduce it or get rid of it.

voca.means_ko:
[b뤼-f]
(시간이) 짧은, 잠시 동안의, 잠시의, 짧은, 
(말, 글이) 간단한, 간결한
요약하다, 개요를 알리다
간결한 문서, 개요, 요약서
voca.means_en:
Something that is brief lasts for only a short time.
A brief speech or piece of writing does not contain too many words or details.
If you are brief, you say what you want to say in as few words as possible.
You can describe a period of time as brief if you want to emphasize that it is very short.
Men's or women's underpants can be referred to as briefs.
If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it.
A briefcase is a case used for carrying documents in.\n

voca.means_ko:
[b롸잇t]
(빛이) 밝은, 눈부신, 빛나는, 
선명한, 영리한, 똑똑한
밝게, 환히
voca.means_en:
bright / brilliant / fluorescent / luminous / vivid / vibrant
A bright colour is strong and noticeable, and not dark.
A bright light, object, or place is shining strongly or is full of light.
If you describe someone as bright, you mean that they are quick at learning things.
A bright idea is clever and original.
If someone looks or sounds bright, they look or sound cheerful and lively.

bright / brilliant / fluorescent / luminous / vivid / vibrant
A brilliant person, idea, or performance is extremely clever or skilful.
You can say that something is brilliant when you are very pleased about it or think that it is very good.
A brilliant career or success is very successful.

voca.means_ko:
[b륑]
가져오다, 데려오다, 가져다 주다/제공하다
(특정 방향, 방식으로) 움직이게 하다
기소/고발 하다
(간신히) ~을 하다
voca.means_en:
bring - brought - brought
If you bring someone or something with you when you come to a place, they come with you or you have them with you.
If you bring something somewhere, you move it there.
If you bring something that someone wants or needs, you get it for them or carry it to them.
To bring something or someone to a place or position means to cause them to come to the place or move into that position.
If you bring something new to a place or group of people, you introduce it to that place or cause those people to hear or know about it.
To bring someone or something into a particular state or condition means to cause them to be in that state or condition.
If something brings a particular feeling, situation, or quality, it makes people experience it or have it.

voca.means_ko:
갖고/데리고 나가다, 
판매 개시하다, 출판하다, 
(의미를) 분명히 하다
(재능을) 발휘하다

voca.means_en: (on something) to get somebody involved in something, especially to advise or help, etc.\nif the police bring somebody in, they take them to a police station to question them or arrest them\n

voca.means_ko: ~을 줄이다/낮추다\n(항공기를) 착륙시키다, 격추하다\n(짐승, 새를) 거꾸러뜨리다, 떨어뜨리다
voca.means_en: to make something smaller in size or amount\nto make an aircraft land\n
to manage to do something difficult successfully\n
to make something unpleasant happen\n

to move something from a lower to a higher position
to mention a subject and start to talk about it
(to something) to increase a total, a price, a number, etc. to a higher level or amount
to bring food from the stomach back out through the mouth

voca.means_ko: ~을 기르다, 훈육하다, 가르치다,\n 내놓다, 제출하다, 투입하다
voca.means_en: to care for a child until he/she is grown up; to teach a child a particular way to behave, etc.\n

voca.means_ko: 처음으로 입밖에 내다, ~에 구멍을 뚫다\n쇠꼬챙이, 송곳

voca.means_en:
wide / broad
Something that is broad is wide.
A broad smile is one in which your mouth is stretched very wide because you are very pleased or amused.
You use broad to describe a feeling or opinion that is shared by many people, or by people of many different kinds.
If you describe someone as broad-minded, you approve of them because they are willing to accept types of behaviour which other people consider immoral.\n

A broadcast is a programme, performance, or speech on the radio or on television.\nTo broadcast a programme means to send it out by radio waves, so that it can be heard on the radio or seen on television.\n
In the western United States, especially in the 19th century, a wild horse was sometimes referred to as a bronco.\nIt bucked like a bronco.\n

Bronze is a yellowish-brown metal which is a mixture of copper and tin.
A bronze is a bronze medal.
Something that is bronze is yellowish-brown in colour.
A brook is a small stream.\nIf someone in a position of authority will brook no interference or opposition, they will not accept any interference or opposition from others.\n
A broom is a kind of brush with a long handle. You use a broom for sweeping the floor.\nBroom is a wild bush with a lot of tiny yellow flowers.\n

voca.means_ko: [b뤄더r]\n형, 오빠, 남동생, \n(같은 단체의) 형제, 수도사, 수사
voca.means_en:
Your brother is a boy or a man who has the same parents as you.
You can describe a man as your brother if he belongs to the same race, religion, country,
Brothers is used in the names of some companies and shops.
Brother is a title given to a man who belongs to a religious community such as a monastery.
A man's brotherly feelings are feelings of love and loyalty which you expect a brother to show.\n

If you browse in a shop, you look at things in a fairly casual way, in the hope that you might find something you like.
If you browse through a book or magazine, you look through it in a fairly casual way.
If you browse on a computer, you search for information in computer files or on the Internet, especially on the World Wide Web.

voca.means_ko:
[b루-z]
타박상을 입히다, 멍들게 하다
의기소침하게 만들다, 마음의 상처를 주다
타박상, 상처, 흠, 멍
voca.means_en:
injure / wound / hurt / bruise / maim / sprain / pull / twist / strain
A bruise is an injury which appears as a purple mark on your body, although the skin is not broken.
If you bruise a part of your body, a bruise appears on it, for example because something hits you. If you bruise easily, bruises appear when something hits you only slightly.
If a fruit, vegetable, or plant bruises or is bruised, it is damaged by being handled roughly, making a mark on the skin.
If you are bruised by an unpleasant experience, it makes you feel unhappy or upset.

voca.means_ko:
[b뤄쉬]
솔, 붓질, 화법, 
덤블이 우거진 땅, 여우의 꼬리
(~의 위에) 가볍게 닿음/스침
솔질하다, 이를 닦다, 머리를 빗질하다
~을 스치다, 스치듯 지나가다
voca.means_en:
A brush is an object which has a large number of bristles or hairs fixed to it. You use brushes for painting, for cleaning things, and for tidying your hair.
If you have a brush with someone, you have an argument or disagreement with them. You use brush when you want to make an argument or disagreement sound less serious than it really is.
If you have a brush with a particular situation, usually an unpleasant one, you almost experience it.
Brush is an area of rough open land covered with small bushes and trees. You also use brush to refer to the bushes and trees on this land.
If you brush something or brush something such as dirt off it, you clean it or tidy it using a brush.
If you brush something with a liquid, you apply a layer of that liquid using a brush.
If one thing brushes against another or if you brush one thing against another, the first thing touches the second thing lightly while passing it.

voca.means_ko: (대규모의 산불과 구분해서)\n관목/잡목 지대의 화제, 소규모의 전투

If you call someone, usually a man, a brute, you mean that they are rough, violent, and insensitive.
When you refer to brute strength or force, you are contrasting it with gentler methods or qualities.
"Or we'll be meat for those evil brutes!"

voca.means_en:
A buck is a US or Australian dollar.
A buck is the male of various animals, including the deer, antelope, rabbit and kangaroo.
If a horse bucks, it kicks both of its back legs wildly into the air, or jumps into the air wildly with all four feet off the ground.
If you buck the trend, you obtain different results from others in the same area. If you buck the system, you get what you want by breaking or ignoring the rules.
If you get more bang for the buck, you spend your money wisely and get more for your money than if you were to spend it in a different way.
It bucked like a bronco.
to become, or to make somebody, more cheerful\nused to tell somebody to hurry up\n
Buckskin is soft, strong leather made from the skin of a deer or a goat.\n

On a train, the buffet or the buffet car is the carriage or car where meals and snacks are sold.
If something is buffeted by strong winds or by stormy seas, it is repeatedly struck or blown around by them.

voca.means_en:
You can refer to something's bulk when you want to emphasize that it is very large.
You can refer to a large person's body or to their weight or size as their bulk.
The bulk of something is most of it.
Bulky white suits hung from hangers.\n

voca.means_ko: [부울-]\n황소, 코끼리(고래 및 큰 동물)의 수컷\n교황의 칙령/칙서
voca.means_en:
A bull is a male animal of the cow family.
Some other male animals, including elephants and whales, are called bulls.
On the stock market, bulls are people who buy shares in expectation of a price rise, in order to make a profit by selling the shares again after a short time. Compare bear.
If you say that something is bull or a load of bull, you mean that it is complete nonsense or absolutely untrue.
If you take the bull by the horns, you do something that you feel you ought to do even though it is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant.
A bullet is a small piece of metal with a pointed or rounded end, which is fired out of a gun.\nIf someone bites the bullet, they accept that they have to do something unpleasant but necessary.\n

voca.means_en:
A bulletin is a short news report on the radio or television.
A bulletin is a short official announcement made publicly to inform people about an important matter.
A bulletin is a regular newspaper or leaflet that is produced by an organization or group such as a school or church.

voca.means_en:
A bully is someone who uses their strength or power to hurt or frighten other people.
If someone bullies you, they use their strength or power to hurt or frighten you.
"Leave him alone, you bully!" she cried.

Annie drove the moon buggy over bumps and hollows.
