voca.means_en:
A bunch of people is a group of people who share one or more characteristics or who are doing something together.
A bunch of flowers is a number of flowers with their stalks held or tied together.
A bunch of bananas or grapes is a group of them growing on the same stem.
A bunch of keys is a set of keys kept together on a metal ring.
A bunch of things is a number of things, especially a large number.

voca.means_en:
A bundle of things is a number of them that are tied together or wrapped in a cloth or bag so that they can be carried or stored.
If you describe someone as, for example, a bundle of fun, you are emphasizing that they are full of fun. If you describe someone as a bundle of nerves, you are emphasizing that they are very nervous.
If you refer to a bundle of things, you are emphasizing that there is a wide range of them.
If someone is bundled somewhere, someone pushes them there in a rough and hurried way.
To bundle software means to sell it together with a computer, or with other hardware or software, as part of a set.
to make somebody feel warmer by putting warm clothes on them or covering them with blankets\n

voca.means_en:
If you describe a problem or a responsibility as a burden, you mean that it causes someone a lot of difficulty, worry, or hard work.
A burden is a heavy load that is difficult to carry.
If someone burdens you with something that is likely to worry you, for example a problem or a difficult decision, they tell you about it.

if a building burns down, or somebody burns it down, it is destroyed by fire\nif a fire burns down, it becomes less strong and burns with smaller flames\n

voca.means_en: to stop burning because there is no more fuel\nif a machine or part of a machine burns out or somebody/something burns it out, it stops working because it has been used too much or has got too hot\n

if a fire burns up, it gets stronger and has larger flames

If something bursts or if you burst it, it suddenly breaks open or splits open and the air or other substance inside it comes out.
If a dam bursts, or if something bursts it, it breaks apart because the force of the river is too great.
When a door or lid bursts open, it opens very suddenly and violently because someone pushes it or there is great pressure behind it.
A burst of something is a sudden short period of it.
By the time they got to the white dome, he was ready to burst.

open suddenly or violently; make something open in this way.\nThe door burst open.\n

voca.means_en:
To bury something means to put it into a hole in the ground and cover it up with earth.
To bury a dead person means to put their body into a grave and cover it with earth.
If someone says they have buried one of their relatives, they mean that one of their relatives has died.
If you bury something under a large quantity of things, you put it there, often in order to hide it.
If something buries a place or person, it falls on top of them so that it completely covers them and often harms them in some way.
If you bury your head or face in something, you press your head or face against it, often because you are unhappy.
He found a picture of pirate burying a treasure chest.

voca.means_en:
Business is work relating to the production, buying, and selling of goods or services.
Business is used when talking about how many products or services a company is able to sell. If business is good, a lot of products or services are being sold and if business is bad, few of them are being sold.
A business is an organization which produces and sells goods or which provides a service.
Business is work or some other activity that you do as part of your job and not for pleasure.
You can use business to refer to a particular area of work or activity in which the aim is to make a profit.
You can use business to refer to something that you are doing or concerning yourself with.
You can use business to refer to important matters that you have to deal with.

If someone is busted, the police arrest them.
If police bust a place, they go to it in order to arrest people who are doing something illegal.
A company or fund that is bust has no money left and has been forced to close down.
A bust is a statue of the head and shoulders of a person.

If you say that someone is busy thinking or worrying about something, you mean that it is taking all their attention, often to such an extent that they are unable to think about anything else.

When a telephone line is busy, you cannot make your call because the line is already being used by someone else.
If you busy yourself with something, you occupy yourself by dealing with it.

A butcher is a shopkeeper who cuts up and sells meat. Some butchers also kill animals for meat and make foods such as sausages and meat pies.
You can refer to someone as a butcher when they have killed a lot of people in a very cruel way, and you want to express your horror and disgust.
A butcher or a butcher's is a shop where meat is sold.
To butcher an animal means to kill it and cut it up for meat.
You can say that someone has butchered people when they have killed a lot of people in a very cruel way, and you want to express your horror and disgust.

If something buzzes or buzzes somewhere, it makes a long continuous sound, like the noise a bee makes when it is flying.
If people are buzzing around, they are moving around quickly and busily.
If questions or ideas are buzzing around your head, or if your head is buzzing with questions or ideas, you are thinking about a lot of things, often in a confused way.
If a place is buzzing with activity or conversation, there is a lot of activity or conversation there, especially because something important or exciting is about to happen.
If an aircraft buzzes a place, it flies low over it, usually in a threatening way.
You can use buzz to refer to a long continuous sound, usually caused by lots of people talking at once.
to let somebody enter a building by opening the door using an electronic device\n
used to tell somebody, not very politely, to go away\n
in a way that is not planned or organized\n

A cabbage is a round vegetable with white, green or purple leaves that is usually eaten cooked.\n

A cabin is a small room in a ship or boat.
A cabin is one of the areas inside a plane.
A cabin is a small wooden house, especially one in an area of forests or mountains.

voca.means_en: A cabinet is a cupboard used for storing things such as medicine or alcoholic drinks or for displaying decorative things in.\nThe Cabinet is a group of the most senior ministers in a government, who meet regularly to discuss policies.\n
If someone cackles, they laugh in a loud unpleasant way, often at something bad that happens to someone else.\n
A cactus is a thick fleshy plant that grows in many hot, dry parts of the world. Cacti have no leaves and many of them are covered in prickles.\n
A Caesarean or a Caesarean section is an operation in which a baby is lifted out of a woman's womb through an opening cut in her abdomen.\n
A cage is a structure of wire or metal bars in which birds or animals are kept.\nIf someone rattles your cage, they do something which is intended to make you feel nervous.\n
If you calculate a number or amount, you discover it from information that you already have, by using arithmetic, mathematics, or a special machine.\n
Calculus is a branch of advanced mathematics which deals with variable quantities.\n

A calf is a young cow.
Some other young animals, including elephants and whales, are called calves.
Your calf is the thick part at the back of your leg, between your ankle and your knee.
to visit somebody for a short time\nto ask somebody in a class, etc. to answer a question or give their opinion\n

calm / calmness
A calm person does not show or feel any worry, anger, or excitement.
If someone says that a place is calm, they mean that it is free from fighting or public disorder, when trouble has recently occurred there or had been expected.
A camel is a large animal that lives in deserts and is used for carrying goods and people. Camels have long necks and one or two lumps on their backs called humps.\n

hide / conceal / cover / disguise / mask / camouflage
Camouflage consists of things such as leaves, branches, or brown and green paint, which are used to make it difficult for an enemy to see military forces and equipment.
If military buildings or vehicles are camouflaged, things such as leaves, branches, or brown and green paint are used to make it difficult for an enemy to see them.
This is called camouflage.

voca.means_en:
A camp is a collection of huts and other buildings that is provided for a particular group of people, such as refugees, prisoners, or soldiers, as a place to live or stay.
A camp is an outdoor area with buildings, tents, or caravans where people stay on holiday.
A camp is a collection of tents or caravans where people are living or staying, usually temporarily while they are travelling.
You can refer to a group of people who all support a particular person, policy, or idea as a particular camp.
If you camp somewhere, you stay or live there for a short time in a tent or caravan, or in the open air.
If you describe someone's behaviour, performance, or style of dress as camp, you mean that it is exaggerated and amusing, often in a way that is thought to be typical of some male homosexuals.

voca.means_ko: 진을 치다, 야영하다\n(집 밖) 다른 곳에서 (오랜 시간) 있다 캠핑하다
voca.means_en: to sleep outside, usually in a tent; to sleep on the floor somewhere for a short time\n"We camped out in the desert under the stars. It was great."\n
A campus is an area of land that contains the main buildings of a university or college.\n

If you cancel something that has been arranged, you stop it from happening. If you cancel an order for goods or services, you tell the person or organization supplying them that you no longer wish to receive them.\n

Cancer is a serious disease in which cells in a person's body increase rapidly in an uncontrolled way, producing abnormal growths.\nCancer is one of the twelve signs of the zodiac. Its symbol is a crab. People who are born approximately between the 21st of June and the 22nd of July come under this sign.\n

A candle is a stick of hard wax with a piece of string called a wick through the middle. You light the wick in order to give a steady flame that provides light.\nIf you burn the candle at both ends, you try to do too many things in too short a period of time so that you have to stay up very late at night and get up very early in the morning to get them done.\n

voca.means_ko: (대나무처럼 속이 빈)줄기, 지팡이, 막대기, 사탕수수\n회초리(막대기)로 때리다
voca.means_en: Cane is used to refer to the long, hollow, hard stems of plants such as bamboo. Strips of cane are often used to make furniture, and some types of cane can be crushed and processed to make sugar.\nA cane is a long thin stick with a curved or round top which you can use to support yourself when you are walking, or which in the past was fashionable to carry with you.\n
A canoe is a small, narrow boat that you move through the water using a stick with a wide end called a paddle.\n"It looks like a canoe" said Jack.\n

voca.means_ko: (침대위에 지붕처럼 늘어뜨린) 뎦개\n(숲의 나뭇가지들이) 지붕모양으로 우거진 것
voca.means_en:
A canopy is a decorated cover, often made of cloth, which is placed above something such as a bed or a seat.
A canopy is a layer of something that spreads out and covers an area, for example the branches and leaves that spread out at the top of trees in a forest.
They followed Peanut all the way up to the canopy of the rain forest.

voca.means_ko: [켄-t]\n(특히 종교, 도덕적인 쟁점에 대해) 위선적인 말\n비스듬하다, 비스듬히 놓다
voca.means_en: If you refer to moral or religious statements as cant, you are criticizing them because you think the person making them does not really believe what they are saying.\n
When a horse canters, it moves at a speed that is slower than a gallop but faster than a trot.\n

voca.means_ko: [케이퍼벌]\n(능력, 특질상) ~을 할 수 있는, 유능한, \n능력있는, 가능성있는, 가능한
voca.means_en: If a person or thing is capable of doing something, they have the ability to do it.\nSomeone who is capable has the skill or qualities necessary to do a particular thing well, or is able to do most things well.\n

voca.means_ko:
[커페시릐]
용량, 수용력, 생산 능력
(~을 이해하거나 할 수 있는) 능력

voca.means_en:
Your capacity for something is your ability to do it, or the amount of it that you are able to do.
The capacity of something such as a factory, industry, or region is the quantity of things that it can produce or deliver with the equipment or resources that are available.
The capacity of a piece of equipment is its size or power, often measured in particular units.
The capacity of a container is its volume, or the amount of liquid it can hold, measured in units such as litres or gallons.
The capacity of a building, place, or vehicle is the number of people or things that it can hold. If a place is filled to capacity, it is as full as it can possibly be.
A cape is a large piece of land that sticks out into the sea from the coast.\nA cape is a short cloak.\n

Capital is a large sum of money which you use to start a business, or which you invest in order to make more money.
You can use capital to refer to buildings or machinery which are necessary to produce goods or to make companies more efficient, but which do not make money directly.
The capital of a country is the city or town where its government or parliament meets.

In the army, navy, and some other armed forces, a captain is an officer of middle rank.
The captain of a sports team is the player in charge of it.
The captain of a ship is the sailor in charge of it.
The captain of an aeroplane is the pilot in charge of it.
In the United States and some other countries, a captain is a police officer or fireman of fairly senior rank.
If you captain a team or a ship, you are the captain of it.
He read the caption to Annie.\nA caption is the words printed underneath a picture or cartoon which explain what it is about.\n
Carbohydrates are substances, found in certain kinds of food, that provide you with energy. Foods such as sugar and bread that contain these substances can also be referred to as carbohydrates.\n
Carbon is a chemical element that diamonds and coal are made up of.\n

A cardinal is a high-ranking priest in the Catholic church.
A cardinal is a common North American bird. The male has bright red feathers.
A cardinal rule or quality is the one that is considered to be the most important.

voca.means_ko: 걱정하다, 염려하다, 상관하다, 관심을 가지다,\n돌봄, 걱정, 주의
voca.means_en:
care/ caution / prudence / discretion / wariness
If you care about something, you feel that it is important and are concerned about it.
If you care for someone, you feel a lot of affection for them.
If you care for someone or something, you look after them and keep them in a good state or condition.
Children who are in care are looked after by the state because their parents are dead or unable to look after them properly.

work / employment / career / profession / occupation / trade
A career is the job or profession that someone does for a long period of their life.
Your career is the part of your life that you spend working.
Careers advice or guidance in British English, or career advice or guidance in American English, consists of information about different jobs and help with deciding what kind of job you want to do.
If a person or vehicle careers somewhere, they move fast and in an uncontrolled way.

cautious / careful
If you are careful, you give serious attention to what you are doing, in order to avoid harm, damage, or mistakes. If you are careful to do something, you make sure that you do it.
Careful work, thought, or examination is thorough and shows a concern for details.
If you tell someone to be careful about doing something, you think that what they intend to do is probably wrong, and that they should think seriously before they do it.
If you are careful with something such as money or resources, you use or spend only what is necessary.

If you are careless, you do not pay enough attention to what you are doing, and so you make mistakes, or cause harm or damage.\nIf you say that someone is careless of something such as their health or appearance, you mean that they do not seem to be concerned about it, or do nothing to keep it in a good condition.\n
A caribou is a large north American deer.\n
A carpenter is a person whose job is making and repairing wooden things.\n

Carrots are long, thin, orange-coloured vegetables. They grow under the ground, and have green shoots above the ground.\nSomething that is offered to people in order to persuade them to do something can be referred to as a carrot. Something that is meant to persuade people not to do something can be referred to in the same sentence as a `stick'.\n

voca.means_en:
If you carry something, you take it with you, holding it so that it does not touch the ground.
If you carry something, you have it with you wherever you go.
If something carries a person or thing somewhere, it takes them there.
If a person or animal is carrying a disease, they are infected with it and can pass it on to other people or animals.
If an action or situation has a particular quality or consequence, you can say that it carries it.
If a quality or advantage carries someone into a particular position or through a difficult situation, it helps them to achieve that position or deal with that situation.

(with something) to continue doing something or moving in a particular direction, without stopping
to manage to continue living or working in your usual way in spite of difficult or unpleasant circumstances
(with something) to continue speaking or doing something after a short pause
to last for a particular time
to do something that you said you would do or that you have been asked to do\nto do and complete a task\n
to delay something until a later time\nto keep something from one situation and use or deal with it in a new situation\n
to move a total sum of money, or a total amount, from one page or column to the next, or from one week or year to the next\nto help something to make progress or succeed\n
if a disease carries somebody off, they die as a result of it\nto capture somebody\n
to do something that you said you would do or that you have been asked to do\nto do and complete a task\n
A cartoon is a humorous drawing or series of drawings in a newspaper or magazine.\nA cartoon is a film in which all the characters and scenes are drawn rather than being real people or objects.\n

If you carve an object, you make it by cutting it out of a substance such as wood or stone. If you carve something such as wood or stone into an object, you make the object by cutting it out.
If you carve writing or a design on an object, you cut it into the surface of the object.
If you carve a piece of cooked meat, you cut slices from it so that you can eat it.
Jack placed the mango on the M carved into the floor.

to divide a company, an area of land, etc. into parts and share them out\n

voca.means_ko: (논의 중인 문제, 상황 등에) 딱 들어맞는 사례
voca.means_en: a clear example of the problem, situation, etc. that is being discussed\n

In computing, if a written word such as a password is case-sensitive, it must be written in a particular form, for example using all capital letters or all small letters, in order for the computer to recognize it.\n

Cash is money in the form of notes and coins rather than cheques.
Cash means the same as money, especially money which is immediately available.
If you cash a cheque, you exchange it at a bank for the amount of money that it is worth.

voca.means_ko: 손을 떼다, 청산하다, 일의 결말은 짓다, 성공하다

voca.means_en:
The cast of a play or film is all the people who act in it.
A cast is a model that has been made by pouring a liquid such as plaster or hot metal onto something or into something, so that when it hardens it has the same shape as that thing.
A cast is the same as a plaster cast.
To cast an actor in a play or film means to choose them to act a particular role in it.
To cast someone in a particular way or as a particular thing means to describe them in that way or suggest they are that thing.
If you cast your eyes or cast a look in a particular direction, you look quickly in that direction.
If something casts a light or shadow somewhere, it causes it to appear there.
To cast doubt on something means to cause people to be unsure about it.
A castle is a large building with thick, high walls. Castles were built by important people, such as kings, in former times, especially for protection during wars and battles.\n

voca.means_en:
If you are casual, you are, or you pretend to be, relaxed and not very concerned about what is happening or what you are doing.
A casual event or situation happens by chance or without planning.
Casual clothes are ones that you normally wear at home or on holiday, and not on formal occasions.
Casual work is done for short periods and not on a permanent or regular basis.
What you mean as a casual remark could be misinterpreted.\n
A cat is a furry animal that has a long tail and sharp claws. Cats are often kept as pets.\nCats are lions, tigers, and other wild animals in the same family.\n
A catastrophe is an unexpected event that causes great suffering or damage.\n

voca.means_en:
catch - caught - caught
see / spot / catch / glimpse / clap / lay / set eyes on
If you catch a person or animal, you capture them after chasing them, or by using a trap, net, or other device.
If you catch an object that is moving through the air, you seize it with your hands.
If you catch a part of someone's body, you take or seize it with your hand, often in order to stop them going somewhere.
If one thing catches another, it hits it accidentally or manages to hit it.
If something catches on or in an object or if an object catches something, it accidentally becomes attached to the object or stuck in it.
If you catch yourself doing something, especially something surprising, you suddenly become aware that you are doing it.

voca.means_ko: 뒤쳐진 일을 보충하다, (~에 대해) 그 뒤의 소식을 듣다

voca.means_en: In British English, to cater for a group of people means to provide all the things that they need or want. In American English, you say you cater to a person or group of people.\nIn British English, to cater for something means to take it into account. In American English, you say you cater to something.\n
A caterpillar is a small, worm-like animal that feeds on plants and eventually develops into a butterfly or moth.\n
Cattle are cows and bulls.\n

voca.means_ko: [커-z]\n원인, 이유, 근거, 까닭, 소송\n원인이 되다, 야기하다, 일으키다
voca.means_en:
reason / grounds / excuse / motive / need / justification / cause / pretext
The cause of an event, usually a bad event, is the thing that makes it happen.
If you have cause for a particular feeling or action, you have good reasons for feeling it or doing it.
A cause is an aim or principle which a group of people supports or is fighting for.

voca.means_ko: 조심, 경고\n(위험에 대한) 경고/주의문\n(~에게) ~하지 말라고 주의/경고를 주다
voca.means_en:
care/ caution / prudence / discretion / wariness
Caution is great care which you take in order to avoid possible danger.
If someone cautions you, they warn you about problems or danger.
If someone who has broken the law is cautioned by the police, they are warned that if they break the law again official action will be taken against them.
If someone who has been arrested is cautioned, the police warn them that anything they say may be used as evidence in a trial.
A cautionary story or a cautionary note to a story is one that is intended to give a warning to people.\n

cautious / careful
Someone who is cautious acts very carefully in order to avoid possible danger.
If you describe someone's attitude or reaction as cautious, you mean that it is limited or careful.
A cave is a large hole in the side of a cliff or hill, or one that is under the ground.\n

if a roof, wall, etc. caves in, it falls down and towards the centre
to finally do what somebody wants you to do after you have resisted for a long time
The ground caved in and Jack went with it.
At the end of the tunnel was a huge cavern with a high ceiling.\n
A cavity is a space or hole in something such as a solid object or a person's body.\nIn dentistry, a cavity is a hole in a tooth, caused by decay.\n
When a bird such as a crow or a rook caws, it makes a loud harsh sound.\n

If something ceases, it stops happening or existing.
If you cease to do something, you stop doing it.
If you cease something, you stop it happening or working.
A ceasefire is an arrangement in which countries or groups of people that are fighting each other agree to stop fighting.\n
If something, often something unpleasant, is ceaseless, it continues for a long time without stopping or changing.\n
A ceiling is the horizontal surface that forms the top part or roof inside a room.\nA ceiling on something such as prices or wages is an official upper limit that cannot be broken.\n

A cell is the smallest part of an animal or plant that is able to function independently. Every animal or plant is made up of millions of cells.
A cell is a small room in which a prisoner is locked. A cell is also a small room in which a monk or nun lives.
You can refer to a small group of people within a larger organization as a cell.

voca.means_ko: [켈t]\n켈트족\n켈트족 후예 (특히 아일랜드, 웨일스, 스코틀랜드, 콘월 등)
voca.means_en: If you describe someone as a Celt, you mean that they are part of the racial group which comes from Scotland, Wales, Ireland, and some other areas such as Brittany.\n
A cemetery is a place where dead people's bodies or their ashes are buried.\n

main / major / key / central / principal / chief / prime
Something that is central is in the middle of a place or area.
A place that is central is easy to reach because it is in the centre of a city, town, or particular area.
A central group or organization makes all the important decisions that are followed throughout a larger organization or a country.
The central person or thing in a particular situation is the most important one.

If you describe someone or something as cerebral, you mean that they are intellectual rather than emotional.
Cerebral means relating to the brain.
This chef is incorporating marijuana in 5-star fine dining. "This is a cerebral experience. Whit each bite, you're literally changing your brain chemistry."

certain / bound / sure / definite / as sured
If you are certain about something, you firmly believe it is true and have no doubt about it. If you are not certain about something, you do not have definite knowledge about it.
If you say that something is certain to happen, you mean that it will definitely happen.
If you say that something is certain, you firmly believe that it is true, or have definite knowledge about it.

surely / certainly
You use certainly to emphasize what you are saying when you are making a statement.
You use certainly when you are agreeing with what someone has said.
You say certainly not when you want to say 'no' in a strong way.

voca.means_ko: 증명하다, 증명서/면허장을 주다\n증명서, 보증서, 공증, 인증
voca.means_en: A certificate is an official document stating that particular facts are true.\nA certificate is an official document that you receive when you have completed a course of study or training. The qualification that you receive is sometimes also called a certificate.\n

A chain consists of metal rings connected together in a line.
If prisoners are in chains, they have thick rings of metal round their wrists or ankles to prevent them from escaping.
A chain of things is a group of them existing or arranged in a line.
A chain of shops, hotels, or other businesses is a number of them owned by the same person or company.
A chain of events is a series of them happening one after another.
If a person or thing is chained to something, they are fastened to it with a chain.

A chair is a piece of furniture for one person to sit on. Chairs have a back and four legs.
At a university, a chair is the post of professor.
The person who is the chair of a committee or meeting is the person in charge of it.
The chair is the same as the electric chair.
If you chair a meeting or a committee, you are the person in charge of it.
The chairperson of a meeting, committee, or organization is the person in charge of it.\n

Chalk is a type of soft white rock. You can use small pieces of it for writing or drawing with.
Chalk is small sticks of chalk, or a substance similar to chalk, used for writing or drawing with.
If you chalk something, you draw or write it using a piece of chalk.

A challenge is something new and difficult which requires great effort and determination.
A challenge to something is a questioning of its truth or value. A challenge to someone is a questioning of their authority.
If you challenge ideas or people, you question their truth, value, or authority.
If you challenge someone, you invite them to fight or compete with you in some way.
If you say that someone is challenged in a particular way, you mean that they have a disability in that area. Challenged is often combined with inappropriate words for humorous effect.\n

A chamber is a large room, especially one that is used for formal meetings.
You can refer to a country's parliament or to one section of it as a chamber.
A chamber is a room designed and equipped for a particular purpose.

voca.means_en:
A champion is someone who has won the first prize in a competition, contest, or fight.
If you are a champion of a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them.
If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them.

luck / chance / coincidence / accident / fortune / fate / destiny / providence
If there is a chance of something happening, it is possible that it will happen.
If you have a chance to do something, you have the opportunity to do it.
A chance meeting or event is one that is not planned or expected.
If you chance to do something or chance on something, you do it or find it although you had not planned or tried to.
If you chance something, you do it even though there is a risk that you may not succeed or that something bad may happen.
take a risk (especially when you are unlikely to succeed)\n

voca.means_en:
If there is a change in something, it becomes different.
If you say that something is a change or makes a change, you mean that it is enjoyable because it is different from what you are used to.
A change of clothes is an extra set of clothes that you take with you when you go to stay somewhere or to take part in an activity.
Your change is the money that you receive when you pay for something with more money than it costs because you do not have exactly the right amount of money.
If you change from one thing to another, you stop using or doing the first one and start using or doing the second.
When something changes or when you change it, it becomes different.
pass to a different owner\n
Chaos is a state of complete disorder and confusion.\n
Something that is chaotic is in a state of complete disorder and confusion.\n

voca.means_en: burn / char / blacken / scald / scorch / singe\nIf food chars or if you char it, it burns slightly and turns black as it is cooking.\n

voca.means_en:
The character of a person or place consists of all the qualities they have that make them distinct from other people or places.
If something has a particular character, it has a particular quality.
You can use character to refer to the qualities that people from a particular place are believed to have.
You use character to say what kind of person someone is. For example, if you say that someone is a strange character, you mean they are strange.
Your character is your personality, especially how reliable and honest you are. If someone is of good character, they are reliable and honest. If they are of bad character, they are unreliable and dishonest.
If you say that someone has character, you mean that they have the ability to deal effectively with difficult, unpleasant, or dangerous situations.
If you say that a place has character, you mean that it has an interesting or unusual quality which makes you notice it and like it.

The characteristics of a person or thing are the qualities or features that belong to them and make them recognizable.\nA quality or feature that is characteristic of someone or something is one which is often seen in them and seems typical of them.\n

If something is characterized by a particular feature or quality, that feature or quality is an obvious part of it.\nIf you characterize someone or something as a particular thing, you describe them as that thing.\n

rate / charge / fee / rent / dues / toll / rental / tariff
If you charge someone an amount of money, you ask them to pay that amount for something that you have sold to them or done for them.
To charge something to a person or organization means to tell the people providing it to send the bill to that person or organization. To charge something to someone's account means to add it to their account so they can pay for it later.
When the police charge someone, they formally accuse them of having done something illegal.
If you charge someone with doing something wrong or unpleasant, you publicly say that they have done it.
If you charge towards someone or something, you move quickly and aggressively towards them.
To charge a battery means to pass an electrical current through it in order to make it more powerful or to make it last longer.
A charge is an amount of money that you have to pay for a service.

In ancient times, chariots were fast-moving vehicles with two wheels that were pulled by horses.\n

A charity is an organization which raises money in order to help people who are ill, disabled, or very poor.
If you give money to charity, you give it to one or more charitable organizations. If you do something for charity, you do it in order to raise money for one or more charitable organizations.
People who live on charity live on money or goods which other people give them because they are poor.
Charity is kindness and understanding towards other people.

Charm is the quality of being pleasant or attractive.
Someone who has charm behaves in a friendly, pleasant way that makes people like them.
A charm is a small ornament that is fixed to a bracelet or necklace.
A charm is an act, saying, or object that is believed to have magic powers.
If you charm someone, you please them, especially by using your charm.
If you say that something worked like a charm, you mean that it was very effective or successful.
Charred plants, buildings, or vehicles have been badly burnt and have become black because of fire.\n

voca.means_en:
If you chase someone, or chase after them, you run after them or follow them quickly in order to catch or reach them.
If you are chasing something you want, such as work or money, you are trying hard to get it.
If someone chases someone that they are attracted to, or chases after them, they try hard to persuade them to have a sexual relationship with them.
If someone chases you from a place, they force you to leave by using threats or violence.
To chase someone from a job or a position or from power means to force them to leave it.
If you chase somewhere, you run or rush there.
to try hard to get something or find somebody/something that you need or want\n

to contact somebody and remind them to do something they have said they would do or that they ought to do\nto try to find somebody/something that you need; to try to get more information about somebody/something\n
discussion / conversation / dialogue / talk / consultation / chat / gossip\nWhen people chat, they talk to each other in an informal and friendly way.\n
to talk in a friendly way to somebody because you are sexually attracted to them\nto talk to somebody in a friendly way because you want them to do something for you or to give you something\n

voca.means_en:
cheap / competitive / budget / affordable / reasonable / inexpensive
Goods or services that are cheap cost less money than usual or than you expected.
If you describe goods as cheap, you mean they cost less money than similar products but their quality is poor.
If you describe someone's remarks or actions as cheap, you mean that they are unkindly or insincerely using a situation to benefit themselves or to harm someone else.
If you describe someone as cheap, you are criticizing them for being unwilling to spend money.
If someone does or buys something on the cheap, they spend less money than they should because they are more concerned with what it costs than with its quality.

voca.means_ko: 확인하다, 조사/점검하다, 맡기다, 보관하다\n(무엇의 증가나 악화를) 저지/억제하다, 억누르다\n저지, 억제, 검사, 점검표, 수표, 계산서
voca.means_en:
bill / statement / account / invoice / tab / check
If you check something such as a piece of information or a document, you make sure that it is correct or satisfactory.
If you check on someone or something, you make sure they are in a safe or satisfactory condition.
If you check something that is written on a piece of paper, you put a mark, like a V with the right side extended, next to it to show that something is correct or has been selected or dealt with.
The check in a restaurant is a piece of paper on which the price of your meal is written and which you are given before you pay.
to go to an official desk at a hotel, an airport, etc. and tell somebody that you have arrived\n

to make sure that somebody is safe, happy, etc. or that something is progressing as it should be\nto find out if something is true or correct, especially something that somebody has said about themselves\n

to leave a hotel, a hospital, etc. where you have been staying
if you check out in a shop/store, or somebody checks you out, you find out how much you have to pay and give somebody the money
if facts, etc. check out, they can be shown to be correct or true
to take somebody's name when they arrive at a hotel or an airport, look at their ticket, etc.\n
to borrow something such as a book or a video from a library\n

an examination to see if something is in order
a medical examination, esp one taken at regular intervals to verify a normal state of health or discover a disease in its early stages
check up to investigate or make an inquiry into (a person's character, evidence, etc), esp when suspicions have been aroused
Your cheeks are the sides of your face below your eyes.\nYou say that someone has a cheek when you are annoyed or shocked at something unreasonable that they have done.\n

shout / yell / scream / cheer / cry / call
When people cheer, they shout loudly to show their approval or to encourage someone who is doing something such as taking part in a game.
If you are cheered by something, it makes you happier or less worried.
to encourage somebody, especially somebody in a race or competition, by shouting\n
to encourage somebody, especially somebody in a race or competition, by shouting\n
to become, or to make somebody/yourself, happier or more cheerful\n

cheerful / bright / cheery / jolly / merry / in a good mood
Someone who is cheerful is happy and shows this in their behaviour.
Something that is cheerful is pleasant and makes you feel happy.
"I'll go first!" said Annie cheerfully.\n
A cheerleader is one of the people who leads the crowd in cheering at a large public event, especially a sports event.\n
Cheese is a solid food made from milk. It is usually white or yellow.\n
A cheetah is a wild animal that looks like a large cat with black spots on its body. Cheetahs can run very fast.\n
A chef is a cook in a restaurant or hotel.\n

Chemical means involving or resulting from a reaction between two or more substances, or relating to the substances that something consists of.\nChemicals are substances that are used in a chemical process or made by a chemical process.\n

voca.means_ko: 화학, (특정 물질의) 화학적 성질, \n공감대,\n (사람 사이의) 화학 반응(보통 성적으로 강하게 끌리는 것을 가리킴)
voca.means_en:
Chemistry is the scientific study of the structure of substances and of the way that they react with other substances.
The chemistry of an organism or a material is the chemical substances that make it up and the chemical reactions that go on inside it.
If you say that there is chemistry between two people, you mean that is obvious they are attracted to each other or like each other very much.
A cheque is a printed form on which you write an amount of money and who it is to be paid to. Your bank then pays the money to that person from your account.\n
Chess is a game for two people, played on a chessboard. Each player has 16 pieces, including a king. Your aim is to move your pieces so that your opponent's king cannot escape being taken.\n

voca.means_ko: [체st]\n가슴, 흉부, 흉곽, 생각, 상자, 궤, 서랍장
voca.means_en:
Your chest is the top part of the front of your body where your ribs, lungs, and heart are.
A chest is a large, heavy box used for storing things.
He found a picture of pirate burying a treasure chest.

When you chew food, you use your teeth to break it up in your mouth so that it becomes easier to swallow.
If you chew gum or tobacco, you keep biting it and moving it around your mouth to taste the flavour of it. You do not swallow it.
If you chew your lips or your fingernails, you keep biting them because you are nervous.
If a person or animal chews an object, they bite it with their teeth.
to bite something continuously, especially because you are nervous or to test your teeth\n
to tell somebody angrily that they have done something wrong\n
to think about or discuss something carefully and in detail\n
Chickens are birds which are kept on a farm for their eggs and for their meat.\nIf someone calls you a chicken, they mean that you are afraid to do something.\n
Chickenpox is a disease which gives you a high temperature and red spots that itch.\n

main / major / key / central / principal / chief / prime
The chief of an organization is the person who is in charge of it.
The chief of a tribe is its leader.
Chief is used in the job titles of the most senior worker or workers of a particular kind in an organization.
The chief cause, part, or member of something is the most important one.
Childbirth is the act of giving birth to a child.\n
A person's childhood is the period of their life when they are a child.\n

voca.means_ko:
[췰]
쌀쌀해지다, 오싹해지다, 춥게하다
냉기, 차가움, 한기, 오한
차가운, 쌀쌀한
voca.means_en:
When you chill something or when it chills, you lower its temperature so that it becomes colder but does not freeze.
When cold weather or something cold chills a person or a place, it makes that person or that place feel very cold.
If something sends a chill through you, it gives you a sudden feeling of fear or anxiety.
A chill is a mild illness which can give you a slight fever and headache.
Chill weather is cold and unpleasant.
As he stared at the ship's flag, a chill went through him.

voca.means_ko: 긴장을 풀다/열을 식히다,\n침착해 지다, 냉정해 지다, 진정해, 문제될 것 없어
voca.means_en: to relax completely and not get upset or excited about anything\n

voca.means_ko: [췰뤼]\n차가운, 쌀쌀한, 냉담한, 오싹하게 하는\n싸늘하게, 차게, 쌀쌀하게
voca.means_en:
cold / cool / freezing / chilly / lukewarm / tepid
Something that is chilly is unpleasantly cold.
If you feel chilly, you feel rather cold.
You say that relations between people are chilly or that a person's response is chilly when they are not friendly, welcoming, or enthusiastic.

voca.means_ko: [차임]\n차임을 울리다, (종을) 치다\n차임, 종, 선율, 조화가 잘 된 음
voca.means_en:
When a bell or a clock chimes, it makes ringing sounds.
A chime is a ringing sound made by a bell, especially when it is part of a clock.
Chimes are a set of small objects which make a ringing sound when they are blown by the wind.
to join in a conversation suddenly or interrupt somebody\n
A chimney is a pipe through which smoke goes up into the air, usually through the roof of a building.\n
A chimpanzee is a kind of small African ape.\n
Something that is Chinese relates or belongs to China or its languages or people.\nThe languages that are spoken in China, especially Mandarin, are often referred to as Chinese.\n
When a bird or an insect such as a cricket or grasshopper chirps, it makes short high-pitched sounds.\n
A chisel is a tool that has a long metal blade with a sharp edge at the end. It is used for cutting and shaping wood and stone.\nIf you chisel wood or stone, you cut and shape it using a chisel.\n

choice / favourite / preference / selection / pick
If there is a choice of things, there are several of them and you can choose the one you want.
Your choice is someone or something that you choose from a range of things.
Choice means of very high quality.

voca.means_ko: [쵸욱k]\n질식시키다, 막다, 막히다, 숨이 막히다, 목을 조르다\n질식, 사레
voca.means_en:
When you choke or when something chokes you, you cannot breathe properly or get enough air into your lungs.
To choke someone means to squeeze their neck until they are dead.
If a place is choked with things or people, it is full of them and they prevent movement in it.
The choke in a car, truck, or other vehicle is a device that reduces the amount of air going into the engine and makes it easier to start.
to try to stop yourself from showing a strong emotion, or saying something that might upset somebody\n
to prevent or stop something\nto stop or interrupt something\n
to become, or to make somebody, so upset that you/they are unable to speak\n
If a person or animal chomps their way through food or chomps on food, they chew it noisily.\n

choose - chose - chosen
choose / select / pick / opt / go for / single out
If you choose someone or something from several people or things that are available, you decide which person or thing you want to have.
If you choose to do something, you do it because you want to or because you feel that it is right.

voca.means_ko: 선수를 선발하다, 팀을 구성하다\n(선수를 뽑아 팀, 편따위를) 만들다

[챠압]
썰다, 잘게 자르다, 난도질하다
(대폭) 삭감하다, 중단하다
자르기, 절단, 잘라낸 조각
voca.means_en: If you chop something, you cut it into pieces with strong downward movements of a knife or an axe.\nA chop is a small piece of meat cut from the ribs of a sheep or pig.\n
to remove something by cutting it with a sharp heavy tool\n

task / duties / mission / job / assignment / chore
A chore is a task that you must do but that you find unpleasant or boring.
Chores are tasks such as cleaning, washing, and ironing that have to be done regularly at home.

voca.means_ko:
[코r-러s]
후렴, (큰 음악 작품의 일부로서) 합창곡
합창단, 
합창을 하다, 이구동성으로 말하다
voca.means_en:
A chorus is a part of a song which is repeated after each verse.
A chorus is a large group of people who sing together.
A chorus is a piece of music written to be sung by a large group of people.
A chorus is a group of singers or dancers who perform together in a show, in contrast to the soloists.
When there is a chorus of criticism, disapproval, or praise, that attitude is expressed by a lot of people at the same time.

When a baby is christened, he or she is given a name during the Christian ceremony of baptism. Compare baptize.
You say that you christen a person, place, or object a particular name if you choose a name for them and start calling them by that name.
You say that you christen something new when you use it for the first time, especially if you do something special to mark the occasion.
Christianity is a religion that is based on the teachings of Jesus Christ and the belief that he was the son of God.\n
A chromosome is a part of a cell in an animal or plant. It contains genes which determine what characteristics the animal or plant will have.\n

A chronic illness or disability lasts for a very long time. Compare acute.
You can describe someone's bad habits or behaviour as chronic when they have behaved like that for a long time and do not seem to be able to stop themselves.
A chronic situation or problem is very severe and unpleasant.

voca.means_ko: 낄낄거리며 웃다, 만족한 미소를 짓다\n빙그래 웃다
voca.means_en: When you chuckle, you laugh quietly.\n

voca.means_ko: [청k]\n(두툼한) 덩어리, 큰 덩어리, 상당히 많은 량\n규모가 큰
voca.means_en: Chunks of something are thick solid pieces of it.\nA chunk of something is a large amount or large part of it.\n

A church is a building in which Christians worship. You usually refer to this place as church when you are talking about the time that people spend there.\nA Church is one of the groups of people within the Christian religion, for example Catholics or Methodists, that have their own beliefs, clergy, and forms of worship.\n

An electrical circuit is a complete route which an electric current can flow around.
A circuit is a series of places that are visited regularly by a person or group, especially as a part of their job.
A racing circuit is a track on which cars, motorbikes, or cycles race.

[써r컴s텐s]
(일, 사건 등을 둘러싼) 환경, 상황, 정황, 
(개인의 특히 제정적인) 형편, 처지, 
부수적인 일
어떤 상황(상태, 환경)에 놓이다
voca.means_en:
The circumstances of a particular situation are the conditions which affect what happens.
The circumstances of an event are the way it happened or the causes of it.
Your circumstances are the conditions of your life, especially the amount of money that you have.
You can emphasize that something must not or will not happen by saying that it must not or will not happen under any circumstances.
Events and situations which cannot be controlled are sometimes referred to as circumstance.

voca.means_ko:

(이유, 예를) 들다/끌어대다, 인용하다,

표창하다
voca.means_en:
mention / refer to / cite / quote / allude to
If you cite something, you quote it or mention it, especially as an example or proof of what you are saying.
To cite a person means to officially name them in a legal case. To cite a reason or cause means to state it as the official reason for your case.
If someone is cited, they are officially ordered to appear before a court.
Someone who is a citizen of a particular country is legally accepted as belonging to that country.\nThe citizens of a town or city are the people who live there.\n
A city is a large town.\nThe City is the part of London where many important financial institutions have their main offices. People often refer to these financial institutions as the City.\n

You use civil to describe events that happen within a country and that involve the different groups of people in it.
You use civil to describe people or things in a country that are not connected with its armed forces.
You use civil to describe things that are connected with the state rather than with a religion.
You use civil to describe the rights that people have within a society.
Someone who is civil is polite in a formal way, but not particularly friendly.
A civilization is a human society with its own social organization and culture.\nCivilization is the state of having an advanced level of social organization and a comfortable way of life.\n

voca.means_ko:
[클레임]
(~이 사실이라고) 주장하다, 
(자기 권리나 재산이라고 여겨) 요구/요청하다
(관심을) 끌다, 사로잡다
요구, 청구, 주장
voca.means_en:
claim / allegation / assertion / contention
If you say that someone claims that something is true, you mean they say that it is true but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.
If you say that someone claims responsibility or credit for something, you mean they say that they are responsible for it, but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.
If you claim something, you try to get it because you think you have a right to it.
If someone claims a record, title, or prize, they gain or win it.
If you claim money from the government, an insurance company, or another organization, you officially apply to them for it, because you think you are entitled to it according to their rules.
A claim is something which someone says which they cannot prove and which may be false.
If you have a claim on someone or their attention, you have the right to demand things from them or to demand their attention.
to ask for something to be returned to you\n
Clams are a kind of shellfish which can be eaten.\n
a dredging bucket that is hinged like the shell of a clam\nan aircraft cockpit canopy hinged at the front and rear\n

When you clap, you hit your hands together to show appreciation or attract attention.
If you clap your hand or an object onto something, you put it there quickly and firmly.
A clap of thunder is a sudden and loud noise of thunder.
He was clapping his hands together.

[k뤠쉬]
(두 집단간의 짧은 물리적) 충돌, 
(대립되는 두 가지 사이의) 충돌/차이, 
(시합 등에서) 맞붙다, 격돌하다, 
충돌하다, 차이를 보이다, 
부딪치다, 상반되다, 겹치다
voca.means_en:
fight / clash / brawl / struggle / scuffle / tussle
When people clash, they fight, argue, or disagree with each other.
Beliefs, ideas, or qualities that clash with each other are very different from each other and therefore are opposed.
If one event clashes with another, the two events happen at the same time so that you cannot attend both of them.
If one colour or style clashes with another, the colours or styles look ugly together. You can also say that two colours or styles clash.

A class is a group of pupils or students who are taught together.
A class is a course of teaching in a particular subject.
If you do something in class, you do it during a lesson in school.
The students in a school or university who finish their course in a particular year are often referred to as the class of that year.
Class refers to the division of people in a society into groups according to their social status.
A class of things is a group of them with similar characteristics.
If someone or something is classed as a particular thing, they are regarded as belonging to that group of things.

classic / classical
You use classical to describe something that is traditional in form, style, or content.
Classical music is music that is considered to be serious and of lasting value.
Classical is used to describe things which relate to the ancient Greek or Roman civilizations.
A classification is a division or category in a system which divides things into groups or types.\n

voca.means_en: If you say that people or things clatter somewhere, you mean that they move there noisily.\nIf something hard clatters, it makes repeated short noises as it hits against another hard thing.\n

voca.means_en: A clause is a section of a legal document.\nIn grammar, a clause is a group of words containing a verb. Sentences contain one or more clauses. There are finite clauses and non-finite clauses.\n

해집고 나아가다.
voca.means_en:
The claws of a bird or animal are the thin, hard, curved nails at the end of its feet.
The claws of a lobster, crab, or scorpion are the two pointed parts at the end of its legs which are used for holding things.
If an animal claws at something, it scratches or damages it with its claws.
To claw at something mean to try very hard to get hold of it.
If you claw your way somewhere, you move there with great difficulty, trying desperately to find things to hold on to.
The bands had spikes like claws on them.
to try to catch somebody/something or scratch or tear somebody/something with claws or with your nails\n

soil / mud / clay / land / earth / dirt / ground
Clay is a kind of earth that is soft when it is wet and hard when it is dry. Clay is shaped and baked to make things such as pots and bricks.
In tennis, matches played on clay are played on courts whose surface is covered with finely crushed stones or brick.

voca.means_ko: (더럽지 않아) 깨끗한, 깔끔한, 정확한, 산뜻한\n청소하다, 깨끗해 지다, \n완전히, 감쪽같이
voca.means_en:
clean / wash / rinse / cleanse / dry-clean / bathe
Something that is clean is free from dirt or unwanted marks.
If you clean something or clean dirt off it, you make it free from dirt and unwanted marks, for example by washing or wiping it. If something cleans easily, it is easy to clean.
Clean is used to emphasize that something was done completely.
to clean something thoroughly by rubbing it with a cloth, etc. or brushing it\n
to clean the inside of something thoroughly\nto use up or take all somebody's money; to take or buy the whole supply of something that somebody has\n
to remove criminals, crime or immoral behaviour from a place or an organization\n

to remove dirt, etc. from a place and make it clean
to wash yourself or make yourself clean
to be very successful; to win a lot of money or prizes

clear / obvious / apparent / evident / plain / crystal clear
Something that is clear is easy to understand, see, or hear.
Something that is clear is obvious and impossible to be mistaken about.
If you are clear about something, you understand it completely.
If your mind or your way of thinking is clear, you are able to think sensibly and reasonably, and you are not affected by confusion or by a drug such as alcohol.
To clear your mind or your head means to free it from confused thoughts or from the effects of a drug such as alcohol.
to remove things that you have been using and no longer need in order to leave a clear space\nto make somebody leave a place\n
to go or run away\n
to make something empty and clean by removing what you do not want\n
to make something empty and clean by removing what you do not want\n

to make something clean and neat
to solve a problem; to find an explanation for something
if the weather clears up, it becomes brighter and rain, etc. moves away
cough slightly, especially before speaking or to attract somebody's attention\n
A clearing is a small area in a forest where there are no trees or bushes.\n

voca.means_ko: [클릐어뤼]\n또렷하게, 분명하게, 알기 쉽게\n(자신이 하는말을 강조하여) 분명히

voca.means_en: Clement weather is pleasantly mild and dry.\n

voca.means_ko:

voca.means_en:
When you clench your fist or your fist clenches, you curl your fingers up tightly, usually because you are very angry.
When you clench your teeth or they clench, you squeeze your teeth together firmly, usually because you are angry or upset.
If you clench something in your hand or in your teeth, you hold it tightly with your hand or your teeth.

A clerk is a person who works in an office, bank, or law court and whose job is to look after the records or accounts.
In a hotel, office, or hospital, a clerk is the person whose job is to answer the telephone and deal with people when they arrive.
A clerk is someone who works in a store.
To clerk means to work as a clerk.

intelligent / smart / clever / brilliant / bright
Someone who is clever is intelligent and able to understand things easily or plan things well.
A clever idea, book, or invention is extremely effective and shows the skill of the people involved.
A cliff is a high area of land with a very steep side, especially one next to the sea.\nBeyond the plain were high rocky cliffs.\n
The climate of a place is the general weather conditions that are typical of it.\nYou can use climate to refer to the general atmosphere or situation somewhere.\n

voca.means_ko: [클롸임]\n오르다, 올라가다, 등반하다, 상승하다\n등반, 등산, (가치, 양 등의) 상승, 증가
voca.means_en:
If you climb something such as a tree, mountain, or ladder, or climb up it, you move towards the top of it. If you climb down it, you move towards the bottom of it.
If you climb somewhere, you move there carefully, for example because you are moving into a small space or trying to avoid falling.
When something such as an aeroplane climbs, it moves upwards to a higher position. When the sun climbs, it moves higher in the sky.
to admit that you are wrong or have made a mistake; to change your position in an argument\n
"I was climbing the walls when my son was in the hospital."\n

voca.means_ko: [클링]\n꼭 붙잡다, 매달리다, 착 들러붙다, 달라붙다\n애착을 갖다
voca.means_en:
cling - clung - clung
hold / hold on / cling / clutch / grip / grasp / clasp / hang on
If you cling to someone or something, you hold onto them tightly.
If someone clings to a position or a possession they have, they do everything they can to keep it even though this may be very difficult.
to hold something/somebody tightly; to not let go of something/somebody\n

voca.means_en:
A clip is a small device, usually made of metal or plastic, that is specially shaped for holding things together.
A clip from a film or a radio or television programme is a short piece of it that is broadcast separately.
When you clip things together or when things clip together, you fasten them together using a clip or clips.
If you clip something, you cut small pieces from it, especially in order to shape it.
If you clip something out of a newspaper or magazine, you cut it out.
If something clips something else, it hits it accidentally at an angle before moving off in a different direction.
Clippers are a tool used for cutting small amounts from something, especially from someone's hair or nails.\n

A cloak is a long, loose, sleeveless piece of clothing which people used to wear over their other clothes when they went out.
A cloak of something such as mist or snow completely covers and hides something.
If you refer to something as a cloak, you mean that it is intended to hide the truth about something.
To cloak something means to cover it or hide it.

voca.means_en:
A clock is an instrument, for example in a room or on the outside of a building, that shows what time of day it is.
A time clock in a factory or office is a device that is used to record the hours that people work. Each worker puts a special card into the device when they arrive and leave, and the times are recorded on the card.
In a car, the clock is the instrument that shows the speed of the car or the distance it has travelled.
To clock a particular time or speed in a race means to reach that time or speed.
If something or someone is clocked at a particular time or speed, their time or speed is measured at that level.
If you are doing something against the clock, you are doing it in a great hurry, because there is very little time.
to record the time that you arrive at work, especially by putting a card into a machine; to do this for somebody or check the time they arrive at work\n
to record the time that you leave work, especially by putting a card into a machine; to do this for somebody\n
When something is moving clockwise, it is moving in a circle in the same direction as the hands on a clock.\n

voca.means_en: When something clogs a hole or place, it blocks it so that nothing can pass through.\nClogs are heavy leather or wooden shoes with thick wooden soles.\n

If someone or something is a clone of another person or thing, they are so similar to this person or thing that they seem to be exactly the same as them.
A clone is an animal or plant that has been produced artificially, for example in a laboratory, from the cells of another animal or plant. A clone is exactly the same as the original animal or plant.
To clone an animal or plant means to produce it as a clone.
to make or move along with a sound as of a horse's hooves striking the ground\na sound of this nature\n

Something that is cold has a very low temperature or a lower temperature than is normal or acceptable.
If it is cold, or if a place is cold, the temperature of the air is very low.
If you are cold, your body is at an unpleasantly low temperature.
Cold weather or low temperatures can be referred to as the cold.
If you have a cold, you have a mild, very common illness which makes you sneeze a lot and gives you a sore throat or a cough.
A cold snap is a short period of cold and icy weather.\n

when the sun, moon or stars come out, they appear in the sky
when flowers come out, they open

to be included within a particular group or collection of things
to be managed, controlled or owned by a particular group or organization

to be included with or as part of something\n

Comedy consists of types of entertainment, such as plays and films, or particular scenes in them, that are intended to make people laugh.
A comedy is a play, film, or television programme that is intended to make people laugh.
The comedy of a situation involves those aspects of it that make you laugh.
A comet is a bright object with a long tail that travels around the sun.\n

voca.means_ko:

위로, 위안, 안도감, 안심, 편안

voca.means_en:
If you are doing something in comfort, you are physically relaxed and contented, and are not feeling any pain or other unpleasant sensations.
Comfort is a style of life in which you have enough money to have everything you need.
Comfort is what you feel when worries or unhappiness stop.
If you refer to a person, thing, or idea as a comfort, you mean that it helps you to stop worrying or makes you feel less unhappy.
If you comfort someone, you make them feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them.
If you say that something is, for example, too close for comfort, you mean you are worried because it is closer than you would like it to be.

voca.means_ko: [컴풔더벌]\n편안한, 안락한, 쾌적한\n풍족한, 넉넉한, 많은 차이가 나는
voca.means_en:
rich / wealthy / prosperous / affluent / well off / comfortable
If a piece of furniture or an item of clothing is comfortable, it makes you feel physically relaxed when you use it, for example because it is soft.
If a building or room is comfortable, it makes you feel physically relaxed when you spend time in it, for example because it is warm and has nice furniture.
If you are comfortable, you are physically relaxed because of the place or position you are sitting or lying in.
If you say that someone is comfortable, you mean that they have enough money to be able to live without financial problems.

funny / amusing / entertaining / witty / humorous / comic / hilarious
If you describe something as comic, you mean that it makes you laugh, and is often intended to make you laugh.
Comic is used to describe comedy as a form of entertainment, and the actors and entertainers who perform it.
A comic is an entertainer who tells jokes in order to make people laugh.
A comic is a magazine that contains stories told in pictures.

voca.means_ko: [커멘d]\n명령, 지령, 사령부, 지휘\n명령하다, 지시하다, ~을 지배/억제 하다
voca.means_en:
order / tell / instruct / direct / command
If someone in authority commands you to do something, they tell you that you must do it.
If you command something such as respect or obedience, you obtain it because you are popular, famous, or important.
If an army or country commands a place, they have total control over it.
In the armed forces, a command is a group of officers who are responsible for organizing and controlling part of an army, navy, or air force.
In computing, a command is an instruction that you give to a computer.

voca.means_ko: [커멘더벌]\n칭찬할 만한, 추천할 만한, 훌륭한\n명령/지배할 수 있는
voca.means_en: If you describe someone's behaviour as commendable, you approve of it or are praising it.\n

voca.means_ko: [커멘t]\n말, 발언, 논평, 언급, 의견\n주석을 달다, 논평하다, 견해를 밝히다
voca.means_en:
comment / note / remark / observe
If you comment on something, you give your opinion about it or you give an explanation for it.
A comment is something that you say which expresses your opinion of something or which gives an explanation of it.
If an event or situation is a comment on something, it reveals something about that thing, usually something bad.
Commerce is the activities and procedures involved in buying and selling things.\n

ad / advertisement / commercial / promotion / advert / trailer
Commercial means involving or relating to the buying and selling of goods.
Commercial organizations and activities are concerned with making money or profits, rather than, for example, with scientific research or providing a public service.
A commercial product is made to be sold to the public.
A commercial vehicle is a vehicle used for carrying goods, or passengers who pay.

voca.means_ko:
[커밋t]
(그릇된 일, 범쥐를)저지르다, 자살하다,
(병원, 교도소 등에) 수용/수감하다
(재판에) 회부하다

voca.means_en:
If someone commits a crime or a sin, they do something illegal or bad.
If someone commits suicide, they deliberately kill themselves.
If you commit money or resources to something, you decide to use them for a particular purpose.
If you commit yourself to something, you say that you will definitely do it. If you commit yourself to someone, you decide that you want to have a long-term relationship with them.
If you do not want to commit yourself on something, you do not want to say what you really think about it or what you are going to do.
If someone is committed to a hospital, prison, or other institution, they are officially sent there for a period of time.
If you commit something to paper or to writing, you record it by writing it down. If you commit something to memory, you learn it so that you will remember it.

Commitment is a strong belief in an idea or system.
A commitment is something which regularly takes up some of your time because of an agreement you have made or because of responsibilities that you have.
If you make a commitment to do something, you promise that you will do it.
Commitment is the process of officially sending someone to a prison or to hospital.
A committee is a group of people who meet to make decisions or plans for a larger group or organization that they represent.\n

If something is common, it is found in large numbers or it happens often.
If something is common to two or more people or groups, it is done, possessed, or used by them all.
When there are more animals or plants of a particular species than there are of related species, then the first species is called common.
A common is an area of grassy land, usually in or near a village or small town, where the public is allowed to go.
The Commons is the same as the House of Commons. The members of the House of Commons can also be referred to as the Commons.
Commonality is used to refer to a feature or purpose that is shared by two or more people or things.\nFinding Commonalities in Two Dictionaries\n

voca.means_ko:
[커뮤니케잇t]
연락을 주고받다, 의사소통을 하다, 
(정보 등을) 전달하다, 
소통하다, 
(병을) 전염시키다
voca.means_en:
talk / discuss / speak / communicate
If you communicate with someone, you share or exchange information with them, for example by speaking, writing, or using equipment. You can also say that two people communicate.
If you communicate information, a feeling, or an idea to someone, you let them know about it.
If one person communicates with another, they successfully make each other aware of their feelings and ideas. You can also say that two people communicate.
Communications are the systems and processes that are used to communicate or broadcast information, especially by means of electricity or radio waves.\nA communication is a message.\n

The community is all the people who live in a particular area or place.
A particular community is a group of people who are similar in some way.
Community is friendship between different people or groups, and a sense of having something in common.

voca.means_ko: 꽉 채우다, ~을 굳히다, 응축/압축하다\n꽉찬, 빽빽한, 작고 경제적인, 간결한\n소형의, 간편한, (공간이) 작은
voca.means_en:
Compact things are small or take up very little space. You use this word when you think this is a good quality.
A compact person is small but strong.
A compact cassette, camera, or car is a small type of cassette, camera, or car.
To compact something means to press it so that it becomes more solid.
A companion is someone who you spend time with or who you are travelling with.\n

voca.means_ko: 회사, 친구, 교제, 함께 있음\n(함께 일하거나 공연하는) 단체\n중대
voca.means_en:
A company is a business organization that makes money by selling goods or services.
A company is a group of opera singers, dancers, or actors who work together.
A company is a group of soldiers that is usually part of a battalion or regiment, and that is divided into two or more platoons.
If you have company, you have a visitor or friend with you.

voca.means_ko: 비교의, 비교에 의한, 상당한, 상대적으로, 비교급의
voca.means_en: You use comparative to show that you are judging something against a previous or different situation. For example, comparative calm is a situation which is calmer than before or calmer than the situation in other places.\n

When you compare things, you consider them and discover the differences or similarities between them.
If you compare one person or thing to another, you say that they are like the other person or thing.
If one thing compares favourably with another, it is better than the other thing. If it compares unfavourably, it is worse than the other thing.
If you say that something does not compare with something else, you mean that it is much worse.

When you make a comparison, you consider two or more things and discover the differences between them.
When you make a comparison, you say that one thing is like another in some way.
If you say, for example, that something is large or small in comparison with, in comparison to, or by comparison with something else, you mean that it is larger or smaller than the other thing.
If you say there is no comparison between one thing and another, you mean that you think the first thing is much better than the second, or very different from it.

voca.means_en: A compartment is one of the separate spaces into which a railway carriage is divided.\nA compartment is one of the separate parts of an object that is used for keeping things in.\n

voca.means_en:
If things, for example systems, ideas, and beliefs, are compatible, they work well together or can exist together successfully.
If you say that you are compatible with someone, you mean that you have a good relationship with them because you have similar opinions and interests.
If one make of computer or computer equipment is compatible with another make, especially IBM, they can be used together and can use the same software.

voca.means_ko: 강요하다, 압도적인, ~ 하게 하다\n(어떤 반응을) 자아내다/불러오다
voca.means_en: If a situation, a rule, or a person compels you to do something, they force you to do it.\nIf you feel compelled to do something, you feel that you must do it, because it is the right thing to do.\n

강제적인, 강력한, 억지의
voca.means_en:
interesting / fascinating / compelling / stimulating / gripping / absorbing
A compelling argument or reason is one that convinces you that something is true or that something should be done.
If you describe something such as a film or book, or someone's appearance, as compelling, you mean you want to keep looking at it or reading it because you find it so interesting.

Compensation is money that someone who has experienced loss or suffering claims from the person or organization responsible, or from the state.\nIf something is some compensation for something bad that has happened, it makes you feel better.\n

When one firm or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its own goods in preference to those of the other firm or country. You can also say that two firms or countries compete.\n
Competence is the ability to do something well or effectively.\n

Competition is a situation in which two or more people or groups are trying to get something which not everyone can have.
The competition is the person or people you are competing with.
Competition is an activity involving two or more firms, in which each firm tries to get people to buy its own goods in preference to the other firms' goods.
The competition is the goods that a rival organization is selling.
A competition is an event in which many people take part in order to find out who is best at a particular activity.
A company's competitors are companies who are trying to sell similar goods or services to the same people.\nA competitor is a person who takes part in a competition or contest.\n

voca.means_en: A compilation is a book, CD, or programme that contains many different items that have been gathered together, usually ones which have already appeared in other places.\n

voca.means_en: When you compile something such as a report, book, or programme, you produce it by collecting and putting together many pieces of information.\n

voca.means_en:
compliment / complement
If one thing complements another, it goes well with the other thing and makes its good qualities more noticeable.
If people or things complement each other, they are different or do something different, which makes them a good combination.
Something that is a complement to something else complements it.
The complement of things or people that something has is the number of things or people that it normally has, which enable it to function properly.
