voca.means_en:
You use complete to emphasize that something is as great in extent, degree, or amount as it possibly can be.
You can use complete to emphasize that you are referring to the whole of something and not just part of it.
If something is complete, it contains all the parts that it should contain.
The complete works of a writer are all their books or poems published together in one book or as a set of books.
If something is complete, it has been finished.
To complete a set or group means to provide the last item that is needed to make it a full set or group.

voca.means_ko: ~을 복잡하게 하다\n복합체, 합성물, 콤플렉스\n복잡한, 합성의, 복합의, 까다로운
[컴플러케잇t]\n(더) 복잡하게 만들다, 복잡하게 하다, 악화시키다\n복잡한, 뒤얽힌
voca.means_en: To complicate something means to make it more difficult to understand or deal with.\n
If you say that something is complicated, you mean it has so many parts or aspects that it is difficult to understand or deal with.\n
A complication is a problem or difficulty that makes a situation harder to deal with.\nA complication is a medical problem that occurs as a result of another illness or disease.\n

compliment / complement
A compliment is a polite remark that you say to someone to show that you like their appearance, appreciate their qualities, or approve of what they have done.
You can refer to your compliments when you want to express thanks, good wishes, or respect to someone in a formal way.
If you compliment someone, you pay them a compliment.
If you say that someone returns the compliment, you mean that they do the same thing to someone else as that person has done to them.

voca.means_ko: 성분, 구성요소, 부품, 부분\n구성하는, 구성 요소를 이루는
voca.means_en: The components of something are the parts that it is made of.\nThe component parts of something are the parts that make it up.\n

voca.means_ko: 구성하다, 작곡하다, 조립/조직하다\n(감정, 표정 등을) 가다듬다
voca.means_en:
The things that something is composed of are its parts or members. The separate things that compose something are the parts or members that form it.
When someone composes a piece of music, they write it.
If you compose something such as a letter, poem, or speech, you write it, often using a lot of concentration or skill.
If you compose yourself or if you compose your features, you succeed in becoming calm after you have been angry, excited, or upset.
A composite object or item is made up of several different things, parts, or substances.\n

voca.means_ko: 구성, 구조, 성분, 작곡법, 합성, 복합
voca.means_en:
structure / framework / composition / construction / fabric / make-up
When you talk about the composition of something, you are referring to the way in which its various parts are put together and arranged.
The compositions of a composer, painter, or other artist are the works of art that they have produced.
A composition is a piece of written work that children write at school.
Composition is the technique or skill involved in creating a work of art.

voca.means_ko: 비료를 주다, 퇴비를 만들다\n비료, 퇴비, 합성물/혼합물
voca.means_en:
Compost is a mixture of decayed plants and vegetable waste which is added to the soil to help plants grow.
Compost is specially treated soil that you buy and use to grow seeds and plants in pots.
To compost things such as unwanted bits of plants means to make them into compost.

voca.means_ko: 혼합하다, 조제하다, 만들다, 조립하다\n혼합물, 복합적인 요소, 화합물\n합성의,  혼합/복합의
voca.means_en:
A compound is an enclosed area of land that is used for a particular purpose.
In chemistry, a compound is a substance that consists of two or more elements.
If something is a compound of different things, it consists of those things.
Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things.
In grammar, a compound sentence is one that is made up of two or more main clauses. Compare complex.
To compound a problem, difficulty, or mistake means to make it worse by adding to it.

Comprehension is the ability to understand something.
Comprehension is full knowledge and understanding of the meaning of something.
When pupils do comprehension, they do an exercise to find out how well they understand a piece of spoken or written language.
the ability to be compressed\nsymbol k the reciprocal of the bulk modulus; the ratio of volume strain to stress at constant temperature\n

voca.means_ko: 압축, 압착(된 것),\n(사상, 언어 등의) 요약, 압축

voca.means_en: If you say that something comprises or is comprised of a number of things or people, you mean it has them as its parts or members.\nThe things or people that comprise something are the parts or members that form it.\n

사슬같이 잇다, 연쇄시키다

연쇄된, 이어진, 연결된
voca.means_en: to link or join together, esp in a chain or series\nlinked or joined together\n

hide / conceal / cover / disguise / mask / camouflage
If you conceal something, you cover it or hide it carefully.
If you conceal a piece of information or a feeling, you do not let other people know about it.
If something conceals something else, it covers it and prevents it from being seen.

If you concentrate on something, or concentrate your mind on it, you give all your attention to it.
If something is concentrated in an area, it is all there rather than being spread around.
Concentrate is a liquid or substance from which water has been removed in order to make it stronger, or to make it easier to store.
to spend more time doing one particular thing than others\n

voca.means_ko: 염려하다, 걱정하다, 관여하다, 영향을 미치다\n관계, 이해관계, 관심사, 염려
voca.means_en:
Concern is worry about a situation. / A concern is a fact or situation that worries you.
Someone's concern with something is their feeling that it is important.
Concern for someone is a feeling that you want them to be happy, safe, and well. If you do something out of concern for someone, you do it because you want them to be happy, safe, and well.
If something concerns you, it worries you.
If you concern yourself with something, you give it attention because you think that it is important.

voca.means_ko:
[컨클루-d]
결론/결판을 내리다, 결론짓다,
끝내다, 마치다, 
(협정, 조약을 ) 맺다, 체결하다,
voca.means_en:
If you conclude that something is true, you decide that it is true using the facts you know as a basis.
When you conclude, you say the last thing that you are going to say.
When something concludes, or when you conclude it, you end it.
If one person or group concludes an agreement, such as a treaty or business deal, with another, they arrange it. You can also say that two people or groups conclude an agreement.

When you come to a conclusion, you decide that something is true after you have thought about it carefully and have considered all the relevant facts.
The conclusion of something is its ending.
The conclusion of a treaty or a business deal is the act of arranging it or agreeing it.
You can refer to something that seems certain to happen as a foregone conclusion.

voca.means_ko: 콘크리트로 굳히다, 응고하다, 굳어지다\n콘크리트, 구체적 관념, 결합체\n구체적인, 현실에 근거한, 실제적인
voca.means_en:
Concrete is a substance used for building which is made by mixing together cement, sand, small stones, and water.
When you concrete something such as a path, you cover it with concrete.
You use concrete to indicate that something is definite and specific.
A concrete object is a real, physical object.
A concrete noun is a noun that refers to a physical object rather than to a quality or idea.

voca.means_ko: 상태, 조건, 상황, 날씨\n길들이다, 훈련시키다, \n좌우하다, 영향을 미치다
voca.means_en:
condition / state
If you talk about the condition of a person or thing, you are talking about the state that they are in, especially how good or bad their physical state is.
The conditions under which something is done or happens are all the factors or circumstances which directly affect it.
The conditions in which people live or work are the factors which affect their comfort, safety, or health.
If someone is conditioned by their experiences or environment, they are influenced by them over a period of time so that they do certain things or think in a particular way.

voca.means_ko: 실시하다, 수행하다, 지휘하다\n행위, 처신, 태도, 지도, 안내

voca.means_en:
When you confer with someone, you discuss something with them in order to make a decision. You can also say that two people confer.
To confer something such as power or an honour on someone means to give it to them.
He wanted to confer with his colleagues before reaching a decision.

admit / acknowledge / concede / confess / allow / grant
If someone confesses to doing something wrong, they admit that they did it.
If someone confesses or confesses their sins, they tell God or a priest about their sins so that they can be forgiven.
You use expressions like `I confess', `I must confess', or `I have to confess' to apologize slightly for admitting something you are ashamed of or that you think might offend or annoy someone.

A confession is a signed statement by someone in which they admit that they have committed a particular crime.
Confession is the act of admitting that you have done something that you are ashamed of or embarrassed about.
If you make a confession of your beliefs or feelings, you publicly tell people that this is what you believe or feel.
In the Catholic church and in some other churches, if you go to confession, you privately tell a priest about your sins and ask for forgiveness.

If you have confidence in someone, you feel that you can trust them.
If you have confidence, you feel sure about your abilities, qualities, or ideas.
If you can say something with confidence, you feel certain it is correct.
If you tell someone something in confidence, you tell them a secret.

sure / confident / convinced / certain / positive
If you are confident about something, you are certain that it will happen in the way you want it to.
If a person or their manner is confident, they feel sure about their own abilities, qualities, or ideas.
If you are confident that something is true, you are sure that it is true. A confident statement is one that the speaker is sure is true.
Information that is confidential is meant to be kept secret or private.\nIf you talk to someone in a confidential way, you talk to them quietly because what you are saying is secret or private.\n

voca.means_ko: 구성, 형상, 상대적 배치, 요소의 조합

voca.means_en:
If you are confronted with a problem, task, or difficulty, you have to deal with it.
If you confront a difficult situation or issue, you accept the fact that it exists and try to deal with it.
If you are confronted by something that you find threatening or difficult to deal with, it is there in front of you.
If you confront someone, you stand or sit in front of them, especially when you are going to fight, argue, or compete with them.

voca.means_en:
If you confuse two things, you get them mixed up, so that you think one of them is the other one.
To confuse someone means to make it difficult for them to know exactly what is happening or what to do.
To confuse a situation means to make it complicated or difficult to understand.

If there is confusion about something, it is not clear what the true situation is, especially because people believe different things.\nConfusion is a situation in which everything is in disorder, especially because there are lots of things happening at the same time.\n

In English, there are co-ordinating conjunctions such as `and' and `but', and subordinating conjunctions such as `although', `because', and `when'.\n

It has a wholly different connotation.
Red has a connotation of warmth.
The use of the word "purpose" has wide connotations.

Conquest is the act of conquering a country or group of people.
Conquests are lands that have been conquered in war.
If someone makes a conquest, they succeed in attracting and usually sleeping with another person. You usually use conquest when you want to indicate that this relationship is not important to the person concerned.
You can refer to the person that someone has succeeded in attracting as their conquest.
The conquest of something such as a problem is success in ending it or dealing with it.
Consecutive periods of time or events happen one after the other without interruption.\nShe was absent for nine consecutive days.\nThe water rate has not dropped for three consecutive months.

The consequences of something are the results or effects of it.
If one thing happens and then another thing happens in consequence or as a consequence, the second thing happens as a result of the first.
Something or someone of consequence is important or valuable. If something or someone is of no consequence, or of little consequence, they are not important or valuable.
If you tell someone that they must take the consequences or face the consequences, you warn them that something unpleasant will happen to them if they do not stop behaving in a particular way.

Someone who is conservative or has conservative ideas is unwilling to accept changes and new ideas.
If someone dresses in a conservative way, their clothes are conventional in style.
A conservative estimate or guess is one in which you are cautious and estimate or guess a low amount which is probably less that the real amount.

regard / consider / see / view / perceive
If you consider a person or thing to be something, you have the opinion that this is what they are.
If you consider something, you think about it carefully.
If you are considering doing something, you intend to do it, but have not yet made a final decision whether to do it.
Considerable means great in amount or degree.\n
Someone who is considerate pays attention to the needs, wishes, or feelings of other people.\n

Consideration is careful thought about something.
If something is under consideration, it is being discussed.
If you show consideration, you pay attention to the needs, wishes, or feelings of other people.
A consideration is something that should be thought about, especially when you are planning or deciding something.

If a way of doing something is convenient, it is easy, or very useful or suitable for a particular purpose.

If a law covers a particular set of people, things, or situations, it applies to them.
If you call someone a coward, you disapprove of them because they are easily frightened and avoid dangerous or difficult situations.\n
a person employed to tend cattle\n
A coyote is a small wolf which lives in the plains of North America.\n

A house or room that is cosy is comfortable and warm.

This one looked cozy and safe and worm.

If something crashes somewhere, it moves and hits something else violently, making a loud noise.
If a business or financial system crashes, it fails suddenly, often with serious effects.
If a computer or a computer program crashes, it fails suddenly.
to go to sleep because you are very tired\n

When you crawl, you move forward on your hands and knees.
When an insect crawls somewhere, it moves there quite slowly.

If you say that a place is crawling with people or animals, you are emphasizing that it is full of them.

She must have crawled out when we were looking at the paintings.\n

If someone or something has credibility, people believe in them and trust them.\n

A credit is an amount of money that is given to someone.
If you get the credit for something good, people praise you because you are responsible for it, or are thought to be responsible for it.

Jank and Annie crept to the cave and peeked inside. / The sabertooth crept forward.
Then he crept down the stairs
to start happening or affecting somebody/something gradually\n

to make somebody feel frightened and not safe\n
if a price, an amount, etc. creeps up, it rises very gradually\nto move nearer to somebody/something slowly and quietly without being seen or heard\n
If you say that something or someone is creepy, you mean they make you feel very nervous or frightened.\n

of, denoting, or formed in the last period of the Mesozoic era, between the Jurassic and Tertiary periods, lasting 80 million years during which chalk deposits were formed and flowering plants first appeared\nthe Cretaceous the Cretaceous period or rock system\n

Crickets chirped loudly.

Bread crumbs

You can refer to an important time or event, for example when an important decision has to be made, as the crunch.
A situation in which a business or economy has very little money can be referred to as a crunch.
Food that is crunchy is pleasantly hard or crisp so that it makes a noise when you eat it.\n

voca.means_en: A cub is a young wild animal such as a lion, wolf, or bear.\n
A cuckoo is a bird that has a call of two quick notes, and lays its eggs in other birds' nests.\n
If you cuddle someone, you put your arms round them and hold them close as a way of showing your affection.\n
Cultural means relating to a particular society and its ideas, customs, and art.\nCultural means involving or concerning the arts.\n

A cupboard is a piece of furniture that has one or two doors, usually contains shelves, and is used to store things. In British English, cupboard refers to all kinds of furniture like this. In American English, closet is usually used instead to refer to larger pieces of furniture\nA cupboard is a very small room that is used to store things, especially one without windows.\n
If you curb something, you control it and keep it within limits.\n

If doctors or medical treatments cure an illness or injury, they cause it to end or disappear.
If doctors or medical treatments cure a person, they make the person well again after an illness or injury.
If someone or something cures a problem, they bring it to an end.

Curiosity is a desire to know about something.\nA curiosity is something that is unusual, interesting, and fairly rare.\n

If your toes, fingers, or other parts of your body curl, or if you curl them, they form a curved or round shape.
If something curls somewhere, or if you curl it there, it moves there in a spiral or curve.

actual / current / present

in your most private thoughts; in reality rather than in appearance\n

voca.means_ko: [더r-t]\n먼지, 때, 흙\n(사람의 평판을 해칠 수 있는) 좋지않은 정보
voca.means_en:
soil / mud / clay / land / earth / dirt / ground
If there is dirt on something, there is dust, mud, or a stain on it.
A dirt road or track is made from hard earth. A dirt floor is made from earth without any cement, stone, or wood laid on it.
Annie stuck another stick into the dirt.
If someone dishes the dirt on you, they say bad things about you, without worrying if they are true or not, or if they will damage your reputation.
If you say that someone treats you like dirt, you are angry with them because you think that they treat you unfairly and with no respect.
an unsealed country road\n

voca.means_ko: 불리, 열세, 약점, 불리한 상태, 손해, 신용 상실
voca.means_en:
A disadvantage is a factor which makes someone or something less useful, acceptable, or successful than other people or things.
If you are at a disadvantage, you have a problem or difficulty that many other people do not have, which makes it harder for you to be successful.
If something is to your disadvantage or works to your disadvantage, it creates difficulties for you.

voca.means_ko: 동의하지 않는다, 일치하지 않다\n의견이 다르다\n(진술, 보고서 들이) 내용이 다르다/일치하지 않는다
voca.means_en: If you disagree with someone or disagree with what they say, you do not accept that what they say is true or correct. You can also say that two people disagree.\nIf you disagree with a particular action or proposal, you disapprove of it and believe that it is wrong.\n

If you say that someone or something disappears, you mean that you can no longer see them, usually because you or they have changed position.
If someone or something disappears, they go away or are taken away somewhere where nobody can find them.
If something disappears, it stops existing or happening.

If you refer to someone's disappearance, you are referring to the fact that nobody knows where they have gone.
If you refer to the disappearance of an object, you are referring to the fact that it has been lost or stolen.
The disappearance of a type of thing, person, or animal is a process in which it becomes less common and finally no longer exists.

voca.means_ko: [디s어포인t]\n실망시키다, 실망을 안겨 주다\n(바라던 일을) 좌절 시키다, 망치다
voca.means_en: If things or people disappoint you, they are not as good as you had hoped, or do not do what you hoped they would do.\n
If you feel or show disapproval of something or someone, you feel or show that you do not approve of them.\n

voca.means_ko: 탐탁찮아 하다, 못마땅해 하다, 반대하다\n~을 승인/인가/찬성하지 않다, 불만을 나타내다
voca.means_en: If you disapprove of something or someone, you feel or show that you do not like them or do not approve of them.\n
To disassemble something means to take it to pieces.\n

A disaster is a very bad accident such as an earthquake or a plane crash, especially one in which a lot of people are killed.
If you refer to something as a disaster, you are emphasizing that you think it is extremely bad or unacceptable.
Disaster is something which has very bad consequences for you.
Disbelief is not believing that something is true or real.\n

voca.means_ko: [디s카rd]\n(불필요한 것을) 버리다, 포기/폐기하다, 제거하다\n버리기, 포기, 버려진 것
voca.means_en: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it.\n

voca.means_ko: 제대하다, 방출/해고하다, 퇴원하다\n(에너지를) 방출하다, 발사/발포하다\n짐부리기, 방출, 해방, 퇴원, 수행, 이행
voca.means_en:
When someone is discharged from hospital, prison, or one of the armed services, they are officially allowed to leave, or told that they must leave.
If someone discharges their duties or responsibilities, they do everything that needs to be done in order to complete them.
If someone discharges a debt, they pay it.
If something is discharged from inside a place, it comes out.
When there is a discharge of a substance, the substance comes out from inside somewhere.

voca.means_ko: 훈련, 훈육, 징계, 규율, 기강, 절제력\n징계하다, 훈육하다, 스스로(심신을) 단련하다
voca.means_en:
Discipline is the practice of making people obey rules or standards of behaviour, and punishing them when they do not.
Discipline is the quality of being able to behave and work in a controlled way which involves obeying particular rules or standards.
A discipline is a particular area of study, especially a subject of study in a college or university.
If someone is disciplined for something that they have done wrong, they are punished for it.
If you discipline yourself to do something, you train yourself to behave and work in a strictly controlled and regular way.

voca.means_ko: [디s껄릐지]\n(무엇을 어렵게 만들거나 반대하여) 막다, 말리다, \n의욕/열의를 껃다, 좌절시키다
voca.means_en: If someone or something discourages you, they cause you to lose your enthusiasm about your actions.\nTo discourage an action or to discourage someone from doing it means to make them not want to do it.\n

If you discover something that you did not know about before, you become aware of it or learn of it.
If a person or thing is discovered, someone finds them, either by accident or because they have been looking for them.
When someone discovers a new place, substance, scientific fact, or scientific technique, they are the first person to find it or become aware of it.
If you say that someone has discovered a particular activity or subject, you mean that they have tried doing it or studying it for the first time and that they enjoyed it.
When a actor, musician, or other performer who is not well-known is discovered, someone recognizes that they have talent and helps them in their career.
A discus is a heavy circular object which athletes try to throw as far as they can as a sport.\nThe discus is the sport of throwing a discus.\n

talk / discuss / speak / communicate
If people discuss something, they talk about it, often in order to reach a decision.
If you discuss something, you write or talk about it in detail.

voca.means_ko: [디s꺼션]\n토론, 논의, 토의, 평의, 심의, 검토, 해설, 논문
voca.means_en:
discussion / conversation / dialogue / talk / consultation / chat / gossip
If there is discussion about something, people talk about it, often in order to reach a decision.
A discussion of a subject is a piece of writing or a lecture in which someone talks about it in detail.
A discussion document or paper is one that contains information and usually proposals for people to discuss.
disease / illness / disorder / infection / condition / ailment / bug\nA disease is an illness which affects people, animals, or plants, for example one which is caused by bacteria or infection.\n

hide / conceal / cover / disguise / mask / camouflage
If you are in disguise, you are not wearing your usual clothes or you have altered your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you.
If you disguise yourself, you put on clothes which make you look like someone else or alter your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you.
To disguise something means to hide it or make it appear different so that people will not know about it or will not recognize it.
disgusting / revolting / foul / repulsive / offensive / gross / nauseating\nIf you say that something is disgusting, you are criticizing it because it is extremely unpleasant.\n

A dish is a shallow container with a wide uncovered top. You eat and serve food from dishes and cook food in them.
The contents of a dish can be referred to as a dish of something.
Food that is prepared in a particular style or combination can be referred to as a dish.
All the objects that have been used to cook, serve, and eat a meal can be referred to as the dishes.
You can use dish to refer to anything that is round and hollow in shape with a wide uncovered top.
to criticize somebody or attack them\n

voca.means_ko: (흔히 많은 사람들에게 또는 많은 양을) 주다\n(식사때 음식을) 담아주다
voca.means_en: to give something out to large numbers of people or in large amounts\nto serve food to somebody by putting it on plates\n
to serve food by putting it on plates\n
to present or offer something to somebody, usually something not very good\n

voca.means_ko: 크게 놀라게 하다, 당황하게 하다\n경악, 당황, 의기소침, 실망, 낙담
voca.means_en:
Dismay is a strong feeling of fear, worry, or sadness that is caused by something unpleasant and unexpected.
If you are dismayed by something, it makes you feel afraid, worried, or sad.
You can't imagine my dismay when you started to take off for dinosaur times.

If you dismiss something, you decide or say that it is not important enough for you to think about or consider.
If you dismiss something from your mind, you stop thinking about it.
When an employer dismisses an employee, the employer tells the employee that they are no longer needed to do the job that they have been doing.
If you are dismissed by someone in authority, they tell you that you can go away from them.
When a judge dismisses a case against someone, he or she formally states that there is no need for a trial, usually because there is not enough evidence for the case to continue.

voca.means_ko: (말, 자전거) 내리다, 떼어내다\n말에서 내림, 하차, 떼내기

voca.means_en:
disease / illness / disorder / infection / condition / ailment / bug

Disorder is a state of being untidy, badly prepared, or badly organized.
Disorder is violence or rioting in publi

If you dispatch a message, letter, or parcel, you send it to a particular person or destination.
To dispatch a person or an animal means to kill them.
A dispatch is a special report that is sent to a newspaper or broadcasting organization by a journalist who is in a different town or country.

voca.means_en:
If someone dispenses something that they own or control, they give or provide it to a number of people.
If you obtain a product by getting it out of a machine, you can say that the machine dispenses the product.
When a chemist dispenses medicine, he or she prepares it, and gives or sells it to the patient or customer.
to get rid of something; to stop using somebody/something because they are/it is no longer necessary\n

A dispute is an argument or disagreement between people or groups.
If you dispute a fact, statement, or theory, you say that it is incorrect or untrue.
When people dispute something, they fight for control or ownership of it. You can also say that one group of people dispute something with another group.

The distance between two points or places is the amount of space between them.
When you want to emphasize that two people or things do not have a close relationship or are not the same, you can refer to the distance between them.
Distance learning or distance education involves studying at home and sending your work to a college or university, rather than attending the college or university in person.
If you distance yourself from a person or thing, or if something distances you from them, you feel less friendly or positive towards them, or become less involved with them.

If something is distinct from something else of the same type, it is different or separate from it.
If something is distinct, you can hear, see, or taste it clearly.
If an idea, thought, or intention is distinct, it is clear and definite.
You can use distinct to emphasize that something is great enough in amount or degree to be noticeable or important.
You can use several different methods to join distinct strings together.

구별, 차이, 차별, 우대, 훈장
voca.means_en:
A distinction between similar things is a difference.
Distinction is the quality of being very good or better than other things of the same type.
A distinction is a special award or honour that is given to someone because of their very high level of achievement.
If you say that someone or something has the distinction of being something, you are drawing attention to the fact that they have the special quality of being that thing. Distinction is normally used to refer to good qualities, but can sometimes also be used to refer to bad qualities.
Something that is distinctive has a special quality or feature which makes it easily recognizable and different from other things of the same type.\n

voca.means_ko:

유명하게 되다

identify / recognize / make out / discern / pick out / distinguish
If you can distinguish one thing from another or distinguish between two things, you can see or understand how they are different.
A feature or quality that distinguishes one thing from another causes the two things to be regarded as different, because only the first thing has the feature or quality.
If you can distinguish something, you can see, hear, or taste it although it is very difficult to detect.
If you distinguish yourself, you do something that makes you famous or important.

voca.means_en:
Distress is a state of extreme sorrow, suffering, or pain.
Distress is the state of being in extreme danger and needing urgent help.
If someone or something distresses you, they cause you to be upset or worried.

voca.means_en:

If you distribute things among the members of a group, you share them among those members.

If things are distributed throughout an area, object, or group, they exist throughout it.\n

If something is disturbed, its position or shape is changed.
If something disturbs a situation or atmosphere, it spoils it or causes trouble.

voca.means_ko: 방해(물), 불안, 장애, \n(공공장소에서의) 소란, 소동\n(심리적) 장애
voca.means_en:
A disturbance is an incident in which people behave violently in public.
Disturbance means upsetting or disorganizing something which was previously in a calm and well-ordered state.
You can use disturbance to refer to a medical or psychological problem, when someone's body or mind is not working in the normal way.
Something that is disturbing makes you feel worried or upset.\n

If you dive into some water, you jump in head-first with your arms held straight above your head.

When birds and animals dive, they go quickly downwards, head-first, through the air or through water.
If an aeroplane dives, it flies or drops down quickly and suddenly.
If you dive in a particular direction or into a particular place, you jump or move there quickly.
If you dive into a bag or container, you put your hands into it quickly in order to get something out.
If shares, profits, or figures dive, their value falls suddenly and by a large amount.
to start doing something with enthusiasm and without stopping to think\nto start eating with enthusiasm\n
to move your hand quickly into something such as a pocket or bag to try to find something\n

The diversity of something is the fact that it contains many very different elements.\nA diversity of things is a range of things which are very different from each other.\n

voca.means_en:
To divert vehicles or travellers means to make them follow a different route or go to a different destination than they originally intended. You can also say that someone or something diverts from a particular route or to a particular place.
To divert money or resources means to cause them to be used for a different purpose.
To divert a phone call means to send it to a different number or place from the one that was dialled by the person making the call.
If you say that someone diverts your attention from something important or serious, you disapprove of them behaving or talking in a way that stops you thinking about it.

The division of a large unit into two or more distinct parts is the act of separating it into these parts.
The division of something among people or things is its separation into parts which are distributed among the people or things.
Division is the arithmetical process of dividing one number into another number.
A division is a significant distinction or argument between two groups, which causes the two groups to be considered as very different and separate.
do - did - done
show somebody's good qualities; make somebody deserve praise\n
be kind and generous to people who need help, for example by working for a charity\n

If you dodge, you move suddenly, often to avoid being hit, caught, or seen.
If you dodge something, you avoid it by quickly moving aside or out of reach so that it cannot hit or reach you.
If you dodge something, you deliberately avoid thinking about it or dealing with it, often by being deceitful.
A doll is a child's toy which looks like a small person or baby.\n
A dome is a round roof.\nA dome is any object that has a similar shape to a dome.\n

Domestic political activities, events, and situations happen or exist within one particular country.
Domestic duties and activities are concerned with the running of a home and family.
Domestic items and services are intended to be used in people's homes rather than in factories or offices.
A domestic situation or atmosphere is one which involves a family and their home.
A domestic, a domestic help, or a domestic worker is a person who is paid to come to help with the work that has to be done in a house such as the cleaning, washing, and ironing.

To dominate a situation means to be the most powerful or important person or thing in it.

If a building, mountain, or other object dominates an area, it is so large or impressive that you cannot avoid seeing it.
If you donate something to a charity or other organization, you give it to them.\nIf you donate your blood or a part of your body, you allow doctors to use it to help someone who is ill.\n
A donation is something which someone gives to a charity or other organization.\n

If a fact or event dooms someone or something to a particular fate, it makes certain that they are going to suffer in some way.
a general feeling of having lost all hope and of pessimism (= expecting things to go badly)\n

Annie was peering through a doorway off the hall.\n

If you have doubt or doubts about something, you feel uncertain about it and do not know whether it is true or possible. If you say you have no doubt about it, you mean that you are certain it is true.
If you doubt whether something is true or possible, you believe that it is probably not true or possible.
If you doubt something, you believe that it might not be true or genuine.
If you doubt someone or doubt their word, you think that they may not be telling the truth.

The duration of an event or state is the time during which it happens or exists.\nIf you say that something will happen for the duration, you mean that it will happen for as long as a particular situation continues.\n

Duties are taxes which you pay to the government on goods that you buy.

If you dye something such as hair or cloth, you change its colour by soaking it in a special liquid.\nDye is a substance made from plants or chemicals which is mixed into a liquid and used to change the colour of something such as cloth or hair.\n

each / every
If you refer to each thing or each person in a group, you are referring to every member of the group and considering them as individuals.
If you refer to each one of the members of a group, you are emphasizing that something applies to every one of them.
If you are eager to do or have something, you want to do or have it very much.\nIf you look or sound eager, you look or sound as if you expect something interesting or enjoyable to happen.\n

The ears of a cereal plant such as wheat or barley are the parts at the top of the stem, which contain the seeds or grains.

our earlobes are the soft parts at the bottom of your ears.\n

earn a wage / earn ~ points

If you say something earnestly, you say it very seriously, often because you believe that it is important or you are trying to persuade someone else to believe it.
If you do something earnestly, you do it in a thorough and serious way, intending to succeed.
If you earnestly hope or wish for something, you hope or wish strongly and sincerely for it.

floor / ground / land / earth / soil
Earth or the Earth is the planet on which we live. People usually say Earth when they are referring to the planet as part of the universe, and the Earth when they are talking about the planet as the place where we live.
The earth is the land surface on which we live and move about.
Earth is the substance on the land surface of the earth, for example clay or sand, in which plants grow.
The earth in an electric plug or piece of electrical equipment is the wire through which electricity can pass into the ground, which makes the equipment safe if something goes wrong with it.

If you ease your way somewhere or ease somewhere, you move there slowly, carefully, and gently. If you ease something somewhere, you move it there slowly, carefully, and gently.
to gradually become less strong or unpleasant\nto go slower or make less effort\n
to go slower or make less effort; to do something less\nto start being less severe with somebody\n

If a job or action is easy, you can do it without difficulty or effort, because it is not complicated and causes no problems.
If you describe an action or activity as easy, you mean that it is done in a confident, relaxed way. If someone is easy about something, they feel relaxed and confident about it.
If you say that someone has an easy life, you mean that they live comfortably without any problems or worries.
If you say that something is easy or too easy, you are criticizing someone because they have done the most obvious or least difficult thing, and have not considered the situation carefully enough.
If you describe someone or something as easy prey or as an easy target, you mean that they can easily be attacked or criticized.
If you tell someone to go easy on something, you are telling them to use only a small amount of it.

If something is eating you, it is annoying or worrying you.
to gradually damage or destroy something\nto use or take away a large part of something valuable, especially money or time\n

if an emotion such as anger, etc. eats somebody up, it worries them all the time and they cannot think of anything else\n

used to tell somebody to eat quickly or to eat everything they have been given\n
Ebony is a very hard, heavy, dark-coloured wood.\nSomething that is ebony is a very deep black colour.\n

voca.means_en: An eclipse of the sun is an occasion when the moon is between the earth and the sun, so that for a short time you cannot see part or all of the sun. An eclipse of the moon is an occasion when the earth is between the sun and the moon, so that for a short time you cannot see part or all of the moon.\nIf one thing is eclipsed by a second thing that is bigger, newer, or more important than it, the first thing is no longer noticed because the second thing gets all the attention.\n

economic / economical / financial / commercial / monetary / budgetary
Economic means concerned with the organization of the money, industry, and trade of a country, region, or society.
If something is economic, it produces a profit.
Economics is the study of the way in which money, industry, and trade are organized in a society.\nThe economics of a society or industry is the system of organizing money and trade in it.\n

voca.means_en:
An economy is the system according to which the money, industry, and trade of a country or region are organized.
A country's economy is the wealth that it gets from business and industry.
Economy is the use of the minimum amount of money, time, or other resources needed to achieve something, so that nothing is wasted.
Economy services such as travel are cheap and have no luxuries or extras.

excited / ecstatic / elated / rapturous / euphoric / exhilarated / on top of the world
If you are ecstatic, you feel very happy and full of excitement.
You can use ecstatic to describe reactions that are very enthusiastic and excited. For example, if someone receives an ecstatic reception or an ecstatic welcome, they are greeted with great enthusiasm and excitement.

voca.means_en:
The edge of something is the place or line where it stops, or the part of it that is furthest from the middle.
The edge of something sharp such as a knife or an axe is its sharp or narrow side.
The edge of something, especially something bad, is the point at which it may start to happen.
If someone or something has an edge, they have an advantage that makes them stronger or more likely to be successful than another thing or person.

If you edit a text such as an article or a book, you correct and adapt it so that it is suitable for publishing.
If you edit a book or a series of books, you collect several pieces of writing by different authors and prepare them for publishing.
If you edit a film or a television or radio programme, you choose some of what has been filmed or recorded and arrange it in a particular order.
Someone who edits a newspaper, magazine, or journal is in charge of it.
An edit is the process of examining and correcting a text so that it is suitable for publishing.
Education involves teaching people various subjects, usually at a school or college, or being taught.\nEducation of a particular kind involves teaching the public about a particular issue.\n
An eel is a long, thin fish that looks like a snake.\n

affect / effect
effect / result / consequence / outcome / repercussion
The effect of one thing on another is the change that the first thing causes in the second thing.
An effect is an impression that someone creates deliberately, for example in a place or in a piece of writing.
If you effect something that you are trying to achieve, you succeed in causing it to happen.

Something that is effective works well and produces the results that were intended.
Effective means having a particular role or result in practice, though not officially or in theory.
When something such as a law or an agreement becomes effective, it begins officially to apply or be valid.
You’ll learn how to use functions to make your code more efficient and flexible.\n

If you make an effort to do something, you try very hard to do it.
If you say that someone did something with effort or with an effort, you mean it was difficult for them to do.
An effort is a particular series of activities that is organized by a group of people in order to achieve something.
If you say that something is an effort, you mean that an unusual amount of physical or mental energy is needed to do it.
Something that is effortless is done easily and well.\nYou use effortless to describe a quality that someone has naturally and does not have to learn.\n
An egotist is someone who is egotistic.

voca.means_en:
neither / either
You use either in front of the first of two or more alternatives, when you are stating the only possibilities or choices that there are. The other alternatives are introduced by `or'.
You use either in a negative statement in front of the first of two alternatives to indicate that the negative statement refers to both the alternatives.
You can use either to refer to one of two things, people, or situations, when you want to say that they are both possible and it does not matter which one is chosen or considered.
You use either by itself in negative statements to indicate that there is a similarity or connection with a person or thing that you have just mentioned.

voca.means_en:
You use elaborate to describe something that is very complex because it has a lot of different parts.
Elaborate plans, systems, and procedures are complicated because they have been planned in very great detail, sometimes too much detail.
Elaborate clothing or material is made with a lot of detailed artistic designs.
If you elaborate a plan or theory, you develop it by making it more complicated and more effective.
to explain or describe something in a more detailed way\n
When time elapses, it passes.\n

Elastic is a rubber material that stretches when you pull it and returns to its original size and shape when you let it go. Elastic is often used in clothes to make them fit tightly, for example round the waist.
Something that is elastic is able to stretch easily and then return to its original size and shape.
If ideas, plans, or policies are elastic, they are able to change to suit new circumstances or conditions as they occur.

Your elbow is the part of your arm where the upper and lower halves of the arm are joined.
If you elbow people aside or elbow your way somewhere, you push people with your elbows in order to move somewhere.
If someone or something elbows their way somewhere, or elbows other people or things out of the way, they achieve success by being aggressive and determined.

voca.means_en:
electric / electrical
An electric device or machine works by means of electricity, rather than using some other source of power.
An electric current, voltage, or charge is one that is produced by electricity.
Electric plugs, sockets, or power lines are designed to carry electricity.
If you describe the atmosphere of a place or event as electric, you mean that people are in a state of great excitement.

electric / electrical
Electrical goods, equipment, or appliances work by means of electricity.
Electrical systems or parts supply or use electricity.
Electrical energy is energy in the form of electricity.
Electrical industries, engineers, or workers are involved in the production and supply of electricity or electrical goods.
Electricity is a form of energy that can be carried by wires and is used for heating and lighting, and to provide power for machines.\n

If you describe a person or thing as elegant, you mean that they are pleasing and graceful in appearance or style.\nIf you describe a piece of writing, an idea, or a plan as elegant, you mean that it is simple, clear, and clever.\n

The different elements of something are the different parts it contains.
A particular element of a situation, activity, or process is an important quality or feature that it has or needs.
When you talk about elements within a society or organization, you are referring to groups of people who have similar aims, beliefs, or habits.
If something has an element of a particular quality or emotion, it has a certain amount of this quality or emotion.
Something that is elementary is very simple and basic.\n
An elephant is a very large animal with a long, flexible nose called a trunk, which it uses to pick up things. Elephants live in India and Africa.\n
If you elicit a response or a reaction, you do or say something which makes other people respond or react.\nIf you elicit a piece of information, you get it by asking the right questions.\n
If you elide something, especially a distinction, you leave it out or ignore it.\nIn linguistics, if you elide a word, you do not pronounce or write it fully.\n

To eliminate something, especially something you do not want or need, means to remove it completely.
When a person or team is eliminated from a competition, they are defeated and so take no further part in the competition.
If someone says that they have eliminated an enemy, they mean that they have killed them. By using the word 'eliminate', they are trying to make the action sound more positive than if they used the word 'kill'.
the omission of a syllable or vowel at the beginning or end of a word, esp when a word ending with a vowel is next to one beginning with a vowel\nany omission of a part or parts\n

voca.means_en: You use else after words such as 'anywhere', 'someone', and 'what', to refer in a vague way to another person, place, or thing.\nYou use else after words such as 'everyone', 'everything', and 'everywhere' to refer in a vague way to all the other people, things, or places except the one you are talking about.\n

voca.means_en: Elsewhere means in other places or to another place.\n

If something or someone embarrasses you, they make you feel shy or ashamed.\nIf something embarrasses a public figure such as a politician or an organization such as a political party, it causes problems for them.\n

Something that is embarrassing makes you feel shy or ashamed.\nSomething that is embarrassing to a public figure such as a politician or an organization such as a political party causes problems for them.\n

voca.means_en: If an object embeds itself in a substance or thing, it becomes fixed there firmly and deeply.\nIf something such as an attitude or feeling is embedded in a society or system, or in someone's personality, it becomes a permanent and noticeable feature of it.\n

If you embrace someone, you put your arms around them and hold them tightly, usually in order to show your love or affection for them. You can also say that two people embrace.
If you embrace a change, political system, or idea, you accept it and start supporting it or believing in it.
If something embraces a group of people, things, or ideas, it includes them in a larger group or category.

If something such as clothing or cloth is embroidered with a design, the design is stitched into it.\nIf you embroider a story or account of something, or if you embroider on it, you try to make it more interesting by adding details which may be untrue.\n
Embroidery consists of designs stitched into cloth.\nEmbroidery is the activity of stitching designs onto cloth.\n

An embryo is an unborn animal or human being in the very early stages of development.\nAn embryo idea, system, or organization is in the very early stages of development, but is expected to grow stronger.\n

To emerge means to come out from an enclosed or dark space such as a room or a vehicle, or from a position where you could not be seen.

If a fact or result emerges from a period of thought, discussion, or investigation, it becomes known as a result of it.
If someone or something emerges as a particular thing, they become recognized as that thing.
The emergence of something is the process or event of its coming into existence.\n

An emergency is an unexpected and difficult or dangerous situation, especially an accident, which happens suddenly and which requires quick action to deal with it.
An emergency action is one that is done or arranged quickly and not in the normal way, because an emergency has occurred.
Emergency equipment or supplies are those intended for use in an emergency.
An emergent country, political movement, or social group is one that is becoming powerful or coming into existence.\n

An emotion is a feeling such as happiness, love, fear, anger, or hatred, which can be caused by the situation that you are in or the people you are with.\nEmotion is the part of a person's character that consists of their feelings, as opposed to their thoughts.\n
If you describe someone as emotionless, you mean that they do not show any feelings or emotions.\n
An emperor is a man who rules an empire or is the head of state in an empire.\n

Emphasis is special or extra importance that is given to an activity or to a part or aspect of something.\nEmphasis is extra force that you put on a syllable, word, or phrase when you are speaking in order to make it seem more important.\n
stress / emphasize\nTo emphasize something means to indicate that it is particularly important or true, or to draw special attention to it.\n

An emphatic response or statement is one made in a forceful way, because the speaker feels very strongly about what they are saying.
If you are emphatic about something, you use forceful language which shows that you feel very strongly about what you are saying.
An emphatic win or victory is one in which the winner has won by a large amount or distance.
If you say something emphatically, you say it in a forceful way which shows that you feel very strongly about what you are saying.\nYou use emphatically to emphasize the statement you are making.\n

If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it.

To enable someone to do something means to give them permission or the right to do it.
To encapsulate particular facts or ideas means to represent all their most important aspects in a very small space or in a single object or event.\n

If you are enchanted by someone or something, they cause you to have feelings of great delight or pleasure.\nIn fairy stories and legends, to enchant someone or something means to put a magic spell on them.\n

If you say that something has enchantment, you mean that it makes you feel great delight or pleasure. Your enchantment with something is the fact of your feeling great delight and pleasure because of it.\nIn fairy stories and legends, an enchantment is a magic spell.\n
In fairy stories and legends, an enchantress is a woman who uses magic to put spells on people and things.\nAs always, Jack was very happy to see the enchantress librarian again.\n
If a place or object is enclosed by something, the place or object is inside that thing or completely surrounded by it.\n

If you encounter problems or difficulties, you experience them.

An encounter is a particular type of experience.

If you encourage someone, you give them confidence, for example by letting them know that what they are doing is good and telling them that they should continue to do it.
If someone is encouraged by something that happens, it gives them hope or confidence.
If you encourage someone to do something, you try to persuade them to do it, for example by telling them that it would be a pleasant thing to do, or by trying to make it easier for them to do it. You can also encourage an activity.
If something encourages a particular activity or state, it causes it to happen or increase.
If a document or piece of information is encrypted, it is written in a special code, so that only certain people can read it.\n

The end of something such as a period of time, an event, a book, or a film is the last part of it or the final point in it.
An end to something or the end of it is the act or result of stopping it so that it does not continue any longer.
The two ends of something long and narrow are the two points or parts of it that are furthest away from each other.
When a situation, process, or activity ends, or when something or someone ends it, it reaches its final point and stops.
If you say that someone or something ends a period of time in a particular way, you are indicating what the final situation was like. You can also say that a period of time ends in a particular way.
to have something as an ending or as a result\n
kill yourself; commit suicide\n
in a line, with the ends touching\n

in danger: used esp of animals in danger of extinction\n
If you say that something is endless, you mean that it is very large or lasts for a very long time, and it seems as if it will never stop.\n
Endurance is the ability to continue with an unpleasant or difficult situation, experience, or activity over a long period of time.\n

If someone is your enemy, they hate you or want to harm you.
If someone is your enemy, they are opposed to you and to what you think or do
The enemy is an army or other force that is opposed to you in a war, or a country with which your country is at war.
If one thing is the enemy of another thing, the second thing cannot happen or succeed because of the first thing.

If people in authority enforce a law or a rule, they make sure that it is obeyed, usually by punishing people who do not obey it.\nTo enforce something means to force or cause it to be done or to happen.\n

If you engage someone in conversation, you have a conversation with them.
If you engage with something or with a group of people, you get involved with that thing or group and feel that you are connected with it or have real contact with it.
If you engage someone to do a particular job, you appoint them to do it.

to take part in something; to make somebody take part in something; to be busy doing something\n

An engagement is an arrangement that you have made to do something at a particular time.
An engagement is an agreement that two people have made with each other to get married.
You can refer to the period of time during which two people are engaged as their engagement.
A military engagement is an armed conflict between two enemies.
If you engrave something with a design or words, or if you engrave a design or words on it, you cut the design or words into its surface.\nThe letter M was engraved on it.\n
Someone or something that is enigmatic is mysterious and difficult to understand.\n
If someone enlists or is enlisted, they join the army, navy, marines, or air force.\nIf you enlist the help of someone, you persuade them to help or support you in doing something.\n

Enough means as much as you need or as much as is necessary.

You use enough in expressions such as strangely enough and interestingly enough to indicate that you think a fact is strange or interesting.
If you say that you have had enough, you mean that you are unhappy with a situation and you want it to stop.

An enthusiast is a person who is very interested in a particular activity or subject and who spends a lot of time on it.\n
If you are enthusiastic about something, you show how much you like or enjoy it by the way that you behave and talk.\n
You use entire when you want to emphasize that you are referring to the whole of something, for example, the whole of a place, time, or population.\n
He has my entire confidence.\n

An entity is something that exists separately from other things and has a clear identity of its own.\n

An entry for a competition is a piece of work, for example a story or drawing, or the answers to a set of questions, which you complete in order to take part in the competition.
Entry in a competition is the act of taking part in it.

Envy is the feeling you have when you wish you could have the same thing or quality that someone else has.

If you envy someone, you wish that you had the same things or qualities that they have.

If you describe something as ephemeral, you mean that it lasts only for a very short time.\n
An epic is a long book, poem, or film, whose story extends over a long period of time or tells of great events.\nSomething that is epic is very large and impressive.\n
Equality is the same status, rights, and responsibilities for all the members of a society, group, or family.\n

If you erase a thought or feeling, you destroy it completely so that you can no longer remember something or no longer feel a particular emotion.

If you erase something such as writing or a mark, you remove it, usually by rubbing it with a cloth.
An eraser is an object, usually a piece of rubber or plastic, which is used for removing something that has been written using a pencil or a pen.\n

voca.means_en: mistake / error / inaccuracy / slip / howler / misprint / typo\nAn error is something you have done which is considered to be incorrect or wrong, or which should not have been done.\n

When people in a place suddenly become angry or violent, you can say that they erupt or that the place erupts.
You say that someone erupts when they suddenly have a change in mood, usually becoming quite noisy.
If your skin erupts, sores or spots suddenly appear there.

If you escape from a place, you succeed in getting away from it.

If something escapes you or escapes your attention, you do not know about it, do not remember it, or do not notice it.

voca.means_en:
If you say that something, usually something large, extends for a particular distance or extends from one place to another, you are indicating its size or position.
If an object extends from a surface or place, it sticks out from it.
If an event or activity extends over a period of time, it continues for that time.
If something extends to a group of people, things, or activities, it includes or affects them.
If you extend something, you make it longer or bigger.
If a piece of equipment or furniture extends, its length can be increased.

voca.means_ko: 넓이, 크기, 길이, 양, 범위, 정도, 한도
voca.means_en:
If you are talking about how great, important, or serious a difficulty or situation is, you can refer to the extent of it.
The extent of something is its length, area, or size.
You use expressions such as to a large extent, to some extent, or to a certain extent in order to indicate that something is partly true, but not entirely true.

The extinction of a species of animal or plant is the death of all its remaining living members.\nIf someone refers to the extinction of a way of life or type of activity, they mean that the way of life or activity stops existing.\n

voca.means_ko: 여분의, 추가의, 추가되는 것\n여분으로, 특별히, 각별히
voca.means_en:
You use extra to describe an amount, person, or thing that is added to others of the same kind, or that can be added to others of the same kind.
If something is extra, you have to pay more money for it in addition to what you are already paying for something.
Extras are additional amounts of money that are added to the price that you have to pay for something.
You can use extra in front of adjectives and adverbs to emphasize the quality that they are describing.

voca.means_ko:
[익st뤡-t]
발췌, 추출물,

voca.means_en:
To extract a substance means to obtain it from something else, for example by using industrial or chemical processes.
If you extract something from a place, you take it out or pull it out.
When a dentist extracts a tooth, they remove it from the patient's mouth.
If you say that someone extracts something, you disapprove of them because they take it for themselves to gain an advantage.
An extract from a book or piece of writing is a small part of it that is printed or published separately.
An extract is a substance that has been obtained from something else, for example by means of a chemical or industrial process.
Extracurricular activities are activities for students that are not part of their course.\nExtracurricular activities are activities that someone does that are not part of their normal work.\n

Extreme means very great in degree or intensity.
You use extreme to describe situations and behaviour which are much more severe or unusual than you would expect, especially when you disapprove of them because of this.
You use extreme to describe opinions, beliefs, or political movements which you disapprove of because they are very different from those that most people would accept as reasonable or normal.
The extreme end or edge of something is its furthest end or edge.
You can use extremes to refer to situations or types of behaviour that have opposite qualities to each other, especially when each situation or type of behaviour has such a quality to the greatest degree possible.
You use extremely in front of adjectives and adverbs to emphasize that the specified quality is present to a very great degree.\n
Someone who is extrovert is very active, lively, and friendly.\n

voca.means_ko: [아이]\n(한쪽) 눈, 안구, 시력, 눈매, 눈길\n쳐다보다, 눈여겨 보다, 관찰하다
voca.means_en:
Your eyes are the parts of your body with which you see.
You use eye when you are talking about a person's ability to judge things or about the way in which they are considering or dealing with things.
An eye on a potato is one of the dark spots from which new stems grow.
An eye is a small metal loop which a hook fits into, as a fastening on a piece of clothing.
to look closely at something, because you want it or are interested in it\n
Your eyebrows are the lines of hair which grow above your eyes.\n

voca.means_en: having an eye or eyes (as specified)\n
Your eyelashes are the hairs which grow on the edges of your eyelids.\n

A fable is a story which teaches a moral lesson. Fables sometimes have animals as the main characters.\nYou can describe a statement or explanation that is untrue but that many people believe as fable.\n

material / fabric / cloth / textile
Fabric is cloth or other material produced by weaving together cotton, nylon, wool, silk, or other threads. Fabrics are used for making things such as clothes, curtains, and sheets.
The fabric of a society or system is its basic structure, with all the customs and beliefs that make it work successfully.
The fabric of a building is its walls, roof, and the materials with which it is built.

voca.means_ko: [풰뷸러s]\n기막히게 좋은, 엄청난, 굉장히 좋은, 멋진, 놀라운
voca.means_en: great / cool / fantastic / fabulous / terrific / brilliant / awesome\nIf you describe something as fabulous, you are emphasizing that you like it a lot or think that it is very good.\n

얼굴
표면, 겉면, (무엇의 특별한) 측면

voca.means_en:
Your face is the front part of your head from your chin to the top of your forehead, where your mouth, eyes, nose, and other features are.
If your face is happy, sad, or serious, for example, the expression on your face shows that you are happy, sad, or serious.
The face of a cliff, mountain, or building is a vertical surface or side of it.
If someone or something faces a particular thing, person, or direction, they are positioned opposite them or are looking in that direction.
If you face someone or something, you turn so that you are looking at them.
to start the game\nto get ready to argue, fight or compete with somebody\n
Jack hit the ground and fell facedown into the dust.\n

voca.means_en: To facilitate an action or process, especially one that you would like to happen, means to make it easier or more likely to happen.\n

(타고난) 재능
voca.means_en: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose.\nA facility is something such as an additional service provided by an organization or an extra feature on a machine which is useful but not essential.\n

voca.means_en:
You use the fact that after some verbs or prepositions, especially in expressions such as in view of the fact that, apart from the fact that, and despite the fact that, to link the verb or preposition with a clause.
You use the fact that instead of a simple that-clause either for emphasis or because the clause is the subject of your sentence.
You use in fact, in actual fact, or in point of fact to indicate that you are giving more detailed information about what you have just said.
When you refer to something as a fact or as fact, you mean that you think it is true or correct.
Facts are pieces of information that can be discovered.
something difficult or unpleasant that cannot be changed and has to be accepted or dealt with\n
factory / plant / mill / works / yard / workshop / foundry\nA factory is a large building where machines are used to make large quantities of goods.\n
You use fad to refer to an activity or topic of interest that is very popular for a short time, but which people become bored with very quickly.\n

voca.means_en:
When a coloured object fades or when the light fades it, it gradually becomes paler.
When light fades, it slowly becomes less bright. When a sound fades, it slowly becomes less loud.
When something that you are looking at fades, it slowly becomes less bright or clear until it disappears.
If memories, feelings, or possibilities fade, they slowly become less intense or less strong.
to gradually become less strong, clear or frequent and disappear\nto become weaker and die\n

if a sound or a picture in a film/movie, etc. fades in, or somebody fades it in, it gradually becomes louder or clearer\n
to become quieter, weaker, etc. and gradually disappear\n
a variation in the strength of received radio signals due to variations in the conditions of the transmission medium\nThe fading daylight lit a piano in the corner of the room.\n
Fahrenheit is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 32 degrees and boils at 212 degrees. It is represented by the symbol F.\n

voca.means_en:
If you fail to do something that you were trying to do, you are unable to do it or do not succeed in doing it.
If an activity, attempt, or plan fails, it is not successful.
If someone or something fails to do a particular thing that they should have done, they do not do it.
If something fails, it stops working properly, or does not do what it is supposed to do.
If a business, organization, or system fails, it becomes unable to continue in operation or in existence.
If something such as your health or a physical quality is failing, it is becoming gradually weaker or less effective.

voca.means_en:
A faint sound, colour, mark, feeling, or quality has very little strength or intensity.
A faint attempt at something is one that is made without proper effort and with little enthusiasm.
Someone who is faint feels weak and unsteady as if they are about to lose consciousness.
If you faint, you lose consciousness for a short time, especially because you are hungry, or because of pain, heat, or shock.
He felt faint.

quite / fairly / rather / pretty
Fairly means to quite a large degree. For example, if you say that something is fairly old, you mean that it is old but not very old.
You use fairly instead of `very' to add emphasis to an adjective or adverb without making it sound too forceful.

A fairy is an imaginary creature with magical powers. Fairies are often represented as small people with wings.\nIf someone describes a man as a fairy, they mean that he is a homosexual and they disapprove of this.\n

voca.means_en:
artificial / synthetic / false / man-made / fake / imitation
A fake fur or a fake painting, for example, is a fur or painting that has been made to look valuable or genuine, usually in order to deceive people.
If someone fakes something, they try to make it look valuable or genuine, although in fact it is not.
If you fake a feeling, emotion, or reaction, you pretend that you are experiencing it when you are not.
Someone who is a fake is not what they claim to be, for example because they do not have the qualifications that they claim to have.
to trick somebody; to make somebody think you are going to do one thing and then do another\n

voca.means_en:
fall - fell - fallen
If someone or something falls, they move quickly downwards onto or towards the ground, by accident or because of a natural force.
If a person or structure that is standing somewhere falls, they move from their upright position, so that they are then lying on the ground.
When rain or snow falls, it comes down from the sky.
If you fall somewhere, you allow yourself to drop there in a hurried or disorganized way, often because you are very tired.
If something falls, it decreases in amount, value, or strength.
If a powerful or successful person falls, they suddenly lose their power or position.
If a place falls in a war or election, an enemy army or a different political party takes control of it.
You can use fall to show that someone or something passes into another state. For example, if someone falls ill, they become ill, and if something falls into disrepair, it is then in a state of disrepair.
He fell right over and lay on his side.

voca.means_en: She clutched the mammoth's ears to keep from falling off.\n

to be the responsibility or duty of a particular person or organization
if your eyes fall on somebody/something, you suddenly see or notice them/it
to attack somebody/something with energy or enthusiasm

The canoe rocked. He nearly fell out.

voca.means_en: We don't want to fall over in these suits.\n
to start doing something\n

artificial / synthetic / false / man-made / fake / imitation
If something is false, it is incorrect, untrue, or mistaken.
You use false to describe objects which are artificial but which are intended to look like the real thing or to be used instead of the real thing.
If you describe a person or their behaviour as false, you are criticizing them for being insincere or for hiding their real feelings.
If you achieve fame, you become very well-known.\n

If you familiarize yourself with something, or if someone familiarizes you with it, you learn about it and start to understand it.\nOf course, the core piece of knowledge you need to use a language is to know the language itself, and  familiarize yourself with its syntax and modules.\n
Famine is a situation in which large numbers of people have little or no food, and many of them die.\n

You use famously to refer to a fact that is well known, usually because it is remarkable or extreme.\nIf you get on or get along famously with someone, you are very friendly with each other and enjoy meeting and being together.\n

voca.means_en:
If you fancy something, you want to have it or to do it.
If you fancy someone, you feel attracted to them, especially in a sexual way.
If you fancy yourself as a particular kind of person or fancy yourself doing a particular thing, you like the idea of being that kind of person or doing that thing.
If you say that someone fancies themselves as a particular kind of person, you mean that they think, often wrongly, that they have the good qualities which that kind of person has.
A fancy is a liking or desire for someone or something, especially one that does not last long.
A giant tiger with two long sharp fangs.\n

voca.means_en:
If one place, thing, or person is far away from another, there is a great distance between them.
If you ask how far a place is, you are asking what distance it is from you or from another place. If you ask how far someone went, you are asking what distance they travelled, or what place they reached.
A time or event that is far away in the future or the past is a long time from the present or from a particular point in time.
You can talk about how far someone or something gets to describe the progress that they make.
You can use far to mean `very much' when you are comparing two things and emphasizing the difference between them. For example, you can say that something is far better or far worse than something else to indicate that it is very much better or worse. You can also say that something is, for example, far too big to indicate that it is very much too big.
When there are two things of the same kind in a place, the far one is the one that is a greater distance from you.
everywhere and many places; over a large area\n
not at all; certainly not\n
A faraway place is a long distance from you or from a particular place.\n

A fare is the money that you pay for a journey that you make, for example, in a bus, train, or taxi.\nIf you say that someone or something fares well or badly, you are referring to the degree of success they achieve in a particular situation or activity.\n
Farewell means the same as goodbye.\n
If someone farts, air is forced out of their body through their anus.\n

farther / further / farthest / furthest
Farther is a comparative form of far.
She pointed at a painting farther down the wall.

voca.means_en:
Fast means happening, moving, or doing something at great speed. You also use fast in questions or statements about speed.
You use fast to say that something happens without any delay.
If you fast, you eat no food for a period of time, usually for either religious or medical reasons, or as a protest.

voca.means_en: When you fasten something, you close it by means of buttons or a strap, or some other device. If something fastens with buttons or straps, you can close it in this way.\nIf you fasten one thing to another, you attach the first thing to the second, for example with a piece of string or tape.\n
She fastened the silk off with her watching TV.\n

voca.means_en: to close, or to make something close, with buttons, etc.\n

If you say that a person or animal is fat, you mean that they have a lot of flesh on their body and that they weigh too much. You usually use the word fat when you think that this is a bad thing.
A fat object, especially a book, is very thick or wide.
A fat profit or fee is a large one.
Fat is the extra flesh that animals and humans have under their skin, which is used to store energy and to help keep them warm.
Fat is a solid or liquid substance obtained from animals or vegetables, which is used in cooking.
Fat is a substance contained in foods such as meat, cheese, and butter which forms an energy store in your body.
A fatal action has very undesirable effects.\nA fatal accident or illness causes someone's death.\n

재해, 재난, 치사성
voca.means_en: A fatality is a death caused by an accident or by violence.\n

voca.means_en:
luck / chance / coincidence / accident / fortune / fate / destiny / providence
Fate is a power that some people believe controls and decides everything that happens, in a way that cannot be prevented or changed. You can also refer to the fates.
A person's or thing's fate is what happens to them.
If something seals a person's or thing's fate, it makes it certain that they will fail or that something unpleasant will happen to them.
A faucet is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas from a pipe or container. Sinks and baths have faucets attached to them.\n

If a bad or undesirable situation is your fault, you caused it or are responsible for it.
A fault is a mistake in what someone is doing or in what they have done.
A fault in someone or something is a weakness in them or something that is not perfect.
If you cannot fault someone, you cannot find any reason for criticizing them or the things that they are doing.
