voca.means_en:
fear / alarm / apprehension / fright / foreboding
Fear is the unpleasant feeling you have when you think that you are in danger.
A fear is a thought that something unpleasant might happen or might have happened.
If you say that there is a fear that something unpleasant or undesirable will happen, you mean that you think it is possible or likely
If you have fears for someone or something, you are very worried because you think that they might be in danger.
If you fear something unpleasant or undesirable, you are worried that it might happen or might have happened.
If you fear for someone or something, you are very worried because you think that they might be in danger

If you are fearful of something, you are afraid of it.
You use fearful to emphasize how serious or bad a situation is.
Fearful is used to emphasize that something is very bad.

voca.means_ko: [퓌-st]\n연회, 잔치, 축제, 향연, (종교적인) 제례, 성찬\n대접받다, 즐기다, 성찬으로 대접하다
voca.means_en:
A feast is a large and special meal.
A feast is a day or time of the year when a special religious celebration takes place.
If you feast on a particular food, you eat a large amount of it with great enjoyment.
If you feast, you take part in a feast.
look at somebody/something and get great pleasure\n
A bird's feathers are the soft covering on its body. Each feather consists of a lot of smooth hairs on each side of a thin stiff centre.\n

A feature of something is an interesting or important part or characteristic of it.
Your features are your eyes, nose, mouth, and other parts of your face.
A feature is a special article in a newspaper or magazine, or a special programme on radio or television.
A feature or a feature film or movie is a full-length film about a fictional situation, as opposed to a short film or a documentary.
When something such as a film or exhibition features a particular person or thing, they are an important part of it.
If someone or something features in something such as a show, exhibition, or magazine, they are an important part of it.

A federal country or system of government is one in which the different states or provinces of the country have important powers to make their own laws and decisions.
Some people use federal to describe a system of government which they disapprove of, in which the different states or provinces are controlled by a strong central government.
Federal also means belonging or relating to the national government of a federal country rather than to one of the states within it.

voca.means_en:
rate / charge / fee / rent / dues / toll / rental / tariff
A fee is a sum of money that you pay to be allowed to do something.
A fee is the amount of money that a person or organization is paid for a particular job or service that they provide.

feel - felt - felt
If you feed a person or animal, you give them food to eat and sometimes actually put it in their mouths.
To feed a family or a community means to supply food for them.
When an animal feeds, it eats or drinks something.
When a baby feeds, or when you feed it, it drinks breast milk or milk from a bottle.
Animal feed is food given to animals, especially farm animals.
to have an influence on the development of something\n
to use something as food; to eat something; to get strength from something\nto become stronger because of something else\n
to give extra food to a person or an animal to make them stronger and more healthy\n

If you get feedback on your work or progress, someone tells you how well or badly you are doing, and how you could improve. If you get good feedback you have worked or performed well.\nFeedback is the unpleasant high-pitched sound produced by a piece of electrical equipment when part of the signal that comes out goes back into it.\n
not feel comfortable in a situation; have an unpleasant physical feeling\n

voca.means_en:
You use fellow to describe people who are in the same situation as you, or people you feel you have something in common with.
A fellow is a man or boy.
Your fellows are the people who you work with, do things with, or who are like you in some way.
A fellow of an academic or professional association is someone who is a specially elected member of it, usually because of their work or achievements or as a mark of honour.

A fence is a barrier between two areas of land, made of wood or wire supported by posts.
A fence in show jumping or horse racing is an obstacle or barrier that horses have to jump over.
If you fence an area of land, you surround it with a fence.
to separate one area from another with a fence, often to stop people or animals from entering\n
A fern is a plant that has long stems with feathery leaves and no flowers. There are many types of fern.\n
They made ropes by braiding plant fibers.\n

If you describe someone as fickle, you disapprove of them because they keep changing their mind about what they like or want.\nIf you say that something is fickle, you mean that it often changes and is unreliable.\n

If you fiddle with an object, you keep moving it or touching it with your fingers.
Some people call violins fiddles, especially when they are used to play folk music.
The air was filled with wild fiddle music and bagpipe playing.

A fierce animal or person is very aggressive or angry.
Fierce feelings or actions are very intense or enthusiastic, or involve great activity.
Fierce conditions are very intense, great, or strong.
He knew that the samurai were fierce Japanese fighters.
The samurai were fierce Japanese fighers.
These bears were larger and fiercer than toay's grizzlies.

voca.means_ko: [퐈이어뤼]\n불타는 듯한, 불의, 불붙은, \n(성질이) 불 같은, 격렬한
voca.means_en:
If you describe something as fiery, you mean that it is burning strongly or contains fire.
You can use fiery for emphasis when you are referring to bright colours such as red or orange.
If you describe food or drink as fiery, you mean that it has a very strong hot or spicy taste.
If you describe someone as fiery, you mean that they express very strong emotions, especially anger, in their behaviour or speech
A fig is a soft sweet fruit that grows in hot countries. It is full of tiny seeds and is often eaten dried.\nA fig or a fig tree is a tree on which figs grow.\n
avoid something or doing something; not want to do something\n

A figure is a particular amount expressed as a number, especially a statistic.
A figure is any of the ten written symbols from 0 to 9 that are used to represent a number.
You refer to someone that you can see as a figure when you cannot see them clearly or when you are describing them.
In art, a figure is a person in a drawing or a painting, or a statue of a person.
Someone who is referred to as a figure of a particular kind is a person who is well-known and important in some way.
If you figure that something is the case, you think or guess that it is the case.
If you say 'That figures' or 'It figures', you mean that the fact referred to is not surprising.
to include something in your plans; to plan something\n

voca.means_ko: (생각한 끝에) ~을 이해하다, 알아내다\n(양, 비용을) 계산/산출 하다

If you fill a container or area, or if it fills, an amount of something enters it that is enough to make it full.
If something fills a space, it is so big, or there are such large quantities of it, that there is very little room left.
If you fill a crack or hole, you put a substance into it in order to make the surface smooth again.
If a sound, smell, or light fills a space, or the air, it is very strong or noticeable.
If something fills you with an emotion, or if an emotion fills you, you experience this emotion strongly.

if a container or a place fills up or somebody fills it up, it becomes completely full\nto fill your vehicle with petrol/gas, etc.\n

voca.means_en:
A film consists of moving pictures that have been recorded so that they can be shown at the cinema or on television. A film tells a story, or shows a real situation.
Film of something is moving pictures of a real event that are shown on television or on a screen.
A film is the narrow roll of plastic that is used in a camera to take photographs.
The making of cinema films, considered as a form of art or a business, can be referred to as film or films.
A film of powder, liquid, or oil is a very thin layer of it.
If you film something, you use a camera to take moving pictures which can be shown on a screen or on television.

voca.means_ko: [픨띄]\n아주 더러운, 불결한, 상스러운, 추잡한\n더럽게, 매우, 상당히
voca.means_en:
dirty / dusty / filthy / soiled / grubby
Something that is filthy is very dirty indeed.
If you describe something as filthy, you mean that you think it is morally very unpleasant and disgusting, sometimes in a sexual way.

A fish's fins are the flat objects which stick out of its body and help it to swim and keep its balance.\nA fin on something such as an aeroplane, rocket, or bomb is a flat part which sticks out and which is intended to help control its movement.\n

In a series of events, things, or people, the final one is the last one.
Final means happening at the end of an event or series of events.
If a decision or someone's authority is final, it cannot be changed or questioned.
The final is the last game or contest in a series and decides who is the winner.

You use finally to suggest that something happens after a long period of time, usually later than you wanted or expected it to happen.
You use finally to indicate that something is last in a series of actions or events.
You use finally in speech or writing to introduce a final point, question, or topic.

voca.means_en:
When someone finances something such as a project or a purchase, they provide the money that is needed to pay for them.
Finance is the commercial or government activity of managing money, debt, credit, and investment.
You can refer to the amount of money that you have and how well it is organized as your finances.
economic / financial / commercial / monetary / budgetary\nFinancial means relating to or involving money.\n

voca.means_en:
If you find someone or something, you see them or learn where they are.
If you find something that you need or want, you succeed in achieving or obtaining it.
If something is found in a particular place or thing, it exists in that place.
If you find someone or something in a particular situation, they are in that situation when you see them or come into contact with them.

voca.means_en: to learn a fact, a piece of information, or the truth about something/somebody\n"But we'll soon find out!" she started waving.\n
to discover that somebody has been dishonest or has done something wrong\n

well / all right / OK / fine / healthy / strong / fit
You use fine to describe something that you admire and think is very good.
If you say that something is fine, you mean that it is satisfactory or acceptable.
A fine is a punishment in which a person is ordered to pay a sum of money because they have done something illegal or broken a rule.
If someone is fined, they are punished by being ordered to pay a sum of money because they have done something illegal or broken a rule.

Your fingers are the four long thin parts at the end of each hand.
A finger of something such as smoke or land is an amount of it that is shaped rather like a finger.
If you finger something, you touch or feel it with your fingers.

When you finish doing or dealing with something, you do or deal with the last part of it, so that there is no more for you to do or deal with.
When you finish something that you are making or producing, you reach the end of making or producing it, so that it is complete.
When something such as a course, film, or sale finishes, especially at a planned time, it ends.
You say that someone or something finishes a period of time or an event in a particular way to indicate what the final situation was like. You can also say that a period of time or an event finishes in a particular way.
The finish of something is the end of it or the last part of it.

Fire is the hot, bright flames produced by things that are burning.
Fire or a fire is an occurrence of uncontrolled burning which destroys buildings, forests, or other things.
A fire is a burning pile of wood, coal, or other fuel that you make, for example to use for heat, light, or cooking.
If someone fires a gun or a bullet, or if they fire, a bullet is sent from a gun that they are using.
If you fire an arrow, you send it from a bow.
used to tell somebody to begin asking questions or to begin to speak\n

voca.means_ko: ~을 발사하다, \n(흔히 화가나서 말, 글을) 급히 하다/쓰다

to shoot a bullet from a gun
to ask a lot of questions, etc. quickly, one after the other
to write a letter, report, etc. quickly, often because you are angry
if you fire off an email, you send it
A firefly is a type of beetle that produces light from its body.\n
Firelight is the light that comes from a fire.\n
Firewood is wood that has been cut into pieces so that it can be burned on a fire.\n

If something is firm, it does not change much in shape when it is pressed but is not completely hard.
If something is firm, it does not shake or move when you put weight or pressure on it, because it is strongly made or securely fastened.
If someone's grip is firm or if they perform a physical action in a firm way, they do it with quite a lot of force or pressure but also in a controlled way.
strong discipline and control\n

If you fix something for someone, you arrange for it to happen or you organize it for them.
If you fix something which is damaged or which does not work properly, you repair it.
If you fix a problem or a bad situation, you deal with it and make it satisfactory.
If you fix your eyes on someone or something or if your eyes fix on them, you look at them with complete attention.
If someone or something is fixed in your mind, you remember them well, for example because they are very important, interesting, or unusual.
If someone fixes a gun, camera, or radar on something, they point it at that thing.

Journalists sometimes refer to the flag of a particular country or organization as a way of referring to the country or organization itself and its values or power.
If you flag or if your spirits flag, you begin to lose enthusiasm or energy.

A flame is an e-mail message which severely criticizes or attacks someone.
If something bursts into flames or bursts into flame, it suddenly starts burning strongly.
If someone or something fans the flames of a situation or feeling, usually a bad one, they make it more intense or extreme in some way.
If something goes up in flames, it starts to burn strongly and is destroyed.

If a bird or insect flaps its wings or if its wings flap, the wings move quickly up and down.
If you flap your arms, you move them quickly up and down as if they were the wings of a bird.
A flap of cloth or skin, for example, is a flat piece of it that can move freely up and down or from side to side because it is held or attached by only one edge.
Ropes flapped and snapped in the wild wind.

A low flat area of uncultivated land, especially an area where the ground is soft and wet, can be referred to as flats or a flat.
You can refer to one of the broad flat surfaces of an object as the flat of that object.
Something that is flat is level, smooth, or even, rather than sloping, curved, or uneven.

as fast as possible; with all the energy, strength, etc. you have

voca.means_en: A flea is a very small jumping insect that has no wings and feeds on the blood of humans or animals.\n

Flesh is the soft part of a person's or animal's body between the bones and the skin.
You can use flesh to refer to human skin and the human body, especially when you are considering it in a sexual way.
The flesh of a fruit or vegetable is the soft inside part of it.
You use flesh and blood to emphasize that someone has human feelings or weaknesses, often when contrasting them with machines.
If you say that someone is your own flesh and blood, you are emphasizing that they are a member of your family.
If something makes your flesh creep or makes your flesh crawl, it makes you feel disgusted, shocked or frightened.
to add more details or information to an argument, an idea, a drawing, etc.\n

voca.means_en: A flex is an electric cable containing two or more wires that is connected to an electrical appliance.\nIf you flex your muscles or parts of your body, you bend, move, or stretch them for a short time in order to exercise them.\n
A flexible object or material can be bent easily without breaking.\nSomething or someone that is flexible is able to change easily and adapt to different conditions and circumstances as they occur.\n

If something flicks in a particular direction, or if someone flicks it, it moves with a short, sudden movement.
If you flick something away, or off something else, you remove it with a quick movement of your hand or finger.
If you flick something such as a whip or a towel, or flick something with it, you hold one end of it and move your hand quickly up and then forward, so that the other end moves.
If you flick a switch, or flick an electrical appliance on or off, you press the switch sharply so that it moves into a different position and works the equipment.
If you flick through a book or magazine, you turn its pages quickly, for example to get a general idea of its contents or to look for a particular item. If you flick through television channels, you continually change channels very quickly, for example using a remote control.
flick the dust off one's hat\n

If a light or flame flickers, it shines unsteadily.
If you experience a flicker of emotion, you feel that emotion only for a very short time, and not very strongly.
In the flickering light, Jack saw a dark figure sitting on a woven mat.

voca.means_en:
If you flip a device on or off, or if you flip a switch, you turn it on or off by pressing the switch quickly.
If you flip through the pages of a book, for example, you quickly turn over the pages in order to find a particular one or to get an idea of the contents.
If something flips over, or if you flip it over or into a different position, it moves or is moved into a different position.
If you flip something, especially a coin, you use your thumb to make it turn over and over, as it goes through the air.
If you say that someone is being flip, you disapprove of them because you think that what they are saying shows they are not being serious enough about something.

If something or someone is floating in a liquid, they are in the liquid, on or just below the surface, and are being supported by it. You can also float something on a liquid.
Something that floats lies on or just below the surface of a liquid when it is put in it and does not sink.
Something that floats in or through the air hangs in it or moves slowly and gently through it.
If you float a project, plan, or idea, you suggest it for others to think about.
If a company director floats their company, they start to sell shares in it to the public.
If a government floats its country's currency or allows it to float, it allows the currency's value to change freely in relation to other currencies.

If there is a flood, a large amount of water covers an area which is usually dry, for example when a river flows over its banks or a pipe bursts.

If something such as a river or a burst pipe floods an area that is usually dry or if the area floods, it becomes covered with water.
If a river floods, it overflows, especially after very heavy rain.
If you say that people or things flood into a place, you are emphasizing that they arrive there in large numbers.
If you flood a place with a particular type of thing, or if a particular type of thing floods a place, the place becomes full of so many of them that it cannot hold or deal with any more.
If an emotion, feeling, or thought floods you, you suddenly feel it very intensely. If feelings or memories flood back, you suddenly remember them very clearly.
if water, etc. floods in or floods into a place, it moves to fill or cover it\nto come to or arrive at a place in large numbers or great quantities\n
to force somebody to leave their home because of a flood\n
You can use floss to refer to fine soft threads of some kind.\nWhen you floss, you use a special kind of strong string to clean between your teeth and gums.\n

A flower is the part of a plant which is often brightly coloured, grows at the end of a stem, and only survives for a short time.
A flower is a stem of a plant that has one or more flowers on it and has been picked, usually with others, for example to give as a present or to put in a vase.
Flowers are small plants that are grown for their flowers as opposed to trees, shrubs, and vegetables.
When a plant or tree flowers, its flowers appear and open.
When something flowers, for example a political movement or a relationship, it gets stronger and more successful.

When something such as a bird, insect, or aircraft flies, it moves through the air.
If you fly somewhere, you travel there in an aircraft.
When someone flies an aircraft, they control its movement in the air.

If you focus on a particular topic or if your attention is focused on it, you concentrate on it and think about it, discuss it, or deal with it, rather than dealing with other topics.
If you focus your eyes or if your eyes focus, your eyes adjust so that you can clearly see the thing that you want to look at. If you focus a camera, telescope, or other instrument, you adjust it so that you can see clearly through it.
If you focus rays of light on a particular point, you pass them through a lens or reflect them from a mirror so that they meet at that point.
The focus of something is the main topic or main thing that it is concerned with.
Your focus on something is the special attention that you pay it.
You use focus to refer to the fact of adjusting your eyes or a camera, telescope, or other instrument, and to the degree to which you can see clearly.
This chapter focuses on creating, modifying, and working with files in general.\n

When there is fog, there are tiny drops of water in the air which form a thick cloud and make it difficult to see things.
A fog is an unpleasant cloud of something such as smoke inside a building or room.
You can use fog to refer to a situation which stops people from being able to notice things, understand things, or think clearly.

When it is foggy, there is fog.\nIf you say that you haven't the foggiest or you haven't the foggiest idea, you are emphasizing that you do not know something.\n

Foil consists of sheets of metal as thin as paper. It is used to wrap food in.
If you refer to one thing or person as a foil for another, you approve of the fact that they contrast with each other and go well together, often in a way that makes the second thing or person seem better or less harmful.
If you foil someone's plan or attempt to do something, for example to commit a crime, you succeed in stopping them from doing what they want.

Foul language is offensive and contains swear words or rude words.
If someone has a foul temper or is in a foul mood, they become angry or violent very suddenly and easily.
Foul weather is unpleasant, windy, and stormy.
If an animal fouls a place, it drops faeces onto the ground.
In a game or sport, if a player fouls another player, they touch them or block them in a way which is not allowed according to the rules.
A foul is an act in a game or sport that is not allowed according to the rules.
to do something badly; to spoil something, especially by making mistakes\n

voca.means_ko: (기관, 조직을) 설립하다, (도시, 국가를) 세우다,\n~의 기초를 쌓다
voca.means_en: When an institution, company, or organization is founded by someone or by a group of people, they get it started, often by providing the necessary money.\nWhen a town, important building, or other place is founded by someone or by a group of people, they cause it to be built.\n
I found out about your podcast last year. \n

voca.means_ko: 분수, 식수대, 수원\n분수처럼 뿜어져 나오는 것
voca.means_en: A fountain is an ornamental feature in a pool or lake which consists of a long narrow stream of water that is forced up into the air by a pump.\nA fountain of a liquid is an amount of it which is sent up into the air and falls back.\n
A fraction of something is a tiny amount or proportion of it.\nA fraction is a number that can be expressed as a proportion of two whole numbers. For example, 1/2 and 1/3 are both fractions.\n
If something is fractional, it is very small in size or degree.\n
If you describe a situation as fragile, you mean that it is weak or uncertain, and unlikely to be able to resist strong pressure or attack.\nSomething that is fragile is easily broken or damaged.\n
A fragment of something is a small piece or part of it.\nIf something fragments or is fragmented, it breaks or separates into small pieces or parts.\n
Prevents network fragmentation\n
A fragrance is a pleasant or sweet smell.\nFragrance is a pleasant-smelling liquid which people put on their bodies to make themselves smell nice.\n
Something that is fragrant has a pleasant, sweet smell.\n

voca.means_ko:

voca.means_en:
The frame of a picture or mirror is the wood, metal, or plastic that is fitted around it, especially when it is displayed or hung on a wall.
The frame of an object such as a building, chair, or window is the arrangement of wooden, metal, or plastic bars between which other material is fitted, and which give the object its strength and shape.
When a picture or photograph is framed, it is put in a frame.
If an object is framed by a particular thing, it is surrounded by that thing in a way that makes the object more striking or attractive to look at.

If you are frantic, you are behaving in a wild and uncontrolled way because you are frightened or worried.
If an activity is frantic, things are done quickly and in an energetic but disorganized way, because there is very little time.
But the frantic swimmers kept coming.

Fraud is the crime of gaining money or financial benefits by a trick or by lying.
A fraud is something or someone that deceives people in a way that is illegal or dishonest.
If you call someone or something a fraud, you are criticizing them because you think that they are not genuine, or are less good than they claim or appear to be.

voca.means_ko: (천이) 해어지다/해어지게 하다\n신경이 날카로워 지다/날카로워 지게 만들다\n(특히 자신의 능력을 시험하는 듯한) 싸움/경쟁
voca.means_en:
If something such as cloth or rope frays, or if something frays it, its threads or fibres start to come apart from each other and spoil its appearance.
If your nerves or your temper fray, or if something frays them, you become nervous or easily annoyed because of mental strain and anxiety.
The fray is an exciting or challenging activity, situation, or argument that you are involved in.

voca.means_ko:
(~에) 광적으로 관심이 많은, 
별난, 괴짜, 열광자, 이상한 현상

기겁을 하다/하게 만들다
voca.means_en:
A freak event or action is one that is a very unusual or extreme example of its type.
If you describe someone as a particular kind of freak, you are emphasizing that they are very enthusiastic about a thing or activity, and often seem to think about nothing else.
People are sometimes referred to as freaks when their behaviour or attitude is very different from that of the majority of people.
If you refer to someone as a freak, you mean that they are physically abnormal in some way. This use could cause offence.
Freckles are small light brown spots on someone's skin, especially on their face.\n

voca.means_ko: 자유로운, 자기 하고싶은데로 하는, \n무료의, ~이 없는\n자유롭게, 무료로
voca.means_en:
If something is free, you can have it or use it without paying for it.
Someone or something that is free is not restricted, controlled, or limited, for example by rules, customs, or other people.
Someone who is free is no longer a prisoner or a slave.
If someone or something is free of or free from an unpleasant thing, they do not have it or they are not affected by it.
If you free someone of something that is unpleasant or restricting, you remove it from them.
To free a prisoner or a slave means to let them go or release them from prison.
unrestricted freedom to act (esp in the phrase give (someone) a free hand)\n(done) by hand without the use of guiding instruments\n

If you refer to someone as a freeloader, you disapprove of them because they take advantage of other people's kindness, for example by accepting food or accommodation from them, without giving anything in return.\n

Freedom is the state of being allowed to do what you want to do. Freedoms are instances of this.
When prisoners or slaves are set free or escape, they gain their freedom.
Freedom from something you do not want means not being affected by it.
The freedom of a particular city is a special honour which is given to a famous person who is connected with that city, or to someone who has performed some special service for the city.
A freehand drawing is drawn without using instruments such as a ruler or a pair of compasses.\n

voca.means_ko: 음식등을 공짜로 얻어먹다,\n남의 소유물, 설비 등을 공짜로 쓰다,\n식객이 되다
voca.means_en: to act as a freeloader; sponge\n

voca.means_en: The frequency of an event is the number of times it happens during a particular period.\nIn physics, the frequency of a sound wave or a radio wave is the number of times it vibrates within a specified period of time.\n

voca.means_ko: 잦은, 빈번한\n(특정 장소에) 자주가다, ~과 교제하다\n자주 일어나는, 흔한, 보통의
voca.means_en: If something is frequent, it happens often.\nIf someone frequents a particular place, they regularly go there.\n

voca.means_ko: 초조해 하다, 애타다, 애타다\n조바심 치다, 조마조마하다
voca.means_en: If you fret about something, you worry about it.\nThe frets on a musical instrument such as a guitar are the raised lines across its neck.\n
Friday is the day after Thursday and before Saturday.\n
A fridge is a large metal container which is kept cool, usually by electricity, so that food that is put in it stays fresh.\n

A friend is someone who you know well and like, but who is not related to you.
If you are friends with someone, you are their friend and they are yours.
If one country refers to another as a friend, they mean that the other country is not an enemy of theirs.
The friends of a country, cause, organization, or a famous politician are the people and organizations who help and support them.

voca.means_ko: 우호적인 사람, 자기편\n친한, 우호적인, 사용하기 쉬운

voca.means_en:
frighten / scare / alarm / intimidate / startle
If something or someone frightens you, they cause you to suddenly feel afraid, anxious, or nervous.
If something frightens the life out of you, frightens the wits out of you, or frightens you out of your wits, it
afraid / frightened / scared / alarmed / paranoid / apprehensive\nIf you are frightened, you are anxious or afraid, often because of something that has just happened or that you think may happen.\n

voca.means_ko:

술장식을 달다, 가장자리 장식이 되다
가장자리, 주변, 경계, 술장식, 앞머리
(중요성이) 2차 적인
voca.means_en:
A fringe is hair which is cut so that it hangs over your forehead.
A fringe is a decoration attached to clothes, or other objects such as curtains, consisting of a row of hanging strips or threads.
To be on the fringe or the fringes of a place means to be on the outside edge of it, or to be in one of the parts that are farthest from its centre.
The fringe or the fringes of an activity or organization are its less important, least typical, or most extreme parts, rather than its main and central part.
Fringe groups or events are less important or popular than other related groups or events.
Annie wore a fringed buckskin dress.

A frog is a small creature with smooth skin, big eyes, and long back legs which it uses for jumping. Frogs usually live near water.\nFrogs is sometimes used to refer to French people. This use could cause offence.\n

If something comes from a particular person or thing, or if you get something from them, they give it to you or they are the source of it.
Someone who comes from a particular place lives in that place or originally lived there. Something that comes from a particular place was made in that place.
A person from a particular organization works for that organization.
If someone or something moves or is moved from a place, they leave it or are removed, so that they are no longer there.

voca.means_ko: (미래에 대한 생각이나 계획은 없이) 하루하루, 그날그날\n(상황이) 하루하루, 나날이 (변하다)
voca.means_en: with no thoughts or plans for the future\nif a situation changes from day to day, it changes often\n
used to describe a very unpleasant person or thing; the worst that you can imagine\n
moving to the left and then to the right\n
occasionally; sometimes\n
from the head to the feet; completely\n

voca.means_en:
The front of something is the part of it that faces you, or that faces forward, or that you normally see or use.
The front of a building is the side or part of it that faces the street.
A person's or animal's front is the part of their body between their head and their legs that is on the opposite side to their back.
In a war, the front is a line where two opposing armies are facing each other.
If you say that something is happening on a particular front, you mean that it is happening with regard to a particular situation or field of activity.
Front is used to refer to the side or part of something that is towards the front or nearest to the front.
A building or an area of land that fronts a particular place or fronts onto it is next to it and faces it.
in or into the most important position\n

border / boundary / line / frontier
A frontier is a border between two countries.
When you are talking about the western part of America before the twentieth century, you use frontier to refer to the area beyond the part settled by Europeans.
The frontiers of something, especially knowledge, are the limits to which it extends.
Frostbite is a condition in which parts of your body, such as your fingers or toes, become seriously damaged as a result of being very cold.\n

voca.means_en:
When someone frowns, their eyebrows become drawn together, because they are annoyed, worried, or puzzled, or because they are concentrating.
"I know that" said Annie, frowning.
Morgan frowned.
to disapprove of somebody/something

If something frustrates you, it upsets or angers you because you are unable to do anything about the problems it creates.\nIf someone or something frustrates a plan or attempt to do something, they prevent it from succeeding.\n

If something is full, it contains as much of a substance or as many objects as it can.
If a place or thing is full of things or people, it contains a large number of them.
If someone or something is full of a particular feeling or quality, they have a lot of it.
You say that a place or vehicle is full when there is no space left in it for any more people or things.

voca.means_en: If you fumble for something or fumble with something, you try and reach for it or hold it in a clumsy way.\nWhen you are trying to say something, if you fumble for the right words, you speak in a clumsy and unclear way.\n

voca.means_en: Fumes are the unpleasant and often unhealthy smoke and gases that are produced by fires or by things such as chemicals, fuel, or cooking.\nIf you fume over something, you express annoyance and anger about it.\n

entertainment / fun / recreation / relaxation / play / pleasure / amusement
You refer to an activity or situation as fun if you think it is pleasant and enjoyable and it causes you to feel happy.
If you say that someone is fun, you mean that you enjoy being with them because they say and do interesting or amusing things.
If you describe something as a fun thing, you mean that you think it is enjoyable. If you describe someone as a fun person, you mean that you enjoy being with them.

Functional things are useful rather than decorative.
Functional means relating to the way in which something works or operates, or relating to how useful it is.
Functional equipment works or operates in the way that it is supposed to.
The functionality of a computer or other machine is how useful it is or how many functions it can perform.\n

voca.means_ko: 기본적인, 근본적인, 궁극적인, 중요한, 핵심적인\n기본적인 법칙, 핵심
voca.means_en:
You use fundamental to describe things, activities, and principles that are very important or essential. They affect the basic nature of other things or are the most important element upon which other things depend.
You use fundamental to describe something which exists at a deep and basic level, and is therefore likely to continue.
If one thing is fundamental to another, it is absolutely necessary to it, and the second thing cannot exist, succeed, or be imagined without it.
You can use fundamental to show that you are referring to what you consider to be the most important aspect of a situation, and that you are not concerned with less important details.

Funeral arrangements have not been finalized.
People wore deep mourning at Tom's funeral.
Offer an even number of flowers if you go to a funeral.

Fur is the thick and usually soft hair that grows on the bodies of many mammals.
Fur is the fur-covered skin of an animal that is used to make clothing or small carpets.
A fur is a coat made from real or artificial fur, or a piece of fur worn round your neck.
Fur is an artificial fabric that looks like fur and is used, for example, to make clothing, soft toys, and seat covers.
He ware a long fur robe.
Someone who is furious is extremely angry.\nFurious is also used to describe something that is done with great energy, effort, speed, or violence.\n
A furnace is a container or enclosed space in which a very hot fire is made, for example to melt metal, burn rubbish, or produce steam.\n
Furniture consists of large objects such as tables, chairs, or beds that are used in a room for sitting or lying on or for putting things on or in.\n

voca.means_en:
A furry animal is covered with thick, soft hair.
If you describe something as furry, you mean that it has a soft rough texture like fur.
"From that pile of furry skins" said Annie, pointing.

Further means a greater distance than before or than something else.
Further is used in expressions such as `further back' and `further ahead' to refer to a point in time that is earlier or later than the time you are talking about.
Fury is violent or very strong anger.\nIn a burst of fury, she let go of the branch.\n

If you fuss over someone, you pay them a lot of attention and do things to make them happy or comfortable.
to pay a lot of attention, or too much attention, to somebody/something\n
A gaffe is a stupid or careless mistake, for example when you say or do something that offends or upsets people.\n

move forward in a battle\nbecome more popular or successful\n
to get more of a particular quality\n

voca.means_en: A gale is a very strong wind.\nYou'll see a gale if I don't get me gold today, by thunder.\n
Your gall bladder is the organ in your body which contains bile and is next to your liver.\n

If you gallop, you ride a horse that is galloping.
If something such as a process gallops, it develops very quickly and is often difficult to control.
A gallop is a ride on a horse that is galloping.

voca.means_en:
A game is an activity or sport usually involving skill, knowledge, or chance, in which you follow fixed rules and try to win against an opponent or to solve a puzzle.
A game is one particular occasion on which a game is played.
A game is a part of a match, for example in tennis or bridge, consisting of a fixed number of points.

voca.means_ko: 아직 끝나지 않은/누가 이길지 모르는 경기

voca.means_en:
A gap is a space between two things or a hole in the middle of something solid.
A gap is a period of time when you are not busy or when you stop doing something that you normally do.
If there is something missing from a situation that prevents it being complete or satisfactory, you can say that there is a gap.
A gap between two groups of people, things, or sets of ideas is a big difference between them.

rubbish / garbage / trash / refuse
Garbage is rubbish, especially waste from a kitchen.
If someone says that an idea or opinion is garbage, they are emphasizing that they believe it is untrue or unimportant.

In British English, a garden is a piece of land next to a house, with flowers, vegetables, other plants, and often grass. In American English, the usual word is yard, and a garden refers only to land which is used for growing flowers and vegetables.
Gardens are places like a park that have areas of plants, trees, and grass, and that people can visit and walk around.
Gardens is sometimes used as part of the name of a street.
If you garden, you do work in your garden such as weeding or planting.
A gash is a long, deep cut in your skin or in the surface of something.\nIf you gash something, you accidentally make a long and deep cut in it.\n

collect / gather / accumulate / run sth up / amass
If people gather somewhere or if someone gathers people somewhere, they come together in a group.
If you gather things, you collect them together so that you can use them.
If you gather information or evidence, you collect it, especially over a period of time and after a lot of hard work.
If something gathers speed, momentum, or force, it gradually becomes faster or more powerful.
When you gather something such as your strength, courage, or thoughts, you make an effort to prepare yourself to do something.
to collect a quantity of things, especially crops, and put them all together in one place\n
A gathering is a group of people meeting together for a particular purpose.\nIf there is gathering darkness, the light is gradually decreasing, usually because it is nearly night.\n

voca.means_en:
If you gauge the speed or strength of something, or if you gauge an amount, you measure or calculate it, often by using a device of some kind.
If you gauge people's actions, feelings, or intentions in a particular situation, you carefully consider and judge them.
A gauge is a device that measures the amount or quantity of something and shows the amount measured.
A gauge of someone's feelings or a situation is a fact or event that can be used to judge them.
A gauge is the distance between the two rails on a railway line.
Gauze is a type of light, soft cloth with tiny holes in it.\n

look / glance / gaze / stare / glimpse / glare
If you gaze at someone or something, you look steadily at them for a long time, for example because you find them attractive or interesting, or because you are thinking about something else.
You can talk about someone's gaze as a way of describing how they are looking at something, especially when they are looking steadily at it.
Jack followed her gaze.
Annie was gazing down the street at the Frog Creek woods.
to look steadily at somebody/something for a long time, either because you are very interested or surprised, or because you are thinking of something else\n

voca.means_en:
The gears on a machine or vehicle are a device for changing the rate at which energy is changed into motion.
If someone or something is geared to or towards a particular purpose, they are organized or designed in order to achieve that purpose.
Annie ran to get their rain gear.
I pulled out some of my dad's old fishing gear.
\n

voca.means_ko: 보석, 주옥, 일품, 매우 유용한 사람, 뛰어난 인물\n보석으로 장식하다,  ~에 보석을 박다\n뛰어난, 질이 좋은
voca.means_en: A gem is a jewel or stone that is used in jewellery.\nIf you describe something or someone as a gem, you mean that they are especially pleasing, good, or helpful.\n

A person's gender is the fact that they are male or female.
You can refer to all male people or all female people as a particular gender.
In grammar, the gender of a noun, pronoun, or adjective is whether it is masculine, feminine, or neuter. A word's gender can affect its form and behaviour. In English, only personal pronouns such as 'she', reflexive pronouns such as 'itself', and possessive determiners such as 'his' have gender.
A gene is the part of a cell in a living thing which controls its physical characteristics, growth, and development.\n

voca.means_ko: (거의 모든 사람, 사물 등에 해당하는) 일반/보편적인\n일반적인, 대체적인, 대략적인\n장군
voca.means_en:
A general is a high-ranking officer in the armed forces, usually in the army.
If you talk about the general situation somewhere or talk about something in general terms, you are describing the situation as a whole rather than considering its details or exceptions.
You use general to describe several items or activities when there are too many of them or when they are not important enough to mention separately.
You use general to describe something that involves or affects most people, or most people in a particular group.

You use generally to give a summary of a situation, activity, or idea without referring to the particular details of it.\nYou use generally to say that something happens or is used on most occasions but not on every occasion.\n
A genre is a particular type of literature, painting, music, film, or other art form which people consider as a class because it has special characteristics.\n

A germ is a very small organism that causes disease.\nThe germ of something such as an idea is something which developed or might develop into that thing.\n

become / get / go / turn

voca.means_en:
A ghost is the spirit of a dead person that someone believes they can see or feel.
The ghost of something, especially of something bad that has happened, is the memory of it.
If there is a ghost of something, that thing is so faint or weak that it hardly exists.
If a book or other piece of writing is ghosted, it is written by a writer for another person, for example a politician or sportsman, who then publishes it as his or her own work.

Something that is described as giant is much larger or more important than most others of its kind.
Giant is often used to refer to any large, successful business organization or country.
A giant is an imaginary person who is very big and strong, especially one mentioned in old stories.
You can refer to someone, especially a man, as a giant, if they seem important or powerful or if they are big and strong.
You can refer to someone such as a famous musician or writer as a giant, if they are regarded as one of the most important or successful people in their field.
A gift is something that you give someone as a present.\nIf someone has a gift for doing something, they have a natural ability for doing it.\n
If you describe something as gigantic, you are emphasizing that it is extremely large in size, amount, or degree.\n

If someone giggles, they laugh in a childlike way, because they are amused, nervous, or embarrassed.
If you say that someone has the giggles, you mean they cannot stop giggling.
If you say that something is a giggle, you mean it is fun or is amusing.

The gist of a speech, conversation, or piece of writing is its general meaning.\n

You can use give with nouns that refer to physical actions. The whole expression refers to the performing of the action. For example, She gave a smile means almost the same as 'She smiled'.
You use give to say that a person does something for another person. For example, if you give someone a lift, you take them somewhere in your car.

if a ball, etc. glances off something, it touches it lightly and moves away from it in a different direction\n

look / glance / gaze / stare / glimpse / glare

to look at somebody/something in an angry way\n

Glass is a hard transparent substance that is used to make things such as windows and bottles.
A glass is a container made from glass, which you can drink from and which does not have a handle.
Glass is used to mean objects made of glass, for example drinking containers and bowls.
Glasses are two lenses in a frame that some people wear in front of their eyes in order to help them see better.
If you describe something as glassy, you mean that it is very smooth and shiny, like glass.\n

The name God is given to the spirit or being who is worshipped as the creator and ruler of the world, especially by Jews, Christians, and Muslims.

If you describe something as golden, you mean it is wonderful because it is likely to be successful and rewarding, or because it is the best of its kind.
If you refer to a man as a golden boy or a woman as a golden girl, you mean that they are especially popular and successful.

A gong is a large, flat, circular piece of metal that you hit with a hammer to make a sound like a loud bell. Gongs are sometimes used as musical instruments, or to give a signal that it is time to do something.\n

voca.means_ko:
[구웃]
(질적으로) 좋은/잘된/괜찮은

상당한, 꽤 많은, 족히 ~은 되는
voca.means_en:
good / goodness
Good means pleasant or enjoyable.
Good means of a high quality, standard, or level.
If you are good at something, you are skilful and successful at doing it.
If you describe a piece of news, an action, or an effect as good, you mean that it is likely to result in benefit or success.
A good idea, reason, method, or decision is a sensible or valid one.

good / goodness
People sometimes say `goodness' or `my goodness' to express surprise.
Goodness is the quality of being kind, helpful, and honest.

product / goods / commodity / merchandise / produce / wares
Goods are things that are made to be sold.
Your goods are the things that you own and that can be moved.

voca.means_ko:
[구디]
먹기좋은 것, 맛있는 것, 맛있는 과자, 캔디, 
매력적인/갖고싶은 것, 
~댁, ~엄마
voca.means_en: You can refer to pleasant, exciting, or attractive things as goodies.\nYou can refer to the heroes or the morally good characters in a film or story as the goodies. You can also refer to the goodies in a situation in real life.\n
If you describe a food or other substance as gooey, you mean that it is very soft and sticky.\nIn the hollow of each was gooey white stuff and a pile of moss.\n

voca.means_ko: [구-f]\n바보, 천치, 멍텅구리, 실수, 바보같은 실수, \n큰 실수를 저지르다
voca.means_en: If you goof or goof up, you make a silly mistake.\nIf you call someone a goof, you think they are silly.\n
to waste your time doing silly or stupid things\n

voca.means_ko: 게으름뱅이, 휴식(기간), 책임 회피자\n시간을 낭비하다, 농땡이 부리다
voca.means_en: to waste time when you are supposed to be working\n"No goofing off" he said.\n
If you describe someone or something as goofy, you think they are rather silly or ridiculous.\n
A goose is a large bird that has a long neck and webbed feet. Geese are often farmed for their meat.\nGoose is the meat from a goose that has been cooked.\n

A gopher is a small animal which looks a bit like a rat and lives in holes in the ground. Gophers are found in Canada and the USA.\nIn computing, Gopher is a program that collects information for you from many databases across the Internet.\n

voca.means_ko: [고r-져s]\n아주 멋진, 아름다운/좋은, \n호화로운, 화려한, 우아한, 멋진, 예쁜
voca.means_en:
beautiful / pretty / handsome / attractive / lovely / good-looking / gorgeous
If you say that something is gorgeous, you mean that it gives you a lot of pleasure or is very attractive.
If you describe someone as gorgeous, you mean that you find them very sexually attractive.
If you describe things such as clothes and colours as gorgeous, you mean they are bright, rich, and impressive.
A gorilla is a very large ape. It has long arms, black fur, and a black face.\n

voca.means_ko: 잡담하다, 수다떨다, 험담을 퍼뜨리다\n소문, 험담, 잡담, 수다, 뒷말
voca.means_en:
discussion / conversation / dialogue / talk / consultation / chat / gossip
Gossip is informal conversation, often about other people's private affairs.
If you describe someone as a gossip, you mean that they enjoy talking informally to people about the private affairs of others.
If you gossip with someone, you talk informally, especially about other people or local events. You can also say that two people gossip.

To govern a place such as a country, or its people, means to be officially in charge of the place, and to have responsibility for making laws, managing the economy, and controlling public services.\nIf a situation or activity is governed by a particular factor, rule, or force, it is controlled by that factor, rule, or force.\n
The governance of a country is the way in which it is governed.\nThe governance of a company or organization is the way in which it is managed.\n

The government of a country is the group of people who are responsible for governing it.\nGovernment consists of the activities, methods, and principles involved in governing a country or other political unit.\n

voca.means_ko:
[갸운]
(특별한 경우에 입는 여성의) 드레스, 
(판사의) 법복, (졸업생 들의) 학위복
가운, 의상, 야회복
voca.means_en: A gown is a dress, usually a long dress, which women wear on formal occasions.\nA gown is a loose black garment worn on formal occasions by people such as lawyers and academics.\n

voca.means_ko:
[g뤱]
(와락, 단단히) 붙잡다, 움켜쥐다, 거머쥐다
~을 잡으려고 하다, 차지하다
붙잡음, 잡아챔, 약탈, 횡령
voca.means_en:
If you grab something, you take it or pick it up suddenly and roughly.
If you grab at something, you try to grab it.
If you grab someone who is walking past, you succeed in getting their attention.
If you grab someone's attention, you do something in order to make them notice you.
If you grab something such as food, drink, or sleep, you manage to get some quickly.
If you grab something such as a chance or opportunity, or grab at it, you take advantage of it eagerly.
A grab for something such as power or fame is an attempt to gain it.
He galloped toward them, grabbing his bow.

voca.means_ko: [g뤠이s]\n우아함, 아름다움, 예의, 은혜, 은총\n우아하게 하다, 장식하다
voca.means_en:
If someone moves with grace, they move in a smooth, controlled, and attractive way.
If someone behaves with grace, they behave in a pleasant, polite, and dignified way, even when they are upset or being treated unfairly.
The graces are the ways of behaving and doing things which are considered polite and well-mannered.
Grace is used in expressions such as a day's grace and a month's grace to say that you are allowed that amount of extra time before you have to finish something.
In Christianity and some other religions, grace is the kindness that God shows to people because he loves them.
When someone says grace before or after a meal, they say a prayer in which they thank God for the food and ask Him to bless it.

Someone or something that is graceful moves in a smooth and controlled way which is attractive to watch.
Something that is graceful is attractive because it has a pleasing shape or style.
If a person's behaviour is graceful, it is polite, kind, and pleasant, especially in a difficult situation.
They pranced gracefully across the snow.\n

If something is graded, its quality is judged, and it is often given a number or a name that indicates how good or bad it is.
The grade of a product is its quality, especially when this has been officially judged.
Your grade in an examination or piece of written work is the mark you get, usually in the form of a letter or number, that indicates your level of achievement.
Your grade in a company or organization is your level of importance or your rank.
In the United States, a grade is a group of classes in which all the children are of a similar age. When you are six years old you go into the first grade and you leave school after the twelfth grade.

voca.means_ko: 상위 품종으로 분류되다,\n~을 품종 개량하다, ~을 격상시키다

voca.means_en: A gradual change or process occurs in small stages over a long period of time, rather than suddenly.\n
If something changes or is done gradually, it changes or is done in small stages over a long period of time, rather than suddenly.\n

In Britain, a graduate is a person who has successfully completed a degree at a university or college and has received a certificate that shows this.
In the United States, a graduate is a student who has successfully completed a course at a high school, college, or university.
In Britain, when a student graduates from university, they have successfully completed a degree course.
In the United States, when a student graduates, they complete their studies successfully and leave their school or university. You can also say that a school or university graduates a student or students.

voca.means_ko:
[g뤠인]
곡물, 낟알, (특정한 물질의) 알갱이
아주 조금, 티끌
(목제, 천, 암석의) 결, (포면의) 촉감
voca.means_en:
A grain of wheat, rice, or other cereal crop is a seed from it.
Grain is a cereal crop, especially wheat or corn, that has been harvested and is used for food or in trade.
A grain of something such as sand or salt is a tiny hard piece of it.
A grain of a quality is a very small amount of it.
The grain of a piece of wood is the direction of its fibres. You can also refer to the pattern of lines on the surface of the wood as the grain.

Grammar is the ways that words can be put together in order to make sentences.
Someone's grammar is the way in which they obey or do not obey the rules of grammar when they write or speak.
A grammar is a book that describes the rules of a language.
A particular grammar is a particular theory that is intended to explain the rules of a language.
Grammatical is used to indicate that something relates to grammar.\nIf someone's language is grammatical, it is considered correct because it obeys the rules of grammar.\n

If you describe a building or a piece of scenery as grand, you mean that its size or appearance is very impressive.
Grand plans or actions are intended to achieve important results.
People who are grand think they are important or socially superior.
If you describe an activity or experience as grand, you mean that it is very pleasant and enjoyable.
You can describe someone or something as grand when you admire or approve of them very much.

voca.means_ko:
[g뤤t]
(공식적, 법적으로) 승인/허락하다, 인정하다
수여/부여하다, 허가하다, 승인하다
수여, 교부, 허가, 인가, 동의
voca.means_en:
admit / acknowledge / concede / confess / allow / grant
A grant is an amount of money that a government or other institution gives to an individual or to an organization for a particular purpose such as education or home improvements.
If someone in authority grants you something, or if something is granted to you, you are allowed to have it.
If you grant that something is true, you accept that it is true, even though your opinion about it does not change.
You use granted or granted that at the beginning of a clause to say that something is true, before you make a comment on it.\n
Granular substances are composed of a lot of granules, or feel or look as if they are composed of a lot of granules.\n
Grapes are small green or dark purple fruit which grow in bunches. Grapes can be eaten raw, used for making wine, or dried.\n
A grapefruit is a large, round, yellow fruit, similar to an orange, that has a sharp, slightly bitter taste.\n

voca.means_ko:
꽉 잡다, 움켜잡다, 
완전히 이해하다, 파악하다
꽉 붙잡기, (확실한) 통제, 이해, 파악, 
(무엇을 할 수 있는) 능력
voca.means_en:
hold / hold on / cling / clutch / grip / grasp / clasp / hang on
If you grasp something, you take it in your hand and hold it very firmly.
If you grasp something that is complicated or difficult to understand, you understand it.
A grasp is a very firm hold or grip.
If you say that something is in someone's grasp, you disapprove of the fact that they possess or control it. If something slips from your grasp, you lose it or lose control of it.

voca.means_ko: ~ 을 붙잡으려고 하다\n~ 을 단단히 붙잡다.
[g뢔s]\n풀, 잔디, 풀밭, 초지, 목장\n~을 풀로 덥다, 방목하다
voca.means_en:
Grass is a very common plant consisting of large numbers of thin, spiky, green leaves that cover the surface of the ground.
If you talk about the grass, you are referring to an area of ground that is covered with grass, for example in your garden.
Grass is the same as marijuana.
A grass is someone who tells the police or other authorities about criminal activities that they know about.
If you say that one person grasses on another, the first person tells the police or other authorities about something criminal or wrong which the second person has done.
to cover an area of ground with grass\n

voca.means_ko:
(강판으로) 갈다, 갈리다
짜증나게 하다, 신경을 건드리다
(두 물채가 부딪쳐) 삐걱거리는/긁히는 소시를 내다
(난로안의 연료를 받치는) 쇠살대
voca.means_en:
A grate is a framework of metal bars in a fireplace, which holds the coal or wood.
If you grate food such as cheese or carrots, you rub it over a metal tool called a grater so that the food is cut into very small pieces.
When something grates, it rubs against something else making a harsh, unpleasant sound.
If something such as someone's behaviour grates on you or grates, it makes you feel annoyed.
If you are grateful for something that someone has given you or done for you, you have warm, friendly feelings towards them and wish to thank them.\n
A grater is a kitchen tool which has a rough surface that you use for cutting food into very small pieces.\n

voca.means_ko:

voca.means_en:
A grave is a place where a dead person is buried.
You can refer to someone's death as their grave or to death as the grave.
A grave event or situation is very serious, important, and worrying.
A grave person is quiet and serious in their appearance or behaviour.

voca.means_ko:

(소,양) 생풀을 뜯어먹다, 방목하다,

voca.means_en:
When animals graze or are grazed, they eat the grass or other plants that are growing in a particular place. You can also say that a field is grazed by animals.
If you graze a part of your body, you injure your skin by scraping against something.
If something grazes another thing, it touches that thing lightly as it passes by.
A graze is a small wound caused by scraping against something.
The zebras were grazing in the grass.

Grease is a thick, oily substance which is put on the moving parts of cars and other machines in order to make them work smoothly.
Grease is an oily substance that is produced by your skin.
Grease is animal fat that is produced by cooking meat. You can use grease for cooking.
If you grease a part of a car, machine, or device, you put grease on it in order to make it work smoothly.
If you grease a dish, you put a small amount of fat or oil around the inside of it in order to prevent food sticking to it during cooking.

voca.means_ko: [g뤠잇]\n(크기, 양이 보통 이상보다)큰, 많은, 엄청난, 대단한\n위대한, 정말 좋은, 중요한
voca.means_en:
big / large / great
You use great to describe something that is very large. Great is more formal than big.
Great means large in amount or degree.
You use great to describe something that is important, famous, or exciting.
The greats in a particular subject or field of activity are the people who have been most successful or famous in it.
The greats of popular modern music are records that have been successful and that continue to be popular.
If you describe someone as greedy, you mean that they want to have more of something such as food or money than is necessary or fair.\nThe gold-greedy pirates seemed to have lost their minds.\n

Greek means belonging or relating to Greece.
A Greek is a person who comes from Greece.
Greek is the language used in Greece.
Greek or Ancient Greek was the language used in Greece in ancient times.
A greenhouse is a glass building in which you grow plants that need to be protected from bad weather.\nGreenhouse means relating to or causing the greenhouse effect.\n
Greenish means slightly green in colour.\n

When you greet someone, you say 'Hello' or shake hands with them.
If something is greeted in a particular way, people react to it in that way.
If you are greeted by something, it is the first thing you notice in a particular place.
A grenade or a hand grenade is a small bomb that can be thrown by hand.\n

voca.means_ko:
[g릔]
(소리없이) 활짝/크게 웃다, 
밝게 생긋 웃다, (고통, 노여움으로) 이를 들어내다
밝은 웃음, 방긋 웃음
voca.means_en:
When you grin, you smile broadly.
A grin is a broad smile.
If you grin and bear it, you accept a difficult or unpleasant situation without complaining because you know there is nothing you can do to make things better. / Cap'n Bones grinned his black-toothed grin.
Cap'n Bones gave Jack a horrible grin. / He seemed to be grinning at them. / The monkey just grinned.
Jack grinned, "Me too" he said.
accept something unpleasant without complaining\n

voca.means_en:
If you grind a substance such as corn, you crush it between two hard surfaces or with a machine until it becomes a fine powder.
If you grind something into a surface, you press and rub it hard into the surface using small circular or sideways movements.
If you grind something, you make it smooth or sharp by rubbing it against a hard surface.
If a vehicle grinds somewhere, it moves there very slowly and noisily.
The grind of a machine is the harsh, scraping noise that it makes, usually because it is old or is working too hard.
If you refer to routine tasks or activities as the grind, you mean they are boring and take up a lot of time and effort.
to continue for a long time in a boring or unpleasant way\n
to treat somebody in an unkind way or annoy them for a long time until they can no longer defend themselves or fight back\n

voca.means_ko: (흔히 좋지도 않은 것을 대량으로) 생산해 내다
voca.means_en: to produce something in large quantities over a long period of time, especially something that is not interesting or of good quality\nto press a burning cigarette down firmly with your hand or your foot in order to stop it burning\n
to break or crush something into very small pieces\n

통재, 지배, 이해, 파악,

(마음, 흥미, 시선을) 끌다, 사로잡다
voca.means_en:
hold / hold on / cling / clutch / grip / grasp / clasp / hang on
If you grip something, you take hold of it with your hand and continue to hold it firmly.
If you are gripped by something such as a story or a series of events, your attention is concentrated on it and held by it.
A grip is a firm, strong hold on something.
Someone's grip on something is the power and control they have over it.
If things such as shoes or car tyres have grip, they do not slip.
A grip is a bag that is smaller than a suitcase, and that you use when you are travelling.

voca.means_ko:
[g로운]
(고통, 짜증으로) 신음소리를 내다, 끙하는 소리를 내다,

(기뻐서) 탄성을 지르다. 
끙끙거리는 소리, 신음, 불만
voca.means_en:
If you groan, you make a long, low sound because you are in pain, or because you are upset or unhappy about something.
If you groan something, you say it in a low, unhappy voice.
If you groan about something, you complain about it.
If wood or something made of wood groans, it makes a loud sound when it moves.
If you say that something such as a table groans under the weight of food, you are emphasizing that there is a lot of food on it.
If you say that someone or something is groaning under the weight of something, you think there is too much of that thing.
Jack groaned.
A grocery or a grocery store is a grocer's shop.\nGroceries are foods you buy at a grocer's or at a supermarket such as flour, sugar, and tinned foods.\n

voca.means_ko:
[g룸]
(동물을) 손질/솔질 하다, (가죽, 털 등을) 다듬다
깔끔하게 하다, 반듯하게 손질하다
신랑, 마부, 말 사육 담당자
voca.means_en:
A groom is the same as a bridegroom.
A groom is someone whose job is to look after the horses in a stable and to keep them clean.
If you groom an animal, you clean its fur, usually by brushing it.
If you are groomed for a special job, someone prepares you for it by teaching you the skills you will need.
If you describe something as groovy, you mean that it is attractive, fashionable, or exciting.\n

voca.means_ko:
[g로우s]
총계의, 전부의, 천박한, 상스러운
역겨운, 아주 무례한
세금 포함해서
voca.means_en:
disgusting / revolting / foul / repulsive / offensive / gross / nauseating
You use gross to describe something unacceptable or unpleasant to a very great amount, degree, or intensity.
If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very rude or unacceptable.
If you describe something as gross, you think it is very unpleasant.
If you describe someone as gross, you mean that they are extremely fat and unattractive.
Gross means the total amount of something, especially money, before any has been taken away.
Gross means the total amount of something, after all the relevant amounts have been added together.
If a person or a business grosses a particular amount of money, they earn that amount of money before tax has been taken away.
to make somebody feel disgusted\n
A grouch is someone who is always complaining in a bad-tempered way.\nA grouch is a bad-tempered complaint.\n
If someone is grouchy, they are very bad-tempered and complain a lot.\n

voca.means_ko:
[g롸운d]
땅, 지면, 토양, 공터, 운동장
