voca.means_en: to clean the inside of something by rubbing it hard with a brush and usually with soap and water\n
to wash your hands and arms very thoroughly before performing a medical operation\n
Scrubby land is rough and dry and covered with scrub.\n
If someone takes you by the scruff of the neck, they take hold of the back of your neck or collar suddenly and roughly.\n
Someone or something that is scruffy is dirty and untidy.\n

voca.means_en: If you scrunch something, you squeeze it or bend it so that it is no longer in its natural shape and is often crushed.\nJack climbed inside one and tried to scrunch down.\n
A sculpture is a work of art that is produced by carving or shaping stone, wood, clay, or other materials.\nSculpture is the art of creating sculptures.\n
Peanut jumped out of Annie's arms and scurried back to the letter M.\n

any echinoderm of the class Holothuroidea, having an elongated body covered with a leathery skin and bearing a cluster of tentacles at the oral end. They usually creep on the sea bed or burrow in sand\n

any marine teleost fish of the temperate and tropical genus Hippocampus, having a bony-plated body, a prehensile tail, and a horselike head and swimming in an upright position: family Syngnathidae (pipefishes)\n
Also called : snailfish any small spiny-finned fish of the family Liparidae, esp Liparis liparis, of cold seas, having a soft scaleless tadpole-shaped body with the pelvic fins fused into a sucker\n
A sea urchin is a small round sea creature that has a hard shell covered with sharp points.\n
land bordering on the sea; a coast\n

voca.means_en:
When you seal an envelope, you close it by folding part of it over and sticking it down, so that it cannot be opened without being torn.
If you seal a container or an opening, you cover it with something in order to prevent air, liquid, or other material getting in or out. If you seal something in a container, you put it inside and then close the container tightly.
If someone in authority seals an area, they stop people entering or passing through it, for example by placing barriers in the way.
To seal something means to make it definite or confirm how it is going to be.
The seal on a container or opening is the part where it has been sealed.
A seal is a device or a piece of material, for example in a machine, which closes an opening tightly so that air, liquid, or other substances cannot get in or out.
A seal is something such as a piece of sticky paper or wax that is fixed to a container or door and must be broken before the container or door can be opened.
to keep something inside a container so that none of it can escape\n
if the police, the army, etc. seal a place or an area off, they put barriers there to prevent anyone from entering it\n

voca.means_ko: 찾다, 조사하다, 탐색하다\n수사, 조사, 탐색, 검색

voca.means_en: to remove from contact with others\nto shut off or screen from view\n

voca.means_en:
A second is one of the sixty parts that a minute is divided into. People often say `a second' or `seconds' when they simply mean a very short time.
The second item in a series is the one that you count as number two.
Second is used before superlative adjectives to indicate that there is only one thing better or larger than the thing you are referring to.
You say second when you want to make a second point or give a second reason for something.
If you second a proposal in a meeting or debate, you formally express your agreement with it so that it can then be discussed or voted on.

voca.means_en: see - saw - seen

A seed is the small, hard part of a plant from which a new plant grows.
You can refer to the seeds of something when you want to talk about the beginning of a feeling or process that gradually develops and becomes stronger or more important.
In sports such as tennis or badminton, a seed is a player who has been ranked according to his or her ability.
If you seed a piece of land, you plant seeds in it.
When a player or a team is seeded in a sports competition, they are ranked according to their ability.

voca.means_ko: [씨익k]\n(~을 발견하기 위해) 찾다, 모색하다, 추구하다, 구하다\n~하려고 시도하다
voca.means_en:
If you seek something such as a job or a place to live, you try to find one.
When someone seeks something, they try to obtain it.
If you seek someone's help or advice, you contact them in order to ask for it.
If you seek to do something, you try to do it.
to look for and find somebody/something, especially when this means using a lot of effort\n

You use seem to say that someone or something gives the impression of having a particular quality, or of happening in the way you describe.\nYou use seem when you are describing your own feelings or thoughts, or describing something that has happened to you, in order to make your statement less forceful.\n

voca.means_ko: [쎄g멘t]\n부분, 마디, 단편\n(여러 부분으로) 분할하다, 구분하다, 가르다, 나누다
voca.means_en:
A segment of something is one part of it, considered separately from the rest.
A segment of fruit such as an orange or grapefruit is one of the sections into which it is easily divided.
A segment of a circle is one of the two parts into which it is divided when you draw a straight line through it.
A segment of a market is one part of it, considered separately from the rest.
If a company segments a market, it divides it into separate parts, usually in order to improve marketing opportunities.

voca.means_ko:
[쎄g웨이]
계속하다, 계속해서 연주하다
(한 가지 노래, 주제, 장소 등에서 다른 것으로 부드럽게)
넘어가다/이어지다
voca.means_en: If something such as a piece of music or conversation segues into another piece of music or conversation, it changes into it or is followed by it without a break.\n
Seismology is the scientific study of earthquakes.\n

voca.means_ko:
[씨이-z]
와락/꽉 붙잡다, 움켜잡다,
(흔히 폭력을 써서) 장악하다, 점령하다
체포하다, 붙잡다
voca.means_en:
If you seize something, you take hold of it quickly, firmly, and forcefully.
When a group of people seize a place or seize control of it, they take control of it quickly and suddenly, using force.
If a government or other authority seize someone's property, they take it from them, often by force.
When someone is seized, they are arrested or captured.
When you seize an opportunity, you take advantage of it and do something that you want to do.

voca.means_ko: 엄추다, 동작을 안 하다\n(신체 부위가) 잘 움직이지 않다, 말을 안 듣다
voca.means_en: if a machine or a part of a machine seizes up, it stops moving or working correctly\nif a part of your body seizes up, it becomes stiff and you are unable to move it easily\n

If someone has a seizure, they have a sudden violent attack of an illness, especially one that affects their heart or brain.
If there is a seizure of power or a seizure of an area of land, a group of people suddenly take control of the place, using force.
When an organization such as the police or customs service makes a seizure of illegal goods, they find them and take them away.
If a financial institution or a government makes a seizure of someone's assets, they take their money or property from them because they have not paid money that they owe.
If something seldom happens, it happens only occasionally.\n

voca.means_ko:
[셀렉t]
(보통 체계적으로) 선택하다, 선발하다, 고르다
선택/선발된, 조건이 까다로운
엄선된
voca.means_en:
choose / select / pick / opt / go for / single out
If you select something, you choose it from a number of things of the same kind.
If you select a file or a piece of text on a computer screen, you click on it so that it is marked in a different colour, usually in order for you to give the computer an instruction relating to that file or piece of text.
A select group is a small group of some of the best people or things of their kind.
If you describe something as select, you mean it has many desirable features, but is available only to people who have a lot of money or who belong to a high social class.

choice / favourite / preference / selection / pick
Selection is the act of selecting one or more people or things from a group.
A selection of people or things is a set of them that have been selected from a larger group.
The selection of goods in a shop is the particular range of goods that it has available and from which you can choose what you want.

voca.means_ko: [쎌f]\n(어떤 사람의 평상시) 모습, 본모습, \n자기, 자신, 자아
voca.means_en: Your self is your basic personality or nature, especially considered in terms of what you are really like as a person.\nA person's self is the essential part of their nature which makes them different from everyone and everything else.\n

Your self-esteem is how you feel about yourself. For example, if you have low self-esteem, you do not like yourself, you do not think that you are a valuable person, and therefore you do not behave confidently.\n
If you say that someone is selfish, you mean that he or she cares only about himself or herself, and not about other people.\n

sell - sold - sold
cost / be / sell / retail / set sb back sth
If you sell something that you own, you let someone have it in return for money.
If a shop sells a particular thing, it is available for people to buy there.
If something sells for a particular price, that price is paid for it.
If something sells, it is bought by the public, usually in fairly large quantities.
to ignore or change your principles or beliefs, especially to gain an advantage for yourself\nto sell your business or a part of your business\n
to sell something to somebody else that you have bought not long before, usually in order to make a profit\n
to sell your home, possessions, business, etc., usually because you need the money, are moving to another place or are stopping work\n
In colleges and universities in some countries, a semester is one of the two main periods into which the year is divided.\n

one half of a circle
half the circumference of a circle
anything having the shape or form of half a circle

The Senate is the smaller and more important of the two parts of the parliament in some countries, for example the United States and Australia.\nSenate or the Senate is the governing council at some universities.\n
A senator is a member of a political Senate, for example in the United States or Australia.\n

When you send someone something, you arrange for it to be taken and delivered to them, for example by post.
If you send someone somewhere, you tell them to go there.
If you send someone to an institution such as a school or a prison, you arrange for them to stay there for a period of time.
If something sends things or people in a particular direction, it causes them to move in that direction.
To send someone or something into a particular state means to cause them to go into or be in that state.
to send a message to somebody to ask them to come and see you, especially in order to help you\n
to ask somebody to bring or deliver something to you\n
to make somebody leave the field because they have broken the rules of the game\n
to order somebody to go to a place to deal with a difficult situation\nto tell somebody to go into a room, where somebody else is waiting to see them\n

voca.means_ko: (자신보다 앞서 도착하도록) ~을 미리 보내다\n(어떤 사람의 옛날 주소로 온 편지를 새 주소로) 다시 보내다
voca.means_en:
to send a letter, etc. that has arrived at somebody's old address to their new one
to send something you have received to somebody else for them to see or deal with
to send something to a place so that it arrives before you get there

voca.means_en: to send something to a lot of different people or places\nto produce something, such as light, a signal, sound, etc.\n

voca.means_en:
The senior people in an organization or profession have the highest and most important jobs.
If someone is senior to you in an organization or profession, they have a higher and more important job than you or they are considered to be superior to you because they have worked there for longer and have more experience.
If you take part in a sport at senior level, you take part in competitions with adults and people who have reached a high degree of achievement in that sport.
Senior is used when indicating how much older one person is than another. For example, if someone is ten years your senior, they are ten years older than you.

voca.means_en:
A sensation is a physical feeling.
Sensation is your ability to feel things physically, especially through your sense of touch.
You can use sensation to refer to the general feeling or impression caused by a particular experience.
If a person, event, or situation is a sensation, it causes great excitement or interest.
If a person, event, or situation causes a sensation, they cause great interest or excitement.

voca.means_ko:

~을 느끼다, 감지하다
voca.means_en:
Your senses are the physical abilities of sight, smell, hearing, touch, and taste.
If you have a sense that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you may not have firm, clear evidence for this belief.
If you have a sense of guilt or relief, for example, you feel guilty or relieved.
If you have a sense of something such as duty or justice, you are aware of it and believe it is important.
If you sense something, you become aware of it or you realize it, although it is not very obvious.
Someone who has a sense of timing or style has a natural ability with regard to timing or style. You can also say that someone has a bad sense of timing or style.
a feeling or an understanding that an event is important or special\n

voca.means_en:
A sentence is a group of words which, when they are written down, begin with a capital letter and end with a full stop, question mark, or exclamation mark. Most sentences contain a subject and a verb.
In a law court, a sentence is the punishment that a person receives after they have been found guilty of a crime.
When a judge sentences someone, he or she states in court what their punishment will be.

개별적인
voca.means_en:
If one thing is separate from another, there is a barrier, space, or division between them, so that they are clearly two things.
If you refer to separate things, you mean several different things, rather than just one thing.
If you separate people or things that are together, or if they separate, they move apart.
If you separate people or things that have been connected, or if one separates from another, the connection between them is ended.
If a couple who are married or living together separate, they decide to live apart.
An object, obstacle, distance, or period of time which separates two people, groups, or things exists between them.
If you separate one idea or fact from another, you clearly see or show the difference between them.
to divide into different parts; to divide somebody/something into different parts or groups\n

voca.means_ko:

voca.means_en:
A sequence of events or things is a number of events or things that come one after another in a particular order.
A particular sequence is a particular order in which things happen or are arranged.
A film sequence is a part of a film that shows a single set of actions.
A gene sequence or a DNA sequence is the order in which the elements making up a particular gene are combined.
Something that is sequential follows a fixed order.\n

A sergeant is a non-commissioned officer of middle rank in the army, marines, or air force.\nIn the British police force, a sergeant is an officer with the next to lowest rank. In American police forces, a sergeant is an officer with the rank immediately below a captain.\n
Serialization is the act of serializing a book.\nA serialization is a story, originally written as a book, which is being published or broadcast in a number of parts.\n
If a book is serialized, it is broadcast on the radio or television or is published in a magazine or newspaper in a number of parts over a period of time.\n
A series of things or events is a number of them that come one after the other.\nA radio or television series is a set of programmes of a particular kind which have the same title.\n

voca.means_ko:

진지한, 만만찮은

voca.means_en:
serious / grave / earnest / solemn
Serious problems or situations are very bad and cause people to be worried or afraid.
Serious matters are important and deserve careful and thoughtful consideration.
When important matters are dealt with in a serious way, they are given careful and thoughtful consideration.
Serious music or literature requires concentration to understand or appreciate it.

You use seriously to indicate that you are not joking and that you really mean what you say.
You say 'seriously' when you are surprised by what someone has said, as a way of asking them if they really mean it.
If you take someone or something seriously, you believe that they are important and deserve attention.
A serpent is a snake.\n
set - set - set
to begin a task or an activity, especially with energy or enthusiasm\nto approach a problem or task in a particular way\n
if bad weather, an unpleasant feeling, an illness, etc. sets in, it begins and seems likely to continue.
Now Jack and Annie and Peanut are about to set out in search of the third thing… in Sunset of the sabertooth.\n

voca.means_ko:
(다시 필요할 때까지) 한쪽으로 치워놓다

voca.means_en:
to place something to one side
to save or keep something for a particular purpose
to ignore something such as your feelings or opinions, because other things are important
to reject a previous decision made by a court
do something at a speed which other people must follow if they want to be successful; lead by being better, cleverer, more original, etc. than other people\n

voca.means_en:
If people settle an argument or problem, or if something settles it, they solve it, for example by making a decision about who is right or about what to do.
If people settle a legal dispute or if they settle, they agree to end the dispute without going to a court of law, for example by paying some money or by apologizing.
If you settle a bill or debt, you pay the amount that you owe.
If something is settled, it has all been decided and arranged.
When people settle a place or in a place, or when a government settles them there, they start living there permanently.
If you settle yourself somewhere or settle somewhere, you sit down or make yourself comfortable.
The dust settled.

voca.means_ko: 편안히 앉다/눕다\n(조용히 한 곳에 자리 잡고) 정착하다
voca.means_en:
(settle yourself down) to get yourself into a comfortable position when you are sitting or lying
to start to have a calmer or quieter way of life, without many changes, especially living in one place
to become relaxed and confident in a new situation; to get used to a new way of life, job, etc.
to become calmer and less active
to accept something that is not quite what you wanted but is the best that you can get\n
to pay somebody the money you owe them\n

voca.means_ko: 빚을 갚다, 정산하다, 자기 부담분을 지불하다

voca.means_en: Several is used to refer to an imprecise number of people or things that is not large but is greater than two.\n

voca.means_ko: 심각한, 엄격한, 심한, 극심한\n심각한, 가차없는, 엄격한, 가혹한
voca.means_en: You use severe to indicate that something bad or undesirable is great or intense.\nSevere punishments or criticisms are very strong or harsh.\n

voca.means_ko: [서붸뤼디]\n격렬, 혹독, 엄격, 엄정, 괴로움, 쓰라림\n간소, 수수함, 소박한 멋
오래 입어서 낡은, 초라한(옷차림), 비천한/비루한\n황폐한, 낡아빠진
voca.means_en:
Shabby things or places look old and in bad condition.
A person who is shabby is wearing old, worn clothes.
If you describe someone's behaviour as shabby, you think they behave in an unfair or unacceptable way.
Not too shabby!

voca.means_ko:

(시원한) 그늘, (전등의) 갓, 빛 가리개

유령, 귀신

voca.means_en:
shade / shadow / colour / shade / tone / hue / tint / tinge
A shade of a particular colour is one of its different forms. For example, emerald green and olive green are shades of green.
Shade is an area of darkness under or next to an object such as a tree, where sunlight does not reach.
Shade is darkness or shadows as they are shown in a picture.
The shades of something abstract are its many, slightly different forms.
A shade is a piece of stiff cloth or heavy paper that you can pull down over a window as a covering.
If you say that a place or person is shaded by objects such as trees, you mean that the place or person cannot be reached, harmed, or bothered by strong sunlight because those objects are in the way.
to gradually change into something else so that you cannot tell where one thing ends and the other begins\n

voca.means_en:
Shaggy hair or fur is long and untidy.
He had a shaggy black beard.
The mammoth looked like a gaint elephant with shaggy reddish hair and long, curved tusks.

voca.means_ko:
[쉐익k]
흔들리다. 진동하다, 악수하다

털다, 떨리다
진동, 흔들림
voca.means_en:
shake - shook - shaken
If you shake something, you hold it and move it quickly backwards and forwards or up and down. You can also shake a person, for example, because you are angry with them or because you want them to wake up.
If you shake yourself or your body, you make a lot of quick, small, repeated movements without moving from the place where you are.
If you shake your head, you turn it from side to side in order to say 'no' or to show disbelief or sadness.
If you are shaking, or a part of your body is shaking, you are making quick, small movements that you cannot control, for example because you are cold or afraid.
If you shake your fist or an object such as a stick at someone, you wave it in the air in front of them because you are angry with them.
to become comfortable and confident in a new situation\n
to shake hands with somebody in order to show that you agree to something\n
to escape from somebody; to get rid of somebody who is following you\nto escape from somebody who is holding you and will not let go\n

A shallow container, hole, or area of water measures only a short distance from the top to the bottom.
If you describe a person, piece of work, or idea as shallow, you disapprove of them because they do not show or involve any serious or careful thought.

Shame is an uncomfortable feeling that you get when you have done something wrong or embarrassing, or when someone close to you has.
If someone brings shame on you, they make other people lose their respect for you.
If you say that something is a shame, you are expressing your regret about it and indicating that you wish it had happened differently.
If something shames you, it causes you to feel shame.
If you shame someone into doing something, you force them to do it by making them feel ashamed not to.
If you describe a person's action or attitude as shameful, you think that it is so bad that the person ought to be ashamed.\n

A company's shares are the many equal parts into which its ownership is divided. Shares can be bought by people as an investment.
If something is divided or distributed among a number of different people or things, each of them has, or is responsible for, a share of it.
If you share something with another person, you both have it, use it, or occupy it. You can also say that two people share something.
If you share a task, duty, or responsibility with someone, you each carry out or accept part of it. You can also say that two people share something.
A booming snore shattered the air.\n

The shell of a nut or egg is the hard covering which surrounds it.
The shell of an animal such as a tortoise, snail, or crab is the hard protective covering that it has around its body or on its back.
Shells are hard objects found on beaches. They are usually pink, white, or brown and are the coverings which used to surround small sea creatures.
If someone comes out of their shell, they become more friendly and interested in other people and less quiet, shy, and reserved.
If you shell nuts, peas, prawns, or other food, you remove their natural outer covering.
spend / invest / pay out / pay up / cough up / fork out / shell out\nto pay for something, especially when it is a lot of money or you do not really want to\n
A shepherd is a person, especially a man, whose job is to look after sheep.\nIf you are shepherded somewhere, someone takes you there to make sure that you arrive at the right place safely.\n

Something or someone which is a shield against a particular danger or risk provides protection from it.
A shield is a large piece of metal or leather which soldiers used to carry to protect their bodies while they were fighting.
A shield is a sports prize or badge that is shaped like a shield.
If something or someone shields you from a danger or risk, they protect you from it.
If you shield your eyes, you put your hand above your eyes to protect them from direct sunlight.

If a group of factory workers, nurses, or other people work shifts, they work for a set period before being replaced by another group, so that there is always a group working. Each of these set periods is called a shift. You can also use shift to refer to a group of workers who work together on a particular shift.

voca.means_en:

voca.means_en: You use space to refer to an area that is empty or available. The area can be any size. For example, you can refer to a large area outside as a large open space or to a small area between two objects as a small space.\nIf you space a series of things, you arrange them so that they are not all together but have gaps or intervals of time between them.\n

voca.means_en:
A span is the period of time between two dates or events during which something exists, functions, or happens.
Your concentration span or your attention span is the length of time you are able to concentrate on something or be interested in it.
If something spans a long period of time, it lasts throughout that period of time or relates to that whole period of time.
If something spans a range of things, all those things are included in it.
Someone who is sparing with something uses it or gives it only in very small quantities.\n
We advise you to use them as sparingly as you can and put the important stuff into scenarios where it can be tested. \n

A spark is a tiny bright piece of burning material that flies up from something that is burning.
A spark is a flash of light caused by electricity. It often makes a loud sound.
A spark of a quality or feeling, especially a desirable one, is a small but noticeable amount of it.
If something sparks, sparks of fire or light come from it.
If a burning object or electricity sparks a fire, it causes a fire.
to cause something to suddenly happen or develop\n

shine / gleam / glow / sparkle / glisten / shimmer / glitter / twinkle / glint
If something sparkles, it is clear and bright and shines with a lot of very small points of light.
Someone who sparkles is lively, intelligent, and witty.
Sparkles are small points of light caused by light reflecting off a clear bright surface.
The woman ninja's eyes sparkled.
Sparky people or events are lively and entertaining.\n
A sparrow is a small brown bird that is very common in Britain.\n

If you spear something, you push or throw a pointed object into it.

If you do something on spec, you do it hoping to get something that you want, but without being asked or without being certain to get it.

voca.means_ko: 전문, 전공, 장기\n특질, 특성, 특수성, 특별 사항
voca.means_en: Someone's specialty is a particular type of work that they do most or do best, or a subject that they know a lot about.\nA specialty of a particular place is a special food or product that is always very good there.\n
A species is a class of plants or animals whose members have the same main characteristics and are able to breed with each other.\n

voca.means_ko: 명확한 것, 상세한 특성, 시방서\n구체적인, 특정한, 상세한
voca.means_en:
You use specific to refer to a particular fixed area, problem, or subject.
If someone is specific, they give a description that is precise and exact. You can also use specific to describe their description.
Something that is specific to a particular thing is connected with that thing only.
A specification is a requirement which is clearly stated, for example about the necessary features in the design of something.\n

voca.means_ko: 명확히 말하는 사람, 특수화 하는 사람

voca.means_en: If you specify something, you give information about what is required or should happen in a certain situation.\nIf you specify what should happen or be done, you explain it in an exact and detailed way.\n

A spell of a particular type of weather or a particular activity is a short period of time during which this type of weather or activity occurs.
A spell is a situation in which events are controlled by a magical power.
to make something clear and easy to understand; to explain something in detail\nto say or write the letters of a word in the correct order\n
clean, tidy and fresh\n"I want the room to be spick and span"\n

to flow over the edge of a container that is too full\nto start in one situation or area and then have an effect on another situation or in another area\n

spin - spun - spun
If something spins or if you spin it, it turns quickly around a central point.
When you spin washing, it is turned round and round quickly in a spin drier or a washing machine to get the water out.
If your head is spinning, you feel unsteady or confused, for example because you are drunk, ill, or excited.
If someone puts a certain spin on an event or situation, they interpret it and try to present it in a particular way.
The cat roared and spun around.
The most unusual thing is that a spider can spin a web.\n
to produce a new product, material, service, etc. that is connected with something successful that already exists; to be produced in this way\n
to separate part of a company or an organization from the main part in order to form a new one\n
Spinach is a vegetable with large dark green leaves that you chop up and boil in water before eating.\n
Spinal means relating to your spine.\n

Your spine is the row of bones down your back.
The spine of a book is the narrow stiff part which the pages and covers are attached to.
Spines are also long, sharp points on an animal's body or on a plant.

A spiral is a shape which winds round and round, with each curve above or outside the previous one.
If something spirals or is spiralled somewhere, it grows or moves in a spiral curve.
If an amount or level spirals, it rises quickly and at an increasing rate.
If an amount or level spirals downwards, it falls quickly and at an increasing rate.

voca.means_en:
Spit is the watery liquid produced in your mouth. You usually use spit to refer to an amount of it that has been forced out of someone's mouth.
A spit is a long rod which is pushed through a piece of meat and hung over an open fire to cook the meat.
A spit of land is a long, flat, narrow piece of land that sticks out into the sea.
If someone spits, they force an amount of liquid out of their mouth, often to show hatred or contempt.
If you spit liquid or food somewhere, you force a small amount of it out of your mouth.
If it is spitting, it is raining very lightly.
cleaning and polishing\n

used to tell somebody to reveal a piece of information or to say something when they are feeling nervous or unwilling to speak\nusually used in orders to tell somebody to say something when they seem frightened or unwilling to speak\n
if a baby spits up or spits something up, it brings milk back from its stomach out through its mouth\n

You use in spite of to introduce a fact which makes the rest of the statement you are making seem surprising.
If you do something in spite of yourself, you do it although you did not really intend to or expect to.
If you do something cruel out of spite, you do it because you want to hurt or upset someone.
If you do something cruel to spite someone, you do it in order to hurt or upset them.
A splint is a long piece of wood or metal that is fastened to a broken arm, leg, or back to keep it still.\n

pay too much attention in an argument to differences that are very small and not important\n

A sponge is a piece of sponge that you use for washing yourself or for cleaning things.
A sponge is a light cake or pudding made from flour, eggs, sugar, and sometimes fat.
If you sponge something, you clean it by wiping it with a wet sponge.
If you say that someone sponges off other people or sponges on them, you mean that they regularly get money from other people when they should be trying to support themselves.
to wash somebody/something with a wet cloth or a soft material\n
to get money, food, etc. from other people, without doing anything for them or offering to pay\n

If you have a spot of something, you have a small amount of it.
A spot in a television or radio show is a part of it that is regularly reserved for a particular performer or type of entertainment.
They saw two spotted brown animals standing in the tall grass.

A spotlight is a powerful light, for example in a theatre, which can be directed so that it lights up a small area.
If something spotlights a particular problem or situation, it makes people notice it and think about it.
Someone or something that is in the spotlight is getting a great deal of public attention.

Spring is the season between winter and summer when the weather becomes warmer and plants start to grow again.
A spring is a spiral of wire which returns to its original shape after it is pressed or pulled.
A spring is a place where water comes up through the ground. It is also the water that comes from that place.
When a person or animal springs, they jump upwards or forwards suddenly or quickly.
If something springs in a particular direction, it moves suddenly and quickly.
If one thing springs from another thing, it is the result of it.
The jaguar sprang after him.
to pay for something for other people\n"We need to spring-clean the house."\n
to be caused by something; to start from something\nto appear suddenly or unexpectedly from somewhere\n
to appear, develop, grow, etc. quickly or suddenly\n

voca.means_en:

Spurs are small metal wheels with sharp points that are attached to the heels of a rider's boots. The rider uses them to make their horse go faster.

A spurt of liquid is a stream of it which comes out of something very forcefully.
A spurt of activity, effort, or emotion is a sudden, brief period of intense activity, effort, or emotion.

If someone or something is squashed, they are pressed or crushed with such force that they become injured or lose their shape.
If you squash something that is causing you trouble, you put a stop to it, often by force.
If people or things are squashed into a place, they are put or pushed into a place where there is not enough room for them to be.

voca.means_en: to achieve a successful result with great difficulty\n

voca.means_en:
If you squeeze something, you press it firmly, usually with your hands.
If you squeeze a liquid or a soft substance out of an object, you get the liquid or substance out by pressing the object.
If you squeeze your eyes shut or if your eyes squeeze shut, you close them tightly, usually because you are frightened or to protect your eyes from something such as strong sunlight.

If you squeeze something out of someone, you persuade them to give it to you, although they may be unwilling to do this.
If a government squeezes the economy, they put strict controls on people's ability to borrow money or on their own departments' freedom to spend money, in order to control the country's rate of inflation.
If you say that getting a number of people into a small space is a squeeze, you mean that it is only just possible for them all to get into it.
get as much money, information, etc. out of somebody as you can\n

voca.means_en:
sweep - swept - swept
If you sweep an area of floor or ground, you push dirt or rubbish off it using a brush with a long handle.
If you sweep things off something, you push them off with a quick smooth movement of your arm.
If someone with long hair sweeps their hair into a particular style, they put it into that style.
If your arm or hand sweeps in a particular direction, or if you sweep it there, it moves quickly and smoothly in that direction.
If wind, a stormy sea, or another strong force sweeps someone or something along, it moves them quickly along.
If you are swept somewhere, you are taken there very quickly.
If something sweeps from one place to another, it moves there extremely quickly.
to destroy or get rid of something completely\n
to lift somebody with a sudden smooth movement\nto make somebody become very involved in something so that they are unable to think clearly\n
to ignore something; to treat something as though it is not important\n
to destroy or get rid of something completely\n
to clean a room, a cupboard, etc. with a large brush with a long handle (a broom)\n

Sweet food and drink contains a lot of sugar.
A sweet smell is a pleasant one, for example the smell of a flower.
If you describe something such as air or water as sweet, you mean that it smells or tastes pleasantly fresh and clean.
A sweet sound is pleasant, smooth, and gentle.
If you describe something as sweet, you mean that it gives you great pleasure and satisfaction.
If you describe someone as sweet, you mean that they are pleasant, kind, and gentle towards other people.
Sweets are small sweet things such as toffees, chocolates, and mints.
pleasant but unimportant words said by lovers\n

If the amount or size of something swells or if something swells it, it becomes larger than it was before.
If something such as a part of your body swells, it becomes larger and rounder than normal.
If you swell with a feeling, you are suddenly full of that feeling.
You can describe something as swell if you think it is really nice.
If a vehicle or other moving thing swerves or if you swerve it, it suddenly changes direction, often in order to avoid hitting something.\n

If you call someone a swine, you dislike them or think that they are a bad person, usually because they have behaved unpleasantly towards you.\n"Dig for more of these, you swine!" he said.\n

voca.means_en:
swing - swung - swung
If something swings or if you swing it, it moves repeatedly backwards and forwards or from side to side from a fixed point.
If something swings in a particular direction or if you swing it in that direction, it moves in that direction with a smooth, curving movement.
If a vehicle swings in a particular direction, or if the driver swings it in a particular direction, they turn suddenly in that direction.
If someone swings around, they turn around quickly, usually because they are surprised.
A swing is a seat hanging by two ropes or chains from a metal frame or from the branch of a tree. You can sit on the seat and move forwards and backwards through the air.
Then he swung silently down the rope ladder. / Then he swung away.
Jack swung himself over the window sill.
to try to hit somebody
to visit a person or place for a short time, especially when you are going somewhere else
If you describe something or someone as swinging, you mean that they are lively and fashionable.\n

voca.means_ko: 소용돌이치다, 빙빙돌다, 현기증이 나다\n빙글빌글 돌기, 회전, 소용돌이
voca.means_en:
If you swirl something liquid or flowing, or if it swirls, it moves round and round quickly.
Then, in a great swirl of colors - in a blur of feathers and light - in a flapping and stretching and screeching - a new being took shape.
The icy wild waters swirled around them.
Snow swirled over the ground, covering the tiny foot prints.

voca.means_en:
If police or soldiers swoop on a place, they go there suddenly and quickly, usually in order to arrest someone or to attack the place.
When a bird or aeroplane swoops, it suddenly moves downwards through the air in a smooth curving movement.
If something is done in one fell swoop or at one fell swoop, it is done on a single occasion or by a single action.
Then she swooped down to the ocean. / Suddenly the monkey swooped down from his tree.

to make or cause to make a rustling or swirling sound, esp when moving or pouring out.
a swirling or rustling sound or movement.
The parrot swooshed into the tree house.
A sword is a weapon with a handle and a long sharp blade.\nIf you cross swords with someone, you disagree with them and argue with them about something.\n
A swordfish is a large sea fish with a very long upper jaw.\n
A syllable is a part of a word that contains a single vowel sound and that is pronounced as a unit. So, for example, 'book' has one syllable, and 'reading' has two syllables.\n
You can refer to the subjects that are studied in a particular course as the syllabus.\nA syllabus is an outline or summary of the subjects to be covered in a course.\n

sign / indication / symptom / symbol / indicator / signal
Something that is a symbol of a society or an aspect of life seems to represent it because it is very typical of it.
A symbol of something such as an idea is a shape or design that is used to represent it.
A symbol for an item in a calculation or scientific formula is a number, letter, or shape that represents that item.
Something that has symmetry is symmetrical in shape, design, or structure.\nSymmetry in a relationship or agreement is the fact of both sides giving and receiving an equal amount.\n

If you are sympathetic to someone who is in a bad situation, you are kind to them and show that you understand their feelings.
If you are sympathetic to a proposal or action, you approve of it and are willing to support it.
You describe someone as sympathetic when you like them and approve of the way that they behave.
A synagogue is a building where Jewish people meet to worship or to study their religion.\n
A synonym is a word or expression which means the same as another word or expression.\n

voca.means_en: To synthesize a substance means to produce it by means of chemical or biological reactions.\nIf you synthesize different ideas, facts, or experiences, you combine them to form a single idea or impression.\n

A syringe is a small tube with a thin hollow needle at the end. Syringes are used for putting liquids into things and for taking liquids out, for example for injecting drugs or for taking blood from someone's body.\n

A system is a way of working, organizing, or doing something which follows a fixed plan or set of rules. You can use system to refer to an organization or institution that is organized in this way.
A system is a set of devices powered by electricity, for example a computer or an alarm.
A system is a set of equipment or parts such as water pipes or electrical wiring, which is used to supply water, heat, or electricity.
A system is a network of things that are linked together so that people or things can travel from one place to another or communicate.
Your system is your body's organs and other parts that together perform particular functions.
A tablet is a small solid round mass of medicine which you swallow.\nClay tablets or stone tablets are the flat pieces of clay or stone which people used to write on before paper was invented\n

If you tackle a difficult problem or task, you deal with it in a very determined or efficient way.
If you tackle someone in a game such as hockey or football, you try to take the ball away from them. If you tackle someone in rugby or American football, you knock them to the ground.
If you tackle someone about a particular matter, you speak to them honestly about it, usually in order to get it changed or done.
If you tackle someone, you attack them and fight them.
Tackle is the equipment that you need for a sport or activity, especially fishing.

label / tag / sticker
A tag is a small piece of card or cloth which is attached to an object or person and has information about that object or person on it.
An electronic tag is a device that is firmly attached to someone or something and sets off an alarm if that person or thing moves away or is removed.
You can refer to a phrase that is used to describe someone or something as a tag.
If you tag something, you attach something to it or mark it so that it can be identified later.
If you tag someone in a particular way, you keep describing them using a particular phrase or thinking of them as a particular thing.
to go somewhere with somebody, especially when you have not been invited\n
to add something as an extra item to the end of something, especially in a careless way\n

The tail of an animal, bird, or fish is the part extending beyond the end of its body.
You can use tail to refer to the end or back of something, especially something long and thin.
If a man is wearing tails, he is wearing a formal jacket which has two long pieces hanging down at the back.
To tail someone means to follow close behind them and watch where they go and what they do.
If you toss a coin and it comes down tails, you can see the side of it that does not have a picture of a head on it.
if traffic tails back, it forms a long line that moves very slowly or not at all\n

A tale is a story, often involving magic or exciting events.
You can refer to an interesting, exciting, or dramatic account of a real event as a tale.
If you survive a dangerous or frightening experience and so are able to tell people about it afterwards, you can say that you lived to tell the tale.
If someone tells tales about you, they tell other people things about you which are untrue or which you wanted to be kept secret.
Talent is the natural ability to do something well.\n
Someone who is talented has a natural ability to do something well.\n

discussion / conversation / dialogue / talk / consultation / chat / gossip
When you talk, you use spoken language to express your thoughts, ideas, or feelings.
If you talk to someone, you have a conversation with them. You can also say that two people talk.
If you talk to someone, you tell them about the things that are worrying you. You can also say that two people talk.
If you talk on or about something, you make an informal speech telling people what you know or think about it.
If one group of people talks to another, or if two groups talk, they have formal discussions in order to do a deal or produce an agreement.
to speak to somebody without listening to what they say in reply\n
to reply rudely to somebody in authority\n

If someone tames a wild animal or bird, they train it not to be afraid of humans and to do what they say.

Something that is tan is a light brown colour.
If something is tangible, it is clear enough or definite enough to be easily seen, felt, or noticed.\n

If ideas or situations are tangled, they become confused and complicated.
to become involved in an argument or a fight with somebody\n

If you tap something, you hit it with a quick light blow or a series of quick light blows.
If you tap your fingers or feet, you make a regular pattern of sound by hitting a surface lightly and repeatedly with them, especially while you are listening to music.
If you tap a resource or situation, you make use of it by getting from it something that you need or want.
If someone taps your telephone, they attach a special device to the line so that they can secretly listen to your conversations.
to put information, numbers, letters, etc. into a machine by pressing buttons\n

voca.means_en: A tavern is a bar or pub.\n

Tea is a drink made by adding hot water to tea leaves or tea bags. Many people add milk to the drink and some add sugar.
The chopped dried leaves of the plant that tea is made from is referred to as tea.
Tea is a meal some people eat in the late afternoon. It consists of food such as sandwiches and cakes, with tea to drink.
Some people refer to the main meal that they eat in the early part of the evening as tea.
If you say that someone or something is not your cup of tea, you mean that they are not the kind of person or thing that you like.

teach - taught - taught
If you teach someone something, you give them instructions so that they know about it or how to do it.
To teach someone something means to make them think, feel, or act in a new or different way.
If you teach or teach a subject, you help students to learn about it by explaining it or showing them how to do it, usually as a job at a school, college, or university.

tear - tore - torn
If you tear paper, cloth, or another material, or if it tears, you pull it into two pieces or you pull it so that a hole appears in it.
If you tear one of your muscles or ligaments, or if it tears, you injure it by accidentally moving it in the wrong way.
To tear something from somewhere means to remove it roughly and violently.
A tear in paper, cloth, or another material is a hole that has been made in it.
Tears are the drops of salty liquid that come out of your eyes when you are crying.
But Jack couldn't tear himself away.
to attack something violently, especially by pulling pieces off it\n

To tease someone means to laugh at them or make jokes about them in order to embarrass, annoy, or upset them.
If you say that someone is teasing, you mean that they are pretending to offer you something that you want, especially sex, but then not giving it to you.
If you refer to someone as a tease, you mean that they like laughing at people or making jokes about them.
If you refer to someone as a tease, you mean that they pretend to offer someone what they want, especially sex, but then do not give it to them.

If you refer to someone's temper or say that they have a temper, you mean that they become angry very easily.
Your temper is the way you are feeling at a particular time. If you are in a good temper, you feel cheerful. If you are in a bad temper, you feel angry and impatient.
To temper something means to make it less extreme.

A template is a thin piece of metal or plastic which is cut into a particular shape. It is used to help you cut wood, paper, metal, or other materials accurately, or to reproduce the same shape many times.\nIf one thing is a template for something else, the second thing is based on the first thing.\n

Something that is temporary lasts for only a limited time.\n

Something that tempts you attracts you and makes you want it, even though it may be wrong or harmful.
If you tempt someone, you offer them something they want in order to encourage them to do what you want them to do.
If someone says that something they say or do is tempting fate or is tempting providence, they mean they are worried that it may cause the good luck they have had so far to end.
take a risk or do something dangerous\n
If something is tempting, it makes you want to do it or have it.\n

voca.means_en: A tenant is someone who pays rent for the place they live in, or for land or buildings that they use.\n

If something tends to happen, it usually happens or it often happens.
If you tend towards a particular characteristic, you often display that characteristic.
You can say that you tend to think something when you want to give your opinion, but do not want it to seem too forceful or definite.
If you tend someone or something, you do what is necessary to keep them in a good condition or to improve their condition.
If you tend to someone or something, you pay attention to them and deal with their problems and needs.
Tennis is a game played by two or four players on a rectangular court. The players use an oval bat with strings across it to hit a ball over a net across the middle of the court.\n

voca.means_en:
A tense situation or period of time is one that makes people anxious, because they do not know what is going to happen next.
If you are tense, you are anxious and nervous and cannot relax.
If your body is tense, your muscles are tight and not relaxed.
If your muscles tense, if you tense, or if you tense your muscles, your muscles become tight and stiff, often because you are anxious or frightened.
The tense of a verb group is its form, which usually shows whether you are referring to past, present, or future time.

Tension is the feeling that is produced in a situation when people are anxious and do not trust each other, and when there is a possibility of sudden violence or conflict.
If there is a tension between forces, arguments, or influences, there are differences between them that cause difficulties.

The tentacles of an animal such as an octopus are the long thin parts that are used for feeling and holding things, for getting food, and for moving.
If you talk about the tentacles of a political, commercial, or social organization, you are referring to the power and influence that it has in the outside community.
Each of its arms, or tentacles, has many suckers which act like rubber.
obey the orders and accept the ideas, aims and principles of a particular group or person\n
A tepee is a round tent. Tepees were first made by Native American peoples from animal skins or the outer covering of trees.\n

cold / cool / freezing / chilly / lukewarm / tepid
Water or another liquid that is tepid is slightly warm.
If you describe something such as a feeling or reaction as tepid, you mean that it lacks enthusiasm.

A terminal illness or disease causes death, often slowly, and cannot be cured.
A terminal is a place where vehicles, passengers, or goods begin or end a journey.
A computer terminal is a piece of equipment consisting of a keyboard and a screen that is used for putting information into a computer or getting information from it.
On a piece of electrical equipment, a terminal is one of the points where electricity enters or leaves it.

Territorial means concerned with the ownership of a particular area of land or water.\nIf you describe an animal or its behaviour as territorial, you mean that it has an area which it regards as its own, and which it defends when other animals try to enter it.\n

Territory is land which is controlled by a particular country or ruler.
A territory is a country or region that is controlled by another country.
You can use territory to refer to an area of knowledge or experience.
An animal's territory is an area which it regards as its own and which it defends when other animals try to enter it.
Territory is land with a particular character.
If you say that something comes with the territory, you mean that you accept it as a natural result of the situation you are in.

Terror is very great fear.
Terror is violence or the threat of violence, especially when it is used for political reasons.

If someone describes a child as a terror, they think that he or she is naughty and difficult to control.

A text is a book or other piece of writing, especially one connected with science or learning.
If you text someone, you send them a text message on a mobile phone.

A textbook is a book containing facts about a particular subject that is used by people studying that subject.\nIf you say that something is a textbook case or example, you are emphasizing that it provides a clear example of a type of situation or event.\n

material / fabric / cloth / textile
Textiles are types of cloth or fabric, especially ones that have been woven.
Textiles are the industries concerned with the manufacture of cloth.
Textual means relating to written texts, especially literary texts.\n

The texture of something is the way that it feels when you touch it, for example how smooth or rough it is.\nThe texture of something, especially food or soil, is its structure, for example whether it is light with lots of holes, or very heavy and solid.\n

A theatre is a building with a stage in it, on which plays, shows, and other performances take place.
You can refer to work in the theatre such as acting or writing plays as the theatre.
Theatre is entertainment that involves the performance of plays.
A theater or a movie theater is a place where people go to watch films for entertainment.

A theme in a piece of writing, a talk, or a discussion is an important idea or subject that runs through it.
A theme in an artist's work or in a work of literature is an idea in it that the artist or writer develops or repeats.
A theme is a short simple tune on which a piece of music is based.
Theme music or a theme song is a piece of music that is played at the beginning and end of a film or of a television or radio programme.

voca.means_en:
Then means at a particular time in the past or in the future.
You use then to say that one thing happens after another, or is after another on a list.
You use then in conversation to indicate that what you are about to say follows logically in some way from what has just been said or implied.
You use then at the end of a topic or at the end of a conversation.
You use then with words like 'now', 'well', and 'okay', to introduce a new topic or a new point of view.
You use then to introduce the second part of a sentence which begins with `if'. The first part of the sentence describes a possible situation, and then introduces the result of the situation.
You use then at the beginning of a sentence or after 'and' or 'but' to introduce a comment or an extra piece of information to what you have already said.

voca.means_en:

If you have a theory about something, you have your own opinion about it which you cannot prove but which you think is true.
The theory of a practical subject or skill is the set of rules and principles that form the basis of it.
You use in theory to say that although something is supposed to be true or to happen in the way stated, it may not in fact be true or happen in that way.
A therapist is a person who is skilled in a particular type of therapy.\n
Therapy is the treatment of someone with mental or physical illness without the use of drugs or operations.\nA therapy is a particular treatment of someone with a particular illness.\n

There is used as the subject of the verb 'be' to say that something exists or does not exist, or to draw attention to it.
You use there in front of certain verbs when you are saying that something exists, develops, or can be seen. Whether the verb is singular or plural depends on the noun which follows the verb.
If something is there, it exists or is available.
You use there to indicate a place that you are pointing to or looking at, in order to draw someone's attention to it.
that is the situation; those are the facts\n
You use therefore to introduce a logical result or conclusion.\n

A thermal is a movement of rising warm air.
A thermometer is an instrument for measuring temperature. It usually consists of a narrow glass tube containing a thin column of a liquid which rises and falls as the temperature rises and falls.\n

If something is thick with another thing, the first thing is full of or covered with the second.
The thick black mud was up to her chest.
quickly and in great numbers or quantities\n
a physical condition in which your head is painful or you cannot think clearly as a result of an illness or of drinking too much alcohol\n

If you think that something is the case, you have the opinion that it is the case.
If you say that you think that something is true or will happen, you mean that you have the impression that it is true or will happen, although you are not certain of the facts.
If you think in a particular way, you have those general opinions or attitudes.
consider a decision again and perhaps change your idea or intention\n
to think carefully about what might happen in the future; to plan for the future\n
to remember or think about something that happened in the past\n
speak your thoughts about something, for example a problem, to yourself or to others, probably without organizing them as in normal speech\n

to create an idea, a plan, a story, etc. in your mind\n

Thought is the past tense and past participle of think.
A thought is an idea that you have in your mind.
A person's thoughts are their mind, or all the ideas in their mind when they are concentrating on one particular thing.
A person's thoughts are their opinions on a particular subject.
Thought is the activity of thinking, especially deeply, carefully, or logically.
A thousand or one thousand is the number 1,000.\nIf you refer to thousands of things or people, you are emphasizing that there are very many of them.\n

Thread or a thread is a long very thin piece of a material such as cotton, nylon, or silk, especially one that is used in sewing.
The thread of an argument, a story, or a situation is an aspect of it that connects all the different parts together.
A thread of something such as liquid, light, or colour is a long thin line or piece of it.
The thread on a screw, or on something such as a lid or a pipe, is the raised spiral line of metal or plastic around it which allows it to be fixed in place by twisting.
If you thread your way through a group of people or things, or thread through it, you move through it carefully or slowly, changing direction frequently as you move.
If you thread a long thin object through something, you pass it through one or more holes or narrow spaces.
If you thread small objects such as beads onto a string or thread, you join them together by pushing the string through them.

A threat to a person or thing is a danger that something unpleasant might happen to them. A threat is also the cause of this danger.
A threat is a statement by someone that they will do something unpleasant, especially if you do not do what they want.
If a person or thing is under threat, there is a danger that something unpleasant might be done to them, or that they might cease to exist.

If a person threatens to do something unpleasant to you, or if they threaten you, they say or imply that they will do something unpleasant to you, especially if you do not do what they want.
If something or someone threatens a person or thing, they are likely to harm that person or thing.
If something unpleasant threatens to happen, it seems likely to happen.

The threshold of a building or room is the floor in the doorway, or the doorway itself.
A threshold is an amount, level, or limit on a scale. When the threshold is reached, something else happens or changes.
If you are on the threshold of something exciting or new, you are about to experience it.
Thrift is the quality and practice of being careful with money and not wasting things.\nA thrift or a thrift institution is a kind of savings bank.\n

If something gives you a thrill, it gives you a sudden feeling of great excitement, pleasure, or fear.
If something thrills you, or if you thrill at it, it gives you a feeling of great pleasure and excitement.
If you refer to thrills and spills, you are referring to an experience which is exciting and full of surprises.
to feel very excited at something\n
to feel very excited at something\n

Your throat is the back of your mouth and the top part of the tubes that go down into your stomach and your lungs.
Your throat is the front part of your neck.
If you clear your throat, you cough once in order to make it easier to speak or to attract people's attention.
If you ram something down someone's throat or force it down their throat, you keep mentioning a situation or idea in order to make them accept it or believe it.

A throne is a decorative chair used by a king, queen, or emperor on important official occasions.\nYou can talk about the throne as a way of referring to the position of being king, queen, or emperor.\n

If you say that something happens throughout a particular period of time, you mean that it happens during the whole of that period.\nIf you say that something happens or exists throughout a place, you mean that it happens or exists in all parts of that place.\n

throw / toss / hurl / fling / chuck / lob / bowl / pitch
When you throw an object that you are holding, you move your hand or arm quickly and let go of the object, so that it moves through the air.
If you throw your body or part of your body into a particular position or place, you move it there suddenly and with a lot of force.
If you throw something into a particular place or position, you put it there in a quick and careless way.
To throw someone into a particular place or position means to force them roughly into that place or position.

to include something with what you are selling or offering, without increasing the price
to add a remark, comment, etc. without careful thought

Your thumb is the short thick part on the side of your hand next to your four fingers.
If you thumb a lift or thumb a ride, you stand by the side of the road holding out your thumb until a driver stops and gives you a lift.
If you say that someone or something sticks out like a sore thumb or stands out like a sore thumb, you are emphasizing that they are very noticeable, usually because they are unusual or inappropriate.
If you say that someone is twiddling their thumbs, you mean that they do not have anything to do and are waiting for something to happen.
to turn the pages of a book, a magazine, etc. looking at them quickly\n

If you thump someone, you attack them and hit them with your fist.
When your heart thumps, it beats strongly and quickly, usually because you are afraid or excited.
It landed inside the canoe with a thump.
When they got outside, they heard another sound: horse hooves thumping against the hard ground.
Jack's heavy pack thumped against his back as he ran.
Thumping is used to emphasize that something is very great or severe.\n
A thunderstorm is a storm in which there is thunder and lightning and a lot of heavy rain.\n
another word for thud\n
Thursday is the day after Wednesday and before Friday.\n

You use thus to show that what you are about to mention is the result or consequence of something else that you have just mentioned.\nIf you say that something is thus or happens thus you mean that it is, or happens, as you have just described or as you are just about to describe.\n
Thy is an old-fashioned, poetic, or religious word for `your' when you are talking to one person.\n

A ticket is a small, official piece of paper or card which shows that you have paid to enter a place such as a theatre or a sports ground, or shows that you have paid for a journey.
A ticket is an official piece of paper which orders you to pay a fine or to appear in court because you have committed a driving or parking offence.
A ticket for a game of chance such as a raffle or a lottery is a piece of paper with a number on it. If the number on your ticket matches the number chosen, you win a prize.
The particular ticket on which a person fights an election is the party they represent or the policies they support.
A ticket is the list of candidates who are representing a particular political party or group in an election.

If you tilt an object or if it tilts, it moves into a sloping position with one end or side higher than the other.
If you tilt part of your body, usually your head, you move it slightly upwards or to one side.
If a person or thing tilts towards a particular opinion or if something tilts them towards it, they change slightly so that they become more in agreement with that opinion or position.
The tilt of something is the fact that it tilts or slopes, or the angle at which it tilts or slopes.

In sports and informal situations, if you decide something by tossing a coin, you spin a coin into the air and guess which side of the coin will face upwards when it lands.
The toss is a way of deciding something, such as who is going to go first in a game, that consists of spinning a coin into the air and guessing which side of the coin will face upwards when it lands.
But the dolphin opened her mouth and tossed her head.

You can use total to emphasize that something is as great in extent, degree, or amount as it possibly can be.

To touch something means to strike it, usually quite gently.
If something has not been touched, nobody has dealt with it or taken care of it.
If you say that you did not touch someone or something, you are emphasizing that you did not attack, harm or destroy them, especially when you have been accused of doing so.
You say that you never touch something or that you have not touched something for a long time to emphasize that you never use it, or you have not used it for a long time.

A tour is a journey during which you visit several places that interest you.
A tour is a short trip that you make round a place, for example round a historical building, so that you can look at it.
When people such as musicians, politicians, or theatre companies tour, they go on a tour, for example in order to perform or to meet people.

Someone or something that towers over surrounding people or things is a lot taller than they are.
If you refer to someone as a tower of strength, you appreciate them because they give you a lot of help, support, and encouragement when you have problems or are in a difficult situation.

Railway tracks are the rails that a train travels along.
In a school, a track is a group of children of the same age and ability who are taught together.
If you track animals or people, you try to follow them by looking for the signs that they have left behind, for example the marks left by their feet.
To track someone or something means to follow their movements by means of a special device, such as a satellite or radar.
A trader is a person whose job is to trade in goods or stocks.\n

A tradition is a custom or belief that has existed for a long time.\nIf you say that something or someone is in the tradition of a person or thing from the past, you mean that they have many features that remind you of that person or thing.\n
Traditional customs, beliefs, or methods are ones that have existed for a long time without changing.\nA traditional organization or person prefers older methods and ideas to modern ones.\n

Traffic refers to all the vehicles that are moving along the roads in a particular area.
Traffic refers to the movement of ships, trains, or aircraft between one place and another. Traffic also refers to the people and goods that are being transported.
Traffic in something such as drugs or stolen goods is an illegal trade in them.
Someone who traffics in something such as drugs or stolen goods buys and sells them even though it is illegal to do so.
to buy and sell something, especially drugs or weapons, illegally\n

A trail is a rough path across open country or through forests.
A trail is a route along a series of paths or roads, often one that has been planned and marked out for a particular purpose.
A trail is a series of marks or other signs of movement or other activities left by someone or something.
You can refer to all the places that a politician visits in the period before an election as their campaign trail.
If you trail someone or something, you follow them secretly, often by finding the marks or signs that they have left.
If you trail something or it trails, it hangs down loosely behind you as you move along.
She trailed her hand through the water.
if somebody's speech trails away/off, it gradually becomes quieter and then stops\n

A trailer is the long rear section of a lorry or truck, in which the goods are carried.
A trailer is a long vehicle without an engine which people use as a home or as an office and which can be pulled behind a car.
A trailer for a film or television programme is a set of short extracts which are shown to advertise it.

A train is a number of carriages, cars, or trucks which are all connected together and which are pulled by an engine along a railway. Trains carry people and goods from one place to another.
A train of vehicles, people, or animals is a long line of them travelling slowly in the same direction.
A train of thought or a train of events is a connected sequence, in which each thought or event seems to occur naturally or logically as a result of the previous one.
If someone trains you to do something, they teach you the skills that you need in order to do it. If you train to do something, you learn the skills that you need in order to do it.
To train a natural quality or talent that someone has, for example their voice or musical ability, means to help them to develop it.
If you train for a physical activity such as a race or if someone trains you for it, you prepare for it by doing particular physical exercises.

A tramp is a person who has no home or job, and very little money. Tramps go from place to place, and get food or money by asking people or by doing casual work.

If someone refers to a woman as a tramp, they are insulting her, because they think that she is immoral in her sexual behaviour.
If you tramp somewhere, you walk there slowly and with regular, heavy steps, for a long time.

To trample on someone's rights or values or to trample them means to deliberately ignore them.
If someone is trampled, they are injured or killed by being stepped on by animals or by other people.
If someone tramples something or tramples on it, they step heavily and carelessly on it and damage it.

If you transfer something or someone from one place to another, or they transfer from one place to another, they go from the first place to the second.
If something is transferred, or transfers, from one person or group of people to another, the second person or group gets it instead of the first.
In professional sports, if a player transfers or is transferred from one club to another, they leave one club and begin playing for another.
If you are transferred, or if you transfer, to a different job or place, you move to a different job or start working in a different place.
A translation is a piece of writing or speech that has been translated from a different language.\n

voca.means_en:
The transmission of something is the passing or sending of it to a different person or place.
The transmission of television or radio programmes is the broadcasting of them.
A transmission is a broadcast.
The transmission on a car or other vehicle is the system of gears and shafts by which the power from the engine reaches and turns the wheels.
a measure of the ability of a material to transmit radiation, equal to the internal transmittance of the material under conditions in which the path of the radiation has unit length\n

voca.means_en:
A trap is a device which is placed somewhere or a hole which is dug somewhere in order to catch animals or birds.
A trap is a trick that is intended to catch or deceive someone.
A trap is an unpleasant situation that you cannot easily escape from.
If a person traps animals or birds, he or she catches them using traps.
If you trap someone into doing or saying something, you trick them so that they do or say it, although they did not want to.
To trap someone, especially a criminal, means to capture them.
A trapeze is a bar of wood or metal hanging from two ropes on which people in a circus swing and perform skilful movements.\n

[튜롸블]

여행, 출장, 이동, 기행문
voca.means_en:
If you travel, you go from one place to another, often to a place that is far away.
If you travel the world, the country, or the area, you go to many different places in the world or in a particular country or area.
When light or sound from one place reaches another, you say that it travels to the other place.
When news becomes known by people in different places, you can say that it travels to them.
Travel is the activity of travelling.
Someone's travels are the journeys that they make to places a long way from their home.
Treachery is behaviour or an action in which someone betrays their country or betrays a person who trusts them.\n

voca.means_ko: 걷다, 걸음을 옮기다, 밟다, (새) 교미하다\n밟기, 걷기, 발자국, 족적, (새) 교미
대우하다, 치료하다, 대접하다\n대접, 만족, 매우 잘

voca.means_en: The company treats alike their management staff.\n
The treetops are the top branches of the trees in a wood or forest.\n

If you tremble, you shake slightly because you are frightened or cold.
If something trembles, it shakes slightly.
If your voice trembles, it sounds unsteady and uncertain, usually because you are upset or nervous.
The ground trembled.

voca.means_ko: 재판, 시험, 실험, 시도\n재판의, 시험적으로 행해지는, 예선의
voca.means_en:
A trial is a formal meeting in a law court, at which a judge and jury listen to evidence and decide whether a person is guilty of a crime.
A trial is an experiment in which you test something by using it or doing it for a period of time to see how well it works. If something is on trial, it is being tested in this way.
If someone gives you a trial for a job, or if you are on trial, you do the job for a short period of time to see if you are suitable for it.
If you do something by trial and error, you try several different methods of doing it until you find the method that works properly.

A triangle is an object, arrangement, or flat shape with three straight sides and three angles.
The triangle is a musical instrument that consists of a piece of metal shaped like a triangle. You play it by hitting it with a short metal bar.
If you describe a group of three people as a triangle, you mean that they are all connected with each other in a particular situation, but often have different interests.

voca.means_en: Tribe is sometimes used to refer to a group of people of the same race, language, and customs, especially in a developing country. Some people disapprove of this use.\nYou can use tribe to refer to a group of people who are all doing the same thing or who all behave in the same way.\n

cheat / fool / deceive / betray / take in / trick / con
A trick is an action that is intended to deceive someone.
A trick is a clever or skilful action that someone does in order to entertain people.
A trick is a clever way of doing something.
If someone tricks you, they deceive you, often in order to make you do something.
said by children who visit people's houses at Halloween (= October 31) and threaten to play tricks on people who do not give them sweets/candy\n
If you describe a task or problem as tricky, you mean that it is difficult to do or deal with.\nIf you describe a person as tricky, you mean that they are likely to deceive you or cheat you.\n

voca.means_en:
Something that is trim is neat, tidy, and attractive.
If you describe someone's figure as trim, you mean that it is attractive because there is no extra fat on their body.
If you trim something, for example someone's hair, you cut off small amounts of it in order to make it look neater and tidier.
If a government or other organization trims something such as a plan, policy, or amount, they reduce it slightly in extent or size.
If something such as a piece of clothing is trimmed with a type of material or design, it is decorated with it, usually along its edges.
The trim on something such as a piece of clothing is a decoration, for example along its edges, that is in a different colour or material.
to become, or to make something, smaller in size\n
to cut off a small part of something because it is not needed\n

trip / journey / tour / expedition / excursion / outing / day out
A trip is a journey that you make to a particular place.
If you say that someone is, for example, on a power trip, a guilt trip, or a nostalgia trip, you mean that their behaviour is motivated by power, guilt, or nostalgia.
A trip is an experience that someone has when their mind is affected by a drug such as LSD.
If you trip when you are walking, you knock your foot against something and fall or nearly fall.
If you trip someone who is walking or running, you put your foot or something else in front of them, so that they knock their own foot against it and fall or nearly fall.
to fall or almost fall because you have accidentally hit your foot against something while you are walking or running\n

to fall or almost fall because you have accidentally hit your foot against something while walking or running; to make somebody fall or almost fall by catching their foot while they are walking or running\nto make a mistake; to deliberately make somebody do this\n

Triple means consisting of three things or parts.
If something triples or if you triple it, it becomes three times as large in size or number.
If something is triple the amount or size of another thing, it is three times as large.
Triplets are three children born at the same time to the same mother.\n
A tripod is a stand with three legs that is used to support something such as a camera or a telescope.\n
If you describe something as trivial, you think that it is unimportant and not serious.\n
